item.name: Argent Lily
entries: A small but resilient flower growing in harsh cold climates like mountaintops or the Argent sword. Its six-petaled blossom has a bright sheen to it.

item.name: Black Willow
entries: A crooked-trunked tree native to the Blood Marshes and the Haghome Peninsula, known for its black, almost tar-like sap.

item.name: Blood Rose
entries: A legendary flower said to grow on the sites of great battles or the graves of heroes. It is said to bloom only once offered a few drops of heroic blood.

item.name: Death Cap
entries: A small white mushroom with a grey cap, found in increasing numbers around the now undead-infested Heartlands, as well as other places where undead roam or that have a strong connection to the Shadowfell.

item.name: Nostrian Palm
entries: A tall but slender palm tree that, despite its name, can be found along most of the Southern coastline of Ishiir.

item.name: Seed of Life
entries: A seed from Yggdrasil, the first tree, which is said to stand somewhere in the Feywild.
Even holding this tiny simple-looking seed is said to grant warmth and hope, and ward off illness.

item.name: Sylvan Apple
entries: An extremely rare fruit of luminescent golden color from the Feywild. The few trees carrying it are often found on sites of power or in the gardens of powerful fey nobles.

item.name: Sylvan Berry
entries: A pinkish bulbous berry rich with juices. Common in the Feywild, sometimes carried by fey travelling the material plane as well places that have a close connection to the Feywild, such as the island of Amaned'Anar.

item.name: Sylvan Lotus
entries: An elegant water plant with petals of iridescent color that is native to the Feywild. It's popular with Fey and Elvish nobles alike.

item.name: Sylvan Pepper
entries: A spicy-sweet pepper plant of garish color whose fruit is infamous for its unpredictable side effects.

item.name: Sylvan Plum
entries: A purplish very sweet fruit growing on certain trees in the Feywild. Its stone is said to be harder than steel.

item.name: Acid Vial
entries: As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can splash the contents of this vial onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw the vial up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. In either case, make a ranged attack against a creature or object, treating the acid as an improvised weapon. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d6} acid damage.

item.name: Alchemist's Fire
entries: This sticky, adhesive fluid ignites when exposed to air. As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can throw this flask up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. Make a ranged attack against a creature or object, treating the alchemist's fire as an improvised weapon. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d4} fire damage at the start of each of its turns. A creature can end this damage by using its action to make a DC 10 Dexterity check to extinguish the flames.

item.name: Potion of Animal Friendship
entries: When you drink this potion, you can cast the {@spell Animal Friendship|Ishiir} spell (save DC 13) for 1 hour at will. Agitating this muddy liquid brings little bits into view: a fish scale, a hummingbird tongue, a cat claw, or a squirrel hair.

item.name: Blasting Powder
entries: This volatile alchemical powder comes in a small pouch. When ignited by an open flame or a fuse, the powder explodes. Each creature within 5 feet of the exploding pouch must make a DC 13 Dexterity {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, taking {@damage 3d6} bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

A character can bind multiple pouches of blasting powder together so they explode at the same time. Each additional pouch increases the damage by {@dice 1d6} (maximum of {@dice 10d6}) and the blast radius by 5 feet (maximum of 20 feet).

item.name: Potion of Water Breathing
entries: You can breathe underwater for 1 hour after drinking this potion. Its cloudy green fluid smells of the sea and has a jellyfish-like bubble floating in it.

item.name: Philter of Love
entries: The next time you see a creature within 10 minutes after drinking this philter, you become {@condition Charmed|Ishiir} by that creature for 1 hour. If the creature is of a species and gender you are normally attracted to, you regard it as your true love while you are {@condition Charmed|Ishiir}. This potion's rose-hued, effervescent liquid contains one easy-to-miss bubble shaped like a heart.

item.name: Potion of Climbing
entries: When you drink this potion, you gain a {@variantrule Climb Speed|Ishiir} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} for 1 hour. During this time, you have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on Strength ({@skill Athletics}) {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks} you make to climb. The potion is separated into brown, silver, and gray layers resembling bands of stone. Shaking the bottle fails to mix the colors.

item.name: Potion of Mindreading
entries: When you drink this potion, you gain the effect of the {@spell Detect Thoughts|Ishiir} spell (save DC 13). The potion's dense, purple liquid has an ovoid cloud of pink floating in it.

item.name: Bottled Breath
entries: This bottle contains a breath of elemental air. When you inhale it, you either exhale it or hold it.

If you exhale the breath, you gain the effect of the {@spell Gust of Wind|Ishiir} spell. If you hold the breath, you don't need to breathe for 1 hour, though you can end this benefit early (for example, to speak). Ending it early doesn't give you the benefit of exhaling the breath.

item.name: Potion of Heroism
entries: For 1 hour after drinking it, you gain 10 temporary hit points that last for 1 hour. For the same duration, you are under the effect of the {@spell Bless|Ishiir} spell (no {@condition Concentration|Ishiir} required). This blue potion bubbles and steams as if boiling.

item.name: Potion of Invisibility
entries: This potion's container looks empty but feels as though it holds liquid. When you drink it, you become {@condition Invisible|Ishiir} for 1 hour. Anything you wear or carry is {@condition Invisible|Ishiir} with you. The effect ends early if you attack or cast a spell.

item.name: Soothsalt
entries: Soothsalts are derived from a naturally occurring crystalline substance discovered throughout the wilds of the Miskath Strand. The crimson crystals have been mined from cavernous veins like those in the mouth of the Miskath Pit and found within smaller geode formations near sites ravaged by the Calamity. Soothsalts are consumed orally in lozenge-sized doses, and frequent users can be identified by the telltale crimson stain around their mouths. A creature subjected to a dose of soothsalts gains {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on all Intelligence {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks} for {@dice 1d4} hours.

For each dose of soothsalts consumed, the creature must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or gain one level of {@condition Exhaustion|Ishiir}—an effect which is cumulative with multiple doses.

item.name: Potion of Clairvoyance
entries: When you drink this potion, you gain the effect of the {@spell Clairvoyance|Ishiir} spell. An eyeball bobs in this yellowish liquid but vanishes when the potion is opened.

item.name: Potion of Diminution
entries: When you drink this potion, you gain the "reduce" effect of the {@spell Enlarge/reduce|Ishiir} spell for {@dice 1d4} hours (no {@condition Concentration|Ishiir} required). The red in the potion's liquid continuously contracts to a tiny bead and then expands to color the clear liquid around it. Shaking the bottle fails to interrupt this process.

item.name: Potion of Draconic Breath
entries: After drinking this potion, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to exhale fire at a target within 30 feet of you. The target must make a DC 13 Dexterity {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, taking {@damage 4d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The effect ends after you exhale the fire three times or when 1 hour has passed. This potion's orange liquid flickers, and smoke fills the top of the container and wafts out whenever it is opened.

item.name: Potion of Growth
entries: When you drink this potion, you gain the "enlarge" effect of the {@spell Enlarge/reduce|Ishiir} spell for {@dice 1d4} hours (no {@condition Concentration|Ishiir} required). The red in the potion's liquid continuously expands from a tiny bead to color the clear liquid around it and then contracts. Shaking the bottle fails to interrupt this process.

item.name: Potion of Acid Resistance
entries: {#itemEntry Potion of Resistance}

item.name: Potion of Cold Resistance
entries: {#itemEntry Potion of Resistance}

item.name: Potion of Fire Resistance
entries: {#itemEntry Potion of Resistance}

item.name: Potion of Force Resistance
entries: {#itemEntry Potion of Resistance}

item.name: Potion of Gaseous Form
entries: When you drink this potion, you gain the effect of the {@spell Gaseous Form|Ishiir} spell for 1 hour (no {@condition Concentration|Ishiir} required) or until you end the effect as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}. This potion's container seems to hold fog that moves and pours like water.

item.name: Potion of Lightning Resistance
entries: {#itemEntry Potion of Resistance}

item.name: Potion of Necrotic Resistance
entries: {#itemEntry Potion of Resistance}

item.name: Potion of Poison Resistance
entries: {#itemEntry Potion of Resistance}

item.name: Potion of Psychic Resistance
entries: {#itemEntry Potion of Resistance}

item.name: Potion of Radiant Resistance
entries: {#itemEntry Potion of Resistance}

item.name: Potion of Speed
entries: When you drink this potion, you gain the effect of the {@spell Haste|Ishiir} spell for 1 minute (no {@condition Concentration|Ishiir} required). The potion's yellow fluid is streaked with black and swirls on its own.

item.name: Potion of Thunder Resistance
entries: {#itemEntry Potion of Resistance}

item.name: Oil of Slipperiness
entries: This sticky black unguent is thick and heavy in the container, but it flows quickly when poured. The oil can cover a Medium or smaller creature, along with the equipment it's wearing and carrying (one additional vial is required for each size category above Medium). Applying the oil takes 10 minutes. The affected creature then gains the effect of a {@spell Freedom of Movement|Ishiir} spell for 8 hours.

Alternatively, the oil can be poured on the ground as an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, where it covers a 10-foot square, duplicating the effect of the {@spell Grease|Ishiir} spell in that area for 8 hours.

item.name: Potion of Flying
entries: When you drink this potion, you gain a {@variantrule Fly Speed|Ishiir} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} for 1 hour and can hover. If you're in the air when the potion wears off, you fall unless you have some other means of staying aloft. This potion's clear liquid floats at the top of its container and has cloudy white impurities drifting in it.

item.name: Potion of Invisibility (Greater)
entries: This potion's container looks empty but feels as though it holds liquid. When you drink it, you become {@condition Invisible|Ishiir} for 1 hour. Anything you wear or carry is {@condition Invisible|Ishiir} with you. The effect ends early if you attack or cast a spell.

item.name: Potion of Strength
entries: When you drink this potion, your Strength score changes to 21 for 1 hour. The potion has no effect on you if your Strength is equal to or greater than that score.

item.name: Potion of Mind Control (Beast)
entries: When you drink a potion of mind control, you can cast a dominate spell (save DC 15) on a specific creature if you do so before the end of your next turn. If you don't, the potion is wasted.

A potion of mind control produces the effect of a {@spell Dominate Beast|Ishiir} spell. If the target's initial {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} fails, the effect lasts for 1 hour, with no {@condition Concentration|Ishiir} required on your part. The {@condition Charmed|Ishiir} creature has {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on new {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} to break the effect during this time.

item.name: Oil of Etherealness
entries: Beads of this cloudy gray oil form on the outside of its container and quickly evaporate. The oil can cover a Medium or smaller creature, along with the equipment it's wearing and carrying (one additional vial is required for each size category above Medium). Applying the oil takes 10 minutes. The affected creature then gains the effect of the {@spell Etherealness|Ishiir} spell for 1 hour.

item.name: Potion of Luck
entries: When you drink this clear potion, you gain two Fragments of Luck, each of which looks like a Tiny, grayish bead of energy that follows you around, staying within 1 foot of you at all times. Each fragment lasts for 8 hours or until used.

When you make an {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir}, an {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir}, or a {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, you can expend your fragment to roll an additional {@dice d20} and choose which of the {@dice d20}s to use. Alternatively, when an {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} is made against you, you can expend your fragment to roll a {@dice d20} and choose which of the {@dice d20}s to use, the one you rolled or the one the attacker rolled.

If the original {@dice d20} roll has {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} or {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir}, you roll your {@dice d20} after {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} or {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} has been applied to the original roll.
While you have one or more Fragments of Luck from this potion, you can't gain another Fragment of Luck from any source.

item.name: Potion of Mind Control (Monster)
entries: When you drink a potion of mind control, you can cast a dominate spell (save DC 15) on a specific creature if you do so before the end of your next turn. If you don't, the potion is wasted.

A potion of mind control produces the effect of a {@spell Dominate Monster|Ishiir} spell. If the target's initial {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} fails, the effect lasts for 1 hour, with no {@condition Concentration|Ishiir} required on your part. The {@condition Charmed|Ishiir} creature has {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on new {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} to break the effect during this time.

item.name: Potion of Strength (Greater)
entries: When you drink this potion, your Strength score changes to 23 for 1 hour. The potion has no effect on you if your Strength is equal to or greater than that score.

item.name: Potion of Aqueous Form
entries: When you drink this potion, you transform into a pool of water. You return to your true form after 10 minutes or if you are {@condition Incapacitated|Ishiir} or die.
You're under the following effects while in this form:

items.name: Liquid Movement
items.entry: You have a {@variantrule Swim Speed|Ishiir} of 30 feet. You can move over or through other liquids. You can enter and occupy the space of another creature. You can rise up to your normal height, and you can pass through even Tiny openings. You extinguish nonmagical flames in any space you enter.

items.name: Watery Resilience
items.entry: You have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to nonmagical damage. You also have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws}.

items.name: Limitations
items.entry: You can't talk, attack, cast spells, or activate magic items. Any objects you were carrying or wearing meld into your new form and are inaccessible, though you continue to be affected by anything you're wearing, such as armor.

item.name: Potion of Mind Control (Humanoid)
entries: When you drink a potion of mind control, you can cast a dominate spell (save DC 15) on a specific creature if you do so before the end of your next turn. If you don't, the potion is wasted.

A potion of mind control produces the effect of a {@spell Dominate Person|Ishiir} spell. If the target's initial {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} fails, the effect lasts for 1 hour, with no {@condition Concentration|Ishiir} required on your part. The {@condition Charmed|Ishiir} creature has {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on new {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} to break the effect during this time.

item.name: Potion of Power
entries: The first time you cast a damage-dealing spell of 4th level or lower within 1 minute after drinking the potion, instead of rolling dice to determine the damage dealt, you can instead use the highest number possible for each die.
This glowing purple liquid smells of sugar and plum, but it has a muddy taste.

item.name: Oil of Sharpness
entries: This clear, gelatinous oil sparkles with tiny, ultrathin silver shards. The oil can coat one slashing or piercing weapon or up to 5 pieces of slashing or piercing ammunition. Applying the oil takes 1 minute. For 1 hour, the coated item is magical and has a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls.

item.name: Potion of Strength (Superior)
entries: When you drink this potion, your Strength score changes to 25 for 1 hour. The potion has no effect on you if your Strength is equal to or greater than that score.

item.name: Potion of Invulnerability
entries: For 1 minute after you drink this potion, you have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to all damage. The potion's syrupy liquid looks like liquefied iron.

item.name: Potion of Strength (Supreme)
entries: When you drink this potion, your Strength score changes to 27 for 1 hour. The potion has no effect on you if your Strength is equal to or greater than that score.

item.name: Potion of Strength (Legendary)
entries: When you drink this potion, your Strength score changes to 29 for 1 hour. The potion has no effect on you if your Strength is equal to or greater than that score.

item.name: Potion of Dragon's Majesty
entries: This potion looks like liquid gold. When you drink this potion, you transform into an adult dragon of the same kind as the dragon the heart came from. The transformation lasts for 1 hour. Any equipment you are wearing or carrying melds into your new form or falls to the ground (your choice). For the duration, you use the game statistics of the adult dragon instead of your own, but you retain your languages, personality, and memories. You can't use a dragon's Change Shape or its legendary or lair actions.

item.name: Potion of Giant Size
entries: When you drink this potion, you become Huge for 24 hours if you are Medium or smaller, otherwise the potion does nothing. For that duration, your Strength becomes 25, if it isn't already higher, and your hit point maximum is doubled (your current hit points are doubled when you drink the potion). In addition, the reach of your melee attacks increases by 5 feet.

Everything you are carrying and wearing also increases in size for the duration. When rolling damage for weapons enlarged in this manner, roll three times the normal number of dice; for example, an enlarged longsword would deal {@damage 3d8} slashing damage (instead of {@dice 1d8}), or {@damage 3d10} slashing damage (instead of {@dice 1d10}) when used with two hands.

When the effect ends, any hit points you have above your hit point maximum become temporary hit points. This potion is a pale white liquid made from the tongue of a giant clam, with a pungent aroma akin to that of rotting algae. It tastes sweet, however, when consumed.

item.name: Arrow Catching
entries: {@i Requirement: Shields.}
You gain a +2 bonus to AC against ranged attacks while you wield the shield. This bonus is in addition to the shield's normal bonus to AC.
In addition, whenever an attacker makes a ranged attack against a target within 5 feet of you, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to become the target of the attack instead.

item.name: Symbiotic
entries: {@i Requirement: Armors.}
To attune to the armor, you must wear it for the entire attunement period, during which tendrils on the inside burrow into you.
While wearing it, you have a +1 bonus to Armor Class, and you have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to the following damage types: necrotic, poison, and psychic.

entries.name: Symbiotic Nature
entries: The armor can't be removed from you while you're attuned to it, and you can't voluntarily end your attunement to it. If you're targeted by a spell that ends a curse, your attunement to the armor ends, and it detaches from you.

item.name: Heart of the Mountain
entries: {@i Requirement: Heavy Armors.}

While wearing the armor, you gain a +3 bonus to AC, you are {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir|Immune} to fire damage, and you can understand and speak Primordial. In addition, you can stand on and walk across molten rock as if it were solid ground.

item.name: Invulnerability
entries: {@i Requirement: Heavy Armors.}

You have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to nonmagical damage while you wear the armor. Additionally, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to make yourself {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir|Immune} to nonmagical damage for 10 minutes or until you are no longer wearing the armor. Once this special action is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Alchemical Silver Coating
entries: {@i Requirement: Ammunition, Armors, Shields, Thrown, Weapons}

Undead and Lycanthropes that start their turn within 30 ft of someone wearing armor/shields with this property have to make a DC 14 WIS save or be {@condition Frightened|Ishiir} until the beginning of their next turn. They also take 5 poison (radiant for undead) damage when touching it.

Undead hit by weapons with this property grant {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} to the next {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} made against them. And any {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} or {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir} they have to the weapons damage type is ignored. Lycanthropes hit by weapons with this property have to make a DC14 CON {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or become {@condition Poisoned|Ishiir} (save repeats). Whenever they start their turn {@condition Poisoned|Ishiir} in this manner, they take 5 poison damage. They also take 5 poison (radiant for undead) dmg when touching it. Furthermore, any {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} or {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir} they have to the weapon's damage type is ignored.

If the coating is temporary, there is no bonus DC when applied during crafting and its value is 100gp. Furthermore, roll a d6 after each completed combat. On a 1 the coating has worn off and is no longer effective.

item.name: Cold Iron Coating
entries: {@i Requirement: Ammunition, Armors, Shields, Thrown, Weapons}

Fey that start their turn within 30 ft of someone wearing armor/shields with this property have to make a DC 14 WIS save or be {@condition Frightened|Ishiir} until the beginning of their next turn. They also take 5 poison damage when touching it.

Fey hit by weapons with this property have to make a DC14 CON {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or become {@condition Poisoned|Ishiir} (save repeats). Whenever they start their turn {@condition Poisoned|Ishiir} in this manner, they take 5 poison damage. They also take 5 poison dmg when touching it. Furthermore, any {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} or {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir} they have to the weapon's damage type is ignored.

If the coating is temporary, there is no bonus DC when applied during crafting and its value is 100gp. Furthermore, roll a {@dice d6} after each completed combat. On a 1 the coating has worn off and is no longer effective.

item.name: Projecting
entries: {@i Requirement: Armors.}

While wearing this armor, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to summon a projection of yourself in an unoccupied space within 30 feet of yourself. The projection is a translucent copy of you that has {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir} to all damage and conditions, and you can make attacks and cast spells with a range other than self as if standing in the projection's space. The projection disappears at the end of your turn. Once you use this {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Fungal
entries: {@i Requirement: Armors.}

While wearing this armor, you can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to make the armor emit poisonous spores, which fill a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on yourself. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or have the poisoned condition until the end of your next turn. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Mariner
entries: {@i Requirement: Armors.}

While wearing the armor, you have a {@variantrule Swim Speed|Ishiir} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir}. In addition, whenever you start your turn underwater with 0 hit points, the armor causes you to rise 60 feet toward the surface.

item.name: Weightlessness
entries: {@i Requirement: Armors.}

This armor has 5 charges. While you wear it, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to expend 1 or more charges to cast one of the following spells from the armor, targeting yourself: {@spell Jump|Ishiir} (1 charge) or {@spell Levitate|Ishiir} (2 charges).
This armor regains {@dice 1d4 + 1} expended charges daily at dawn.

item.name: Dreadful Communion
entries: {@i Requirement: Armors.}

While wearing this armor, you can use it to cast either {@spell Speak with Dead|Ishiir} or {@spell Animate Dead|Ishiir}. Once the armor has cast a spell in this way, it can't cast either spell until the next dawn.
Your soul keeps this armor together. If you die while you are attuned to the armor, the armor is destroyed.

item.name: Boomerang
entries: {@i Requirement: Shields.}

You can make a ranged weapon attack with this magic shield. It has a normal range of 20 feet and a long range of 60 feet, and it uses your Strength or Dexterity for the {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} (your choice). If you're {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir|proficient} with shields, you are {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir|proficient} with attacks made using this shield. On a hit, it deals {@damage 1d6} + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice) bludgeoning damage. If you throw the shield, it reappears in your hand the instant after it hits or misses a target.

item.name: Balance
entries: {@i Requirement: Armors.}
An armor with this property has 4 charges. You can use the charges in the following ways while wearing the armor:

items.name: Equalize
entries: When you or a creature you can see within 60 feet of yourself is about to roll a {@dice d20} with {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} or {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir}, you can expend 1 charge and take a {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to prevent the roll from being affected by {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} or {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir}.

items.name: Expunge Imbalance
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can expend 2 charges to cast the {@spell Lesser Restoration|Ishiir} spell from the armor.
The armor regains {@dice 1d4} expended charges daily at dawn.

item.name: Reliability
entries: {@i Requirement: Armors.}
The outside surface and internal joints of this armor whir with interlocking gears, drawing on the orderly magic of the plane of Mechanus.

The armor has 4 charges. If you make a {@dice d20} roll while wearing this armor, you can expend 1 charge to change the number rolled to a 10. The armor regains {@dice 1d4} expended charges daily at dawn.

item.name: Resistance
entries: {@i Requirement: Armors.}
The armor grants the wearer {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, force, lightning, necrotic, poison, psychic, radiant, or thunder.

item.name: Sentinel
entries: {@i Requirement:  Shields.}
While holding the shield, you have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on initiative rolls and Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks}.

item.name: Reinforced
entries: {@i Requirement: Armors, Shields.}
The armor/shield grants the wearer a +1 bonus to AC.

item.name: Gloomwrought
entries: {@i Requirement: Armors.}
While you're wearing this armor, you have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} you make to avoid or end the frightened condition on yourself.
This armor has 3 charges. You can expend a charge to cast the {@spell Calm Emotions|Ishiir} spell (save DC 15) from the armor. This armor regains {@dice 1d3} expended charges daily at dawn.

item.name: Dragonguard
entries: {@i Requirement: Armors.}
You have a +1 bonus to AC while wearing the armor.
It also grants its wearer {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} against the breath weapons of creatures that have the dragon type.

item.name: Battering
entries: {@i Requirement: Shields.}
While holding the shield, you gain a +1 bonus to AC. This bonus is in addition to the shield's normal bonus to AC.

Additionally, the shield has 3 charges, and it regains {@dice 1d3} expended charges daily at dawn. If you are holding the shield and push a creature within your reach at least 5 feet away, you can expend 1 charge to push that creature an additional 10 feet, knock it {@condition Prone|Ishiir}, or both.

item.name: Etherealness
entries: {@i Requirement: Armors.}

While you're wearing the armor, you can speak its command word as an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to gain the effect of the {@spell Etherealness|Ishiir} spell, which lasts for 10 minutes or until you remove the armor or use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to speak the command word again. This property can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Animated
entries: {@i Requirement: Shields.}

While holding the shield, you can speak its command word as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to cause it to animate. The shield leaps into the air and hovers in your space to protect you as if you were wielding it, leaving your hands free. The shield remains animated for 1 minute, until you use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to end this effect, or until you are {@condition Incapacitated|Ishiir} or die, at which point the shield falls to the ground or into your hand if you have one free.

item.name: Iron Will
entries: {@i Requirement: Armors, Shields.}
While wearing an armor/shield with this property, you have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws}.

item.name: Veil Warden
entries: {@i Requirement: Armors.}
You have a +1 bonus to AC while wearing the armor, which shimmers softly.

If you die while wearing the armor, it is destroyed, and each celestial, fey, and fiend within 30 feet of you must succeed on a DC 15 Charisma {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or be banished to its home plane of existence, unless it is already there.

item.name: Fiendish
entries: {@i Requirement: Armors.}

While wearing the armor, you gain a +1 bonus to AC, and you can understand and speak Abyssal. In addition, the armor's gauntlets turn {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|Ishiir|Unarmed Strikes} with your hands into magic weapons that deal slashing damage, with a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls and a damage die of {@dice 1d8}.

item.name: Mindshield
entries: {@i Requirement: Armors.}

The armor grants {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} and makes its wearer {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir|Immune} to the {@condition Frightened|Ishiir} condition.

item.name: Reverberating
entries: {@i Requirement: Shields.}

While wielding the shield, you have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to psychic and thunder damage. Also, when you take damage from a creature that is within 5 feet of you, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to deal {@damage 2d6} thunder damage to that creature.

As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can use the shield to help you locate Aberrations until the end of your next turn. If any Aberrations are within 1 mile of you, the shield emits a low humming tone for a moment, and you know the direction of all Aberrations within that range. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Antimagic Armor
entries: {@i Requirement: Armors.}

While wearing this armor, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to give yourself {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on a {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} you make against a spell. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.
In addition, while you wear this armor, you can use it to cast {@spell Antimagic Field|Ishiir}, requiring no spell components. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Spellguard
entries: {@i Requirement: Shields.}

While holding the shield, you have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} against spells and other magical effects, and spell attacks have {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} against you.

item.name: Monstrous Visage
entries: {@i Requirement: Shields.}
While wielding a shield with this property, you gain the following benefits:

items.name: Blessing of Euryale
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to poison damage and are {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir|Immune} to the petrified condition.

items.name: Petrifying Heraldry
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can make the front of the shield flare with a medusa's petrifying magic, causing the relief's eyes to glow brightly. Choose one creature you can see within 30 feet of you. The creature must succeed on a DC 20 Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, or it has the restrained condition as its body turns to stone. The restrained creature must make another DC 20 Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} at the start of its next turn. On a failed save, the creature has the petrified condition for 24 hours. On a successful save, the restrained condition ends. Once this {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

items.name: Spellcasting
entries: While wielding the shield, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to cast one of the following spells from it: {@spell Lesser Restoration|Ishiir}, {@spell Locate Creature|Ishiir}, {@spell Transport via Plants|Ishiir}. Once you use the shield to cast a spell, the shield can't cast that spell again until the next dawn.

item.name: Pocket Treat
entries: Your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} increases by 5.

item.name: Fistful o' Nuts
entries: When you receive healing, you regain 1 additional hitpoint for each die of healing. If the source of healing is a flat amount, you instead receive 1 additional hitpoint for each multiple of 5.

item.name: Pocket Bacon
entries: Your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} increases by 10.

item.name: Adventurer's Breakfast
entries: When you finish a rest, your hitpoint maximum increases by {@dice 2d4}.

item.name: Campfire Classic
entries: When you finish a rest, you regain one hit die.

item.name: Blockwurst
entries: All bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage you receive is reduced by an amount equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus, to a minimum of 0.

item.name: Jello Mounds
entries: When you finish a rest, your hitpoint maximum increases by {@dice 2d12}.

item.name: Bellywarmer Bowls
entries: When you finish a rest, you regain one hit die and you become acclimatized to extreme cold.

item.name: Daredevil's Disjune
entries: When you finish a rest, your hitpoint maximum increases by {@dice 2d6}. When you make a Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against becoming {@condition Frightened|Ishiir}, you roll a {@dice d4} and add it to the total.

item.name: Refreshing Salad
entries: When you finish a rest, you regain one hit die and you become acclimatized to extreme heat.

item.name: Traveler's Stew
entries: When you finish a rest, you regain one hit die and your travel speed increases by 5 miles.

item.name: Black Salt Bun
entries: If you currently suffer from a disease or levels of {@condition Exhaustion|Ishiir}, you do not suffer the effects of either until the start of your next turn.

item.name: Sylvan Candy
entries: You benefit from the effects of the {@spell Haste|Ishiir} spell. At the start of your next turn, you suffer the drawback of the {@spell Haste|Ishiir} spell.

item.name: Dragon Slice
entries: If you currently suffer from the {@condition Blinded|Ishiir} or {@condition Frightened|Ishiir} conditions, you do not suffer the effect of either condition until right after the start of your next turn.

item.name: Gelatinous Globule
entries: If you currently suffer from the {@condition Lacerated|Ishiir} or {@condition Poisoned|Ishiir} conditions, you do not suffer the effect of either condition until right after the start of your next turn.

item.name: Marbled Mouthful
entries: If you have temporary hitpoints and you take damage, any damage dealt to your temporary hitpoints is treated as if you had {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to that damage type.

item.name: Wayfarer's Special
entries: When you finish a rest, you regain two hit dice and your travel speed increases by 10 miles.

item.name: Ranger's Plate
entries: When you finish a rest, you regain three hit dice and your travel speed increases by 20 miles.

item.name: Reaper's Repast
entries: When you finish a rest, your hitpoint maximum increases by {@dice 2d4}. The first time you take damage that reduces you to 0 hp, you are reduced to 1 hp instead if the damage you took was equal or less than your character level + your Constitution score.

item.name: Mystery Soup
entries: When you finish a rest, you regain two hit dice. When you make an Intelligence {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, you roll a {@dice d4} and add it to the total.

item.name: Eyes for the Insides
entries: You gain truesight.

item.name: Dragon Roll
entries: You gain another {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} and you automatically succeed on {@condition Concentration|Ishiir} {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws}.

item.name: Pixie Platter
entries: When you finish a rest, you regain two hit dice. When you make a Dexterity {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, you roll a {@dice d4} and add it to the total.

item.name: Veggie Fry-up
entries: When you finish a rest, you regain two hit dice. When you make a Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, you roll a {@dice d4} and add it to the total.

item.name: Breakfast of Champions
entries: When you finish a rest, your hitpoint maximum increases by {@dice 2d8}. When you make a Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, you roll a {@dice d4} and add it to the total.

item.name: Dragon Skewers
entries: When you finish a rest, you regain three hit dice. When you make a Strength or Charisma {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, you roll a {@dice d4} and add it to the total.

item.name: Dragon Feast
entries: When you finish a rest, you regain five hit dice. When you make a {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, you roll a {@dice d4} and add it to the total.

item.name: Hook of Fisher's Delight
entries: This tiny silver fishhook has a little gold feather attached to it. For it to function, the feathered hook must be tied to the end of a fishing line and immersed in enough water to fill at least a 10-foot cube. At the end of each uninterrupted hour of immersion, roll a {@dice d6}. On a 6, a floppy, 6-inch-long magical fish appears on the end of the hook. The color and properties of the conjured fish are determined by rolling on the Hook of Fisher's Delight table. Once the hook conjures a fish, it can't do so again until the next dawn.

entries.caption: Hook of Fisher's Delight
rows: This tasty fish provides a day's worth of nourishment to one creature that eats it. The fish loses this property and rots if it's not eaten within 24 hours of being caught.

Once removed from the hook, this awful-tasting fish can be thrown up to 120 feet, targeting a creature the thrower can see. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Strength {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or be knocked {@condition Prone|Ishiir}. The fish then disappears.

When released from the hook, this fish squirms free, sprouts wings, follows you around, and sings a beautiful tune in Aquan. It disappears after {@dice 2d4} hours or when reduced to 0 hit points. The fish uses the {@creature quipper} stat block, except that it can breathe air and has a {@variantrule Fly Speed|Ishiir} of 30 feet.

This tasty fish provides a day's worth of nourishment to one creature that eats it and grants {@dice 2d10} temporary hit points to that creature. The fish loses these properties and rots if it's not eaten within 24 hours of being caught.

item.name: Lantern of Warning
entries: This hooded lantern burns for 6 hours on 1 pint of oil, shedding bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet.

Each lantern of tracking is designed to track down a certain type of creature, which is determined by rolling on the Lantern of Tracking table. Once determined, this creature type can't be changed. While the lantern is within 300 feet of any creature of that type, its flame turns bright green. The lantern doesn't pinpoint the creature's exact location, however.

item.name: Cleansing Stone
entries: A cleansing stone is a sphere 1 foot in diameter, engraved with mystic sigils. When touching the stone, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to activate it and remove dirt and grime from your garments and your person.
Such stones are often embedded in pedestals in public squares in Aundair or in high-end Ghallanda inns.

item.name: Spellshard
entries: This polished Eberron dragonshard fits in the hand and stores information similar to a book. The shard can hold the equivalent of one book that's no more than 320 pages long. A shard can be created blank or already filled with information. When the shard is created, the creator can set a passphrase that must be spoken to access the information stored within.

While holding the shard, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to open your mind to the shard, seeing its content in your mind. On subsequent rounds, reading the text or scribing new text on blank "pages" in the shard requires {@condition Concentration|Ishiir} (as if concentrating on a spell) and takes the same amount of time it takes you to read and write normally. Thinking of a particular phrase or topic draws you to the first section in the shard that addresses it.
A wizard can use a spellshard as a spellbook, with the usual cost in gold and time to "scribe" a spell into the shard.

item.name: Keycharm
item.reqAttune: by a creature with the Mark of Warding
entries: This small stylized key plays a vital role in the work of House Kundarak. If you cast the {@spell Alarm|Ishiir}, {@spell Arcane Lock|Ishiir}, or {@spell Glyph of Warding|Ishiir} spell, you can tie the effect to the keycharm so that whoever holds it receives the notification from the {@spell Alarm|Ishiir} spell, bypasses the lock of the {@spell Arcane Lock|Ishiir} spell, or avoids triggering the glyph placed by the {@spell Glyph of Warding|Ishiir} spell. In addition, the holder (who needn't be attuned to the item) can take an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to end any one spell tied to it, provided the holder knows the command word you set for ending the tied spells. The keycharm can have up to three tied spells at one time.

item.name: Beastskin Tattoo
entries: This tattoo depicts protective imagery and uses ink that resembles liquid metal. While you aren't wearing armor, the tattoo grants you an Armor Class of 12 + your Dexterity modifier. You can use a shield and still gain this benefit.

entries.name: Tattoo Attunement
entries: To attune to this item, you hold the needle to your skin where you want the tattoo to appear, pressing the needle there throughout the attunement process. When the attunement is complete, the needle turns into the ink that becomes the tattoo, which appears on the skin. If you have multiple magic tattoos, they count as a single magic item with regard to the number of magic items you can attune to.
If your attunement to the tattoo ends, the tattoo vanishes, and the needle reappears in the closest unoccupied space to you.

item.name: Ghostscribe Tattoo
entries: Produced by a special needle, this magic tattoo features beautiful calligraphy, images of writing implements, and the like.

entries.name: Tattoo Attunement
entries: To attune to this item, you hold the needle to your skin where you want the tattoo to appear, pressing the needle there throughout the attunement process. When the attunement is complete, the needle turns into the ink that becomes the tattoo, which appears on the skin.
If your attunement to the tattoo ends, the tattoo vanishes, and the needle reappears in your space.

entries.name: Magical Scribing
entries: While this tattoo is on your skin, you can write with your fingertip as if it were an ink pen that never runs out of ink.

As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can touch a piece of writing up to one page in length and speak a creature's name. The writing becomes {@condition Invisible} to everyone other than you and the named creature for the next 24 hours. Either of you can dismiss the invisibility by touching the script (no action required). Once used, this action can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Glamerweave
entries: Glamerweave is clothing imbued with harmless illusory magic. While wearing these clothes, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to create a moving illusory pattern within the cloth. Alternatively, you can have the pattern rise from the cloth. For example, a glamerweave gown might be wreathed in harmless, illusory flames, while a glamerweave hat might have illusory butterflies fluttering around it.

When you make a Charisma ({@skill Performance}) or Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) check while wearing the glamerweave, you can roll a {@dice d4} and add the number rolled to the check. Once you use this property, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Masquerade Tattoo
entries: Produced by a special needle, this magic tattoo appears on your body as whatever you desire.

entries.name: Tattoo Attunement
entries: To attune to this item, you hold the needle to your skin where you want the tattoo to appear, pressing the needle there throughout the attunement process. When the attunement is complete, the needle turns into the ink that becomes the tattoo, which appears on the skin.
If your attunement to the tattoo ends, the tattoo vanishes, and the needle reappears in your space.

entries.name: Fluid Ink
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can shape the tattoo into any color or pattern and move it to any area of your skin. Whatever form it takes, it is always obviously a tattoo. It can range in size from no smaller than a copper piece to an intricate work of art that covers all your skin.

entries.name: Disguise Self
entries: As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can use the tattoo to cast the {@spell Disguise Self|Ishiir} spell (DC 13 to discern the disguise). Once the spell is cast from the tattoo, it can't be cast from the tattoo again until the next dawn.

item.name: Dust of Disappearance
entries: Found in a small packet, this powder resembles very fine sand. There is enough of it for one use. When you use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to throw the dust into the air, you and each creature and object within 10 feet of you become {@condition Invisible} for {@dice 2d4} minutes. The duration is the same for all subjects, and the dust is consumed when its magic takes effect. If a creature affected by the dust attacks or casts a spell, the invisibility ends for that creature.

item.name: Pearl of Undead Detection
entries: This black pearl glows faintly when undead are within 120 feet of it.

item.name: Quaal's Feather Token: Tree
entries: This tiny object looks like a feather. Different types of feather tokens exist, each with a different single-use effect.

entries.name: Tree
entries: You must be outdoors to use this token. You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to touch it to an unoccupied space on the ground. The token disappears, and in its place a nonmagical oak tree springs into existence. The tree is 60 feet tall and has a 5-foot-diameter trunk, and its branches at the top spread out in a 20-foot radius.

item.name: Shiftweave
entries: When a suit of shiftweave is created, up to five different outfits can be embedded into the cloth. While wearing the clothing, you can speak its command word as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to transform your outfit into your choice of one of the other designs contained within it. Regardless of its appearance, the outfit can't be anything but clothing. Although it can duplicate the look of other magical clothing, it doesn't gain their magical properties.

item.name: Wraps of Light
entries: You may change your unarmed or natural weapon damage type to radiant.
{@b Masterwork}: When the effect of this item is activated, you deal an additional 1 Radiant damage.

item.name: Amulet of Protection from Turning
entries: While you wear this amulet of silver and turquoise, you have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} against effects that turn undead.

If you fail a {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against such an effect, you can choose to succeed instead. You can do so three times, and expended uses recharge daily at dawn. Each time an effect that turns undead is used against you, the amulet glows with silvery blue light for a few seconds.

item.name: Chest of Preserving
entries: Food and other perishable items do not age or decay while inside a Chest of Preserving. The chest is 2½ feet long, 1½ feet wide, and 1 foot tall with a half-barrel lid. The chest has a lock, which can be picked with {@item thieves' tools|PHB} and a successful DC 15 Dexterity check. Smashing the lock or any other part of the chest renders it nonmagical.

item.name: Enchanted Cauldron
entries: This cauldron is made of thick copper that has turned green with age. It is 4 feet wide, has a mouth 3½ feet in diameter, weighs 50 pounds, and can hold up to 30 gallons of liquid. Embossed on its bulging sides are images of satyrs and nymphs in repose, holding ladles. The cauldron comes with a lid and has side handles. It sits on five little clawed feet that keep it from tipping.

If water is poured into the cauldron and stirred for 1 minute, it transforms into a hearty, hot stew, which can provide one nourishing meal for up to four people per gallon. The stew remains hot while in the cauldron, then cools naturally after it is removed. The outside of the cauldron remains safe to touch despite the heat of the stew.
The cauldron can create stew three times. It then ceases to function until the next dawn, when it regains all its uses.

item.name: Seed of Counsel
entries: You can cast {@spell Guidance|Ishiir} with this amber-encased seed up to three times a day.
{@b Masterwork}: You can use this item up to four times a day instead.

item.name: Wind Fan
entries: While holding this fan, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to cast the {@spell Gust of Wind|Ishiir} spell (save DC 13) from it. Once used, the fan shouldn't be used again until the next dawn. Each time it is used again before then, it has a cumulative {@chance 20} chance of not working and tearing into useless, nonmagical tatters.

item.name: Bag of Tricks, Gray
entries: This ordinary bag, made from gray cloth, appears empty. Reaching inside the bag, however, reveals the presence of a small, fuzzy object.

You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to pull the fuzzy object from the bag and throw it up to 20 feet. When the object lands, it transforms into a creature you determine by rolling a {@dice d8} and consulting the table. The creature vanishes at the next dawn or when it is reduced to 0 hit points.

The creature is friendly to you and your companions, and it acts on your turn. You can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to command how the creature moves and what action it takes on its next turn, or to give it general orders, such as to attack your enemies. In the absence of such orders, the creature acts in a fashion appropriate to its nature.
Once three fuzzy objects have been pulled from the bag, the bag can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Bag of Tricks, Rust
entries: This ordinary bag, made from rust cloth, appears empty. Reaching inside the bag, however, reveals the presence of a small, fuzzy object.

You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to pull the fuzzy object from the bag and throw it up to 20 feet. When the object lands, it transforms into a creature you determine by rolling a {@dice d8} and consulting the table. The creature vanishes at the next dawn or when it is reduced to 0 hit points.

The creature is friendly to you and your companions, and it acts on your turn. You can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to command how the creature moves and what action it takes on its next turn, or to give it general orders, such as to attack your enemies. In the absence of such orders, the creature acts in a fashion appropriate to its nature.
Once three fuzzy objects have been pulled from the bag, the bag can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Bag of Tricks, Tan
entries: This ordinary bag, made from tan cloth, appears empty. Reaching inside the bag, however, reveals the presence of a small, fuzzy object.

You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to pull the fuzzy object from the bag and throw it up to 20 feet. When the object lands, it transforms into a creature you determine by rolling a {@dice d8} and consulting the table. The creature vanishes at the next dawn or when it is reduced to 0 hit points.

The creature is friendly to you and your companions, and it acts on your turn. You can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to command how the creature moves and what action it takes on its next turn, or to give it general orders, such as to attack your enemies. In the absence of such orders, the creature acts in a fashion appropriate to its nature.
Once three fuzzy objects have been pulled from the bag, the bag can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Ring of Feather Falling
entries: When you fall while wearing this ring, you descend 60 feet per round and take no damage from falling.

item.name: Alchemy Jug
entries: This ceramic jug appears to be able to hold a gallon of liquid and weighs 12 pounds whether full or empty. Sloshing sounds can be heard from within the jug when it is shaken, even if the jug is empty.

You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} and name one liquid from the table below to cause the jug to produce the chosen liquid. Afterward, you can uncork the jug as an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} and pour that liquid out, up to 2 gallons per minute. The maximum amount of liquid the jug can produce depends on the liquid you named.
Once the jug starts producing a liquid, it can't produce a different one, or more of one that has reached its maximum, until the next dawn.

item.name: Amulet of the Drunkard
entries: This amulet smells of old, ale-stained wood. While wearing it, you can regain {@dice 4d4 + 4} hit points when you drink a pint of beer, ale, mead, or wine. Once the amulet has restored hit points, it can't do so again until the next dawn.

item.name: Boots of Elvenkind
entries: While you wear these boots, your steps make no sound, regardless of the surface you are moving across. You also have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks} that rely on moving silently.

item.name: Circlet of Human Perfection
entries: The Circlet of Human Perfection transforms its attuned wearer into an attractive human of average height and weight. The circlet chooses the physical characteristics of the form, such as age, gender, skin color, hair color, and voice. Except for size, the wearer's statistics and racial traits don't change, nor do items worn or carried by the wearer. Removing the circlet ends the effect.

item.name: Decanter of Endless Water
entries: This stoppered flask sloshes when shaken, as if it contains water. The decanter weighs 2 pounds.

You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to remove the stopper and speak one of three command words, whereupon an amount of fresh water or salt water (your choice) pours out of the flask. The water stops pouring out at the start of your next turn. Choose from the following options:

items: "Stream" produces 1 gallon of water.
"Fountain" produces 5 gallons of water.

"Geyser" produces 30 gallons of water that gushes forth in a geyser 30 feet long and 1 foot wide. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} while holding the decanter, you can aim the geyser at a creature you can see within 30 feet of you. The target must succeed on a DC 13 Strength {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or take {@damage 1d4} bludgeoning damage and fall {@condition Prone|Ishiir}. Instead of a creature, you can target an object that isn't being worn or carried and that weighs no more than 200 pounds. The object is either knocked over or pushed up to 15 feet away from you.

item.name: Dust of Sneezing and Choking
entries: Found in a small container, this powder resembles very fine sand. It appears to be {@item dust of disappearance}, and an {@spell Identify|Ishiir} spell reveals it to be such. There is enough of it for one use.

When you use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to throw a handful of the dust into the air, you and each creature that needs to breathe within 30 feet of you must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or become unable to breathe while sneezing uncontrollably. A creature affected in this way is {@condition Incapacitated|Ishiir} and suffocating. As long as it is conscious, a creature can repeat the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on it on a success. The {@spell Lesser Restoration|Ishiir} spell can also end the effect on a creature.

item.name: Eyes of the Eagle
entries: These crystal lenses fit over the eyes. While wearing them, you have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks} that rely on sight. In conditions of clear visibility, you can make out details of even extremely distant creatures and objects as small as 2 feet across.

item.name: Gloves of Missile Snaring
entries: These gloves seem to almost meld into your hands when you don them. When a ranged weapon attack hits you while you're wearing them, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to reduce the damage by {@dice 1d10} + your Dexterity modifier, provided that you have a free hand. If you reduce the damage to 0, you can catch the missile if it is small enough for you to hold in that hand.

item.name: Immovable Rod
entries: This flat iron rod has a button on one end. You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to press the button, which causes the rod to become magically fixed in place. Until you or another creature uses an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to push the button again, the rod doesn't move, even if it is defying gravity. The rod can hold up to 8,000 pounds of weight. More weight causes the rod to deactivate and fall. A creature can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to make a DC 30 Strength check, moving the fixed rod up to 10 feet on a success.

item.name: Naushindhor's Stone: Sustenance
entries: An {@italic Ioun stone} is named after Ioun, a god of knowledge and prophecy revered on some worlds. Many types of {@italic Ioun stone} exist, each type a distinct combination of shape and color.

When you use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to toss one of these stones into the air, the stone orbits your head at a distance of {@dice 1d3} feet and confers a benefit to you. Thereafter, another creature must use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to grasp or net the stone to separate it from you, either by making a successful {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} against AC 24 or a successful DC 24 Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check. You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to seize and stow the stone, ending its effect.
A stone has AC 24, 10 hit points, and {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to all damage. It is considered to be an object that is being worn while it orbits your head.
You don't need to eat or drink while this clear spindle orbits your head.

item.name: Quaal's Feather Token: Anchor
entries: This tiny object looks like a feather. Different types of feather tokens exist, each with a different single-use effect.

entries.name: Anchor
entries: You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to touch the token to a boat or ship. For the next 24 hours, the vessel can't be moved by any means. Touching the token to the vessel again ends the effect. When the effect ends, the token disappears.

item.name: Ring of Truth Telling
entries: While wearing this ring, you have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks} to determine whether someone is lying to you.

item.name: Rope of Climbing
entries: This 60-foot length of silk rope weighs 3 pounds and can hold up to 3,000 pounds. If you hold one end of the rope and use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to speak the command word, the rope animates. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can command the other end to move toward a destination you choose. That end moves 10 feet on your turn when you first command it and 10 feet on each of your turns until reaching its destination, up to its maximum length away, or until you tell it to stop. You can also tell the rope to fasten itself securely to an object or to unfasten itself, to knot or unknot itself, or to coil itself for carrying.

If you tell the rope to knot, large knots appear at 1-foot intervals along the rope. While knotted, the rope shortens to a 50-foot length and grants {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks} made to climb it.
The rope has AC 20 and 20 hit points. It regains 1 hit point every 5 minutes as long as it has at least 1 hit point. If the rope drops to 0 hit points, it is destroyed.

item.name: Thermal Cube
entries: This 3-inch cube of solid brimstone generates enough dry heat to keep the temperature within 15 feet of it at 95 degrees Fahrenheit (35 degrees Celsius).

item.name: Robe of Serpents
entries: A robe of serpents is a stylish silk garment that is popular among wealthy nobles and retired assassins. The robe is emblazoned with {@dice 1d4 + 3} stylized serpents, all brightly colored.

As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} on your turn, you can transform one of the robe's serpents into a {@creature giant poisonous snake}. The snake instantly falls from the robe, slithers into an unoccupied space next to you, and acts on your initiative count. The snake can tell friendly creatures from hostile ones and attacks the latter. The snake disappears in a harmless puff of smoke after 1 hour, when it drops to 0 hit points, or when you dismiss it (no action required). Once detached, a snake can't return to the robe. When all of the robe's snakes have detached, the robe becomes a nonmagical garment.

item.name: Balance of Harmony
entries: This scale bears celestial symbols on one pan and fiendish symbols on the other. You can use the scale to cast {@spell Detect Evil and Good|Ishiir} as a ritual. Doing so requires you to place the scale on a solid surface, then sprinkle the pans with holy water or place a transparent gem worth 100 gp in each pan. The scale remains motionless if it detects nothing, tips to one side or the other for good (consecrated) or evil (desecrated), and fluctuates slightly if it detects a creature appropriate to the spell but neither good nor evil. By touching the scales after casting the ritual, you instantly learn any information the spell can normally convey, and then the effect ends.

item.name: Cloak of Displacement
entries: While you wear this cloak, it projects an illusion that makes you appear to be standing in a place near your actual location, causing any creature to have {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} against you. If you take damage, the property ceases to function until the start of your next turn. This property is suppressed while you are {@condition Incapacitated|Ishiir}, {@condition Restrained|Ishiir}, or otherwise unable to move.
{@b Masterwork}: Additionally, you have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on Dexterity {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} against effects that target you.

item.name: Eyes of Charming
entries: These crystal lenses fit over the eyes. They have 3 charges. While wearing them, you can expend 1 charge as an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to cast the {@spell Charm Person|Ishiir} spell (save DC 13) on a humanoid within 30 feet of you, provided that you and the target can see each other. The lenses regain all expended charges daily at dawn.

item.name: Hat of Disguise
entries: While wearing this hat, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to cast the {@spell Disguise Self|Ishiir} spell from it at will. The spell ends if the hat is removed.

item.name: Mask of the Beast
entries: This wooden mask is shaped in the likeness of a beast's visage and has 3 charges. While wearing the mask you can expend 1 charge and use the mask to cast the {@spell Animal Friendship|Ishiir} spell as an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}. The mask regains all expended charges at dawn.

item.name: Pipes of the Sewers
entries: You must be {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir|proficient} with wind instruments to use these pipes. While you are attuned to the pipes, ordinary rats and giant rats are indifferent toward you and will not attack you unless you threaten or harm them.

The pipes have 3 charges. If you play the pipes as an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to expend 1 to 3 charges, calling forth one {@creature swarm of rats} with each expended charge, provided that enough rats are within half a mile of you to be called in this fashion (as determined by the DM). If there aren't enough rats to form a swarm, the charge is wasted. Called swarms move toward the music by the shortest available route but aren't under your control otherwise. The pipes regain {@dice 1d3} expended charges daily at dawn.

Whenever a {@creature swarm of rats} that isn't under another creature's control comes within 30 feet of you while you are playing the pipes, you can make a Charisma check contested by the swarm's Wisdom check. If you lose the contest, the swarm behaves as it normally would and can't be swayed by the pipes' music for the next 24 hours. If you win the contest, the swarm is swayed by the pipes' music and becomes friendly to you and your companions for as long as you continue to play the pipes each round as an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}. A friendly swarm obeys your commands. If you issue no commands to a friendly swarm, it defends itself but otherwise takes no actions. If a friendly swarm starts its turn and can't hear the pipes' music, your control over that swarm ends, and the swarm behaves as it normally would and can't be swayed by the pipes' music for the next 24 hours.

item.name: Ring of Obscuring
entries: This band of iron resembles a skull and is cold to the touch. It has 3 charges and regains {@dice 1d3} expended charges daily at dawn. As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} while wearing the ring, you can expend 1 of its charges to cast the {@spell Fog Cloud|Ishiir} spell from it, with the following changes: the cloud is centered on you when it first appears, and the spell lasts for 1 minute (no {@condition Concentration|Ishiir} required).

item.name: Ring of Puzzler's Wit
entries: This gold ring bears a fluorite stone and is enchanted to sharpen the wearer's mind.

The ring has 3 charges and regains {@dice 1d4 - 1} expended charges daily at dawn. When you make an Intelligence check, you can expend 1 charge to grant yourself {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on the check.

item.name: Rod of Retribution
entries: This adamantine rod is tipped with a glowing crystalline eye. The rod has 3 charges and regains all its expended charges daily at dawn.

When a creature you can see within 60 feet of you damages you while you are holding this rod, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to expend 1 of the rod's charges to force the creature to make a DC 13 Dexterity {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. The creature takes {@damage 2d10} lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

item.name: Wand of Magic Detection
entries: This wand has 3 charges. While holding it, you can expend 1 charge as an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to cast the {@spell Detect Magic|Ishiir} spell from it. The wand regains {@dice 1d3} expended charges daily at dawn.

item.name: Boots of Speed
entries: While you wear these boots, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} and click the boots' heels together. If you do, the boots double your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir}, and any creature that makes an opportunity attack against you has {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on the {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir}. If you click your heels together again, you end the effect.
When the boots' property has been used for a total of 10 minutes, the magic ceases to function until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

item.name: Eversmoking Bottle
entries: Smoke leaks from the lead-stoppered mouth of this brass bottle, which weighs 1 pound. When you use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to remove the stopper, a cloud of thick smoke pours out in a 60-foot radius from the bottle. The cloud's area is heavily obscured. Each minute the bottle remains open and within the cloud, the radius increases by 10 feet until it reaches its maximum radius of 120 feet.

The cloud persists as long as the bottle is open. Closing the bottle requires you to speak its command word as an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}. Once the bottle is closed, the cloud disperses after 10 minutes. A moderate wind (11 to 20 miles per hour) can also disperse the smoke after 1 minute, and a strong wind (21 or more miles per hour) can do so after 1 round.

item.name: Bag of Beans
entries: Inside this heavy cloth bag are {@dice 3d4} dry beans. The bag weighs ½ pound plus ¼ pound for each bean it contains.

If you dump the bag's contents out on the ground, they explode in a 10-foot radius, extending from the beans. Each creature in the area, including you, must make a DC 15 Dexterity {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, taking {@damage 5d4} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The fire ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

If you remove a bean from the bag, plant it in dirt or sand, and then water it, the bean produces an effect 1 minute later from the ground where it was planted. The DM can choose an effect from the following table, determine it randomly, or create an effect.

rows: {@dice 5d4} toadstools sprout. If a creature eats a toadstool, roll any die. On an odd roll, the eater must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or take {@damage 5d6} poison damage and become {@condition Poisoned|Ishiir} for 1 hour. On an even roll, the eater gains {@dice 5d6} temporary hit points for 1 hour.
A geyser erupts and spouts water, beer, berry juice, tea, vinegar, wine, or oil (DM's choice) 30 feet into the air for {@dice 1d12} rounds.
A {@creature treant} sprouts. There's a {@chance 50} chance that the treant is chaotic evil and attacks.

An animate, immobile stone statue in your likeness rises. It makes verbal threats against you. If you leave it and others come near, it describes you as the most heinous of villains and directs the newcomers to find and attack you. If you are on the same plane of existence as the statue, it knows where you are. The statue becomes inanimate after 24 hours.
A campfire with blue flames springs forth and burns for 24 hours (or until it is extinguished).

{@dice 1d4 + 8} bright pink toads crawl forth. Whenever a toad is touched, it transforms into a Large or smaller monster of the DM's choice. The monster remains for 1 minute, then disappears in a puff of bright pink smoke.
A hungry {@creature bulette} burrows up and attacks.

A fruit tree grows. It has {@dice 1d10 + 20} fruit, {@dice 1d8} of which act as randomly determined magic potions, while one acts as an ingested poison of the DM's choice. The tree vanishes after 1 hour. Picked fruit remains, retaining any magic for 30 days.

A nest of {@dice 1d4 + 3} eggs springs up. Any creature that eats an egg must make a DC 20 Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. On a successful save, a creature permanently increases its lowest ability score by 1, randomly choosing among equally low scores. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 10d6} force damage from an internal magical explosion.

A pyramid with a 60-foot-square base bursts upward. Inside is a sarcophagus containing a {@creature mummy lord}. The pyramid is treated as the {@creature mummy lord||mummy lord's} lair, and its sarcophagus contains treasure of the DM's choice.

A giant beanstalk sprouts, growing to a height of the DM's choice. The top leads where the DM chooses, such as to a great view, a {@creature cloud giant||cloud giant's} castle, or a different plane of existence.

item.name: Boots of Levitation
entries: While you wear these boots, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to cast the {@spell Levitate|Ishiir} spell on yourself at will.

item.name: Cap of Waterbreathing
entries: While wearing this cap underwater, you can speak its command word as an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to create a bubble of air around your head. It allows you to breathe normally underwater. This bubble stays with you until you speak the command word again, the cap is removed, or you are no longer underwater.

item.name: Emerald Pen
entries: This pen is tipped with an emerald nib and requires no ink to write. While holding this pen, you can cast {@spell Illusory Script|Ishiir} at will, requiring no material components.

item.name: Horseshoes of Speed
entries: These iron horseshoes come in a set of four. While all four shoes are affixed to the hooves of a horse or similar creature, they increase the creature's {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} by 30 feet.

item.name: Night Caller
entries: This whistle is carved from transparent crystal, and it resembles a tiny dragon curled up like a snail. The name Night Caller is etched on the whistle in Dwarvish runes. If a character succeeds on a DC 20 Intelligence ({@skill Arcana} or {@skill History}) check, the character recalls lore that says the {@creature duergar} made several such whistles for various groups in an age past.

If you blow the whistle in darkness or under the night sky, it allows you to cast the {@spell Animate Dead|Ishiir} spell. The target can be affected through up to 10 feet of soft earth or similar material, and if it is, it takes 1 minute to claw its way to the surface to serve you. Once the whistle has animated an undead creature, it can't do so again until 7 days have passed.
Once every 24 hours, you can blow the whistle to reassert control over one or two creatures you animated with it.

item.name: Periapt of Health
entries: You are {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir|Immune} to contracting any disease while you wear this pendant. If you are already infected with a disease, the effects of the disease are suppressed while you wear the pendant.

item.name: Quaal's Feather Token: Fan
entries: This tiny object looks like a feather. Different types of feather tokens exist, each with a different single-use effect.

entries.name: Fan
entries: If you are on a boat or ship, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to toss the token up to 10 feet in the air. The token disappears, and a giant flapping fan takes its place. The fan floats and creates a wind strong enough to fill the sails of one ship, increasing its speed by 5 miles per hour for 8 hours. You can dismiss the fan as an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}.

item.name: Ring of X-Ray Vision
entries: While wearing this ring, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to speak its command word. When you do so, you can see into and through solid matter for 1 minute. This vision has a radius of 30 feet. To you, solid objects within that radius appear transparent and don't prevent light from passing through them. The vision can penetrate 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, or up to 3 feet of wood or dirt. Thicker substances block the vision, as does a thin sheet of lead.

Whenever you use the ring again before taking a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}, you must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or gain one level of {@condition Exhaustion|Ishiir}.

item.name: Saddle of the Cavalier
entries: While in this saddle on a mount, you can't be dismounted against your will if you're conscious, and {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} against the mount have {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir}.

item.name: Staff of the Python
item.reqAttune: by a cleric, druid, or warlock
entries: You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to speak this staff's command word and throw the staff on the ground within 10 feet of you. The staff becomes a {@creature giant constrictor snake} under your control and acts on its own initiative count. By using a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to speak the command word again, you return the staff to its normal form in a space formerly occupied by the snake.

On your turn, you can mentally command the snake if it is within 60 feet of you and you aren't {@condition Incapacitated|Ishiir}. You decide what action the snake takes and where it moves during its next turn, or you can issue it a general command, such as to attack your enemies or guard a location.

If the snake is reduced to 0 hit points, it dies and reverts to its staff form. The staff then shatters and is destroyed. If the snake reverts to staff form before losing all its hit points, it regains all of them.

item.name: Tunnel Claws
entries: These heavy gauntlets of brown iron are forged in the shape of an {@creature umber hulk||umber hulk's} claws, and they fit the wearer's hands and forearms all the way up to the elbow. While wearing both claws, you gain a {@variantrule Burrow Speed|Ishiir} of 20 feet, and you can tunnel through solid rock at a rate of 1 foot per round.

You can use a claw as a melee weapon while wearing it. You have {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} with it, and it deals {@damage 1d8} slashing damage on a hit (your Strength modifier applies to the attack and damage rolls, as normal).
While wearing the claws, you can't manipulate objects or cast spells with somatic components.

item.name: Figurine of Wondrous Power: Onyx Dog
entries: A figurine of wondrous power is a statuette of a beast small enough to fit in a pocket. If you use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to speak the command word and throw the figurine to a point on the ground within 60 feet of you, the figurine becomes a living creature. If the space where the creature would appear is occupied by other creatures or objects, or if there isn't enough space for the creature, the figurine doesn't become a creature.
