The creature is friendly to you and your companions. It understands your languages and obeys your spoken commands. If you issue no commands, the creature defends itself but takes no other actions.

The creature exists for a duration specific to each figurine. At the end of the duration, the creature reverts to its figurine form. It reverts to a figurine early if it drops to 0 hit points or if you use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to speak the command word again while touching it. When the creature becomes a figurine again, its property can't be used again until a certain amount of time has passed, as specified in the figurine's description.
{@creature mastiff||Onyx Dog}.

This onyx statuette of a dog can become a {@creature mastiff} for up to 6 hours. The {@creature mastiff} has an Intelligence of 8 and can speak Common. It also has {@sense darkvision} out to a range of 60 feet and can see {@condition Invisible} creatures and objects within that range. Once it has been used, it can't be used again until 7 days have passed.

item.name: Ring of Jumping
entries: While wearing this ring, you can cast the {@spell Jump|Ishiir} spell from it as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} at will, but can target only yourself when you do so.

item.name: Dust of Dryness
entries: This small packet contains {@dice 1d6 + 4} pinches of dust. You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to sprinkle a pinch of it over water. The dust turns a cube of water 15 feet on a side into one marble-sized pellet, which floats or rests near where the dust was sprinkled. The pellet's weight is negligible.
Someone can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to smash the pellet against a hard surface, causing the pellet to shatter and release the water the dust absorbed. Doing so ends that pellet's magic.

An elemental composed mostly of water that is exposed to a pinch of the dust must make a DC 13 Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, taking {@damage 10d6} necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

item.name: Helm of the Pious
entries: While wearing this helm, you know whether there is a celestial or fiend within 30 feet of you, as well as where the creature is located, provided the creature isn't behind total cover.

Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir} while wearing the helm, you can pray to one of the gods listed on the Helm of the Gods table and store the listed spell in the helm, replacing any spell that is already stored there. The save DC for the spell is 13.
The helm has 3 charges. To cast a spell from the helm, you must expend 1 charge, and the helm regains {@dice 1d3} charges daily at dawn.

item.name: Quaal's Feather Token: Whip
entries: This tiny object looks like a feather. Different types of feather tokens exist, each with a different single-use effect.

entries.name: Whip
entries: You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to throw the token to a point within 10 feet of you. The token disappears, and a floating whip takes its place. You can then use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to make a melee spell attack against a creature within 10 feet of the whip, with an attack bonus of {@hit 9}. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d6 + 5} force damage.

As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} on your turn, you can direct the whip to fly up to 20 feet and repeat the attack against a creature within 10 feet of it. The whip disappears after 1 hour, when you use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to dismiss it, or when you are {@condition Incapacitated|Ishiir} or die.

item.name: Boots of Springing and Striding
entries: While you wear these boots, your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} becomes 30 feet, unless your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} is higher, and your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} isn't reduced if you are encumbered or wearing heavy armor. In addition, you can jump three times the normal distance, though you can't jump farther than your remaining movement would allow.

item.name: Amulet of Proof against Detection and Location
entries: While wearing this amulet, you are hidden from {@filter divination|spells|school=D|source=Ishiir} magic. You can't be targeted by such magic or perceived through magical scrying sensors.

item.name: Cloak of Elvenkind
entries: While you wear this cloak with its hood up, Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks} made to see you have {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir}, and you have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks} made to hide, as the cloak's color shifts to camouflage you. Pulling the hood up or down requires an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}.

item.name: Deceiver's Brooch
entries: While wearing this nondescript brooch, spells and anything else that would detect or reveal your creature type treat you as humanoid, and those that would reveal your alignment treat it as neutral.

item.name: Dragonscale Tattoo
entries: This tattoo depicts protective imagery and uses ink that resembles liquid metal. While you aren't wearing armor, the tattoo grants you an Armor Class of 15 + your Dexterity modifier (maximum of +2). You can use a shield and still gain this benefit.

entries.name: Tattoo Attunement
entries: To attune to this item, you hold the needle to your skin where you want the tattoo to appear, pressing the needle there throughout the attunement process. When the attunement is complete, the needle turns into the ink that becomes the tattoo, which appears on the skin. If you have multiple magic tattoos, they count as a single magic item with regard to the number of magic items you can attune to.
If your attunement to the tattoo ends, the tattoo vanishes, and the needle reappears in the closest unoccupied space to you.

item.name: Eyes of Minute Seeing
entries: These crystal lenses fit over the eyes. While wearing them, you can see much better than normal out to a range of 1 foot. You have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks} that rely on sight while searching an area or studying an object within that range.

item.name: Gloves of Thievery
entries: These gloves are {@condition Invisible} while worn. While wearing them, you gain a +5 bonus to Dexterity ({@skill Sleight of Hand}) {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks} and Dexterity {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks} made to pick locks.

item.name: Horn of Blasting
entries: You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to speak the horn's command word and then blow the horn, which emits a thunderous blast in a 30-foot cone that is audible 600 feet away. Each creature in the cone must make a DC 15 Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 5d6} thunder damage and is {@condition Deafened|Ishiir} for 1 minute. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition Deafened|Ishiir}. Creatures and objects made of glass or crystal have {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} and take {@damage 10d6} thunder damage instead of {@dice 5d6}.
Each use of the horn's magic has a {@chance 20} chance of causing the horn to explode. The explosion deals {@damage 10d6} fire damage to the blower and destroys the horn.

item.name: Iron Bands of Bilarro
entries: This rusty iron sphere measures 3 inches in diameter and weighs 1 pound. You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to speak the command word and throw the sphere at a Huge or smaller creature you can see within 60 feet of you. As the sphere moves through the air, it opens into a tangle of metal bands.

Make a ranged {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} with an attack bonus equal to your Dexterity modifier plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus. On a hit, the target is {@condition Restrained|Ishiir} until you take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to speak the command word again to release it. Doing so, or missing with the attack, causes the bands to contract and become a sphere once more.

A creature, including the one {@condition Restrained|Ishiir}, can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to make a DC 20 Strength check to break the iron bands. On a success, the item is destroyed, and the {@condition Restrained|Ishiir} creature is freed. If the check fails, any further attempts made by that creature automatically fail until 24 hours have elapsed.
Once the bands are used, they can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Naushindhor's Stone: Awareness
entries: An {@italic Ioun stone} is named after Ioun, a god of knowledge and prophecy revered on some worlds. Many types of {@italic Ioun stone} exist, each type a distinct combination of shape and color.

When you use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to toss one of these stones into the air, the stone orbits your head at a distance of {@dice 1d3} feet and confers a benefit to you. Thereafter, another creature must use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to grasp or net the stone to separate it from you, either by making a successful {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} against AC 24 or a successful DC 24 Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check. You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to seize and stow the stone, ending its effect.
A stone has AC 24, 10 hit points, and {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to all damage. It is considered to be an object that is being worn while it orbits your head.
You can't be {@quickref Surprise|PHB|3|0|surprised} while this dark blue rhomboid orbits your head.

item.name: Naushindhor's Stone: Reserve
entries: An {@italic Ioun stone} is named after Ioun, a god of knowledge and prophecy revered on some worlds. Many types of {@italic Ioun stone} exist, each type a distinct combination of shape and color.

When you use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to toss one of these stones into the air, the stone orbits your head at a distance of {@dice 1d3} feet and confers a benefit to you. Thereafter, another creature must use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to grasp or net the stone to separate it from you, either by making a successful {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} against AC 24 or a successful DC 24 Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check. You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to seize and stow the stone, ending its effect.
A stone has AC 24, 10 hit points, and {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to all damage. It is considered to be an object that is being worn while it orbits your head.

This vibrant purple prism stores spells cast into it, holding them until you use them. The stone can store up to 3 levels worth of spells at a time. When found, it contains {@dice 1d4 - 1} levels of stored spells chosen by the DM.

Any creature can cast a spell of 1st through 3rd level into the stone by touching it as the spell is cast. The spell has no effect, other than to be stored in the stone. If the stone can't hold the spell, the spell is expended without effect. The level of the slot used to cast the spell determines how much space it uses.

While this stone orbits your head, you can cast any spell stored in it. The spell uses the slot level, spell save DC, spell attack bonus, and spellcasting ability of the original caster, but is otherwise treated as if you cast the spell. The spell cast from the stone is no longer stored in it, freeing up space.

item.name: Necklace of Adaptation
entries: While wearing this necklace, you can breathe normally in any environment, and you have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} made against harmful gases and vapors (such as {@spell Cloudkill|Ishiir} and {@spell Stinking Cloud|Ishiir} effects, inhaled poisons, and the breath weapons of some dragons).

item.name: Pearl of Power
entries: While this pearl is on your person, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to speak its command word and regain one expended spell slot. If the expended slot was of 4th level or higher, the new slot is 3rd level. Once you have used the pearl, it can't be used again until the next dawn.
{@b Masterwork}: If the expended slot was of 5th level or higher, the new slot is 4th level.

item.name: Pennant of the Vind Rune
entries: This blue pennant is crafted from silk and is five feet long and whips about as if buffeted by a wind. The vind (wind) rune appears on its surface, looking almost like a cloud. The pennant has the following properties, which work only while it's on your person.

entries.name: Wind Step
entries: As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you fly up to 20 feet. If you don't land at the end of this flight, you fall unless you have another means of staying aloft.

entries.name: Comforting Wind
entries: You can't suffocate.

entries.name: Winds Grasp
entries: As a {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} when you fall, you can cause yourself to take no damage from the fall. Once you use this property, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

entries.name: Wind Walker
entries: While you are attuned to this rune, you can cast {@spell Levitate|Ishiir} as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}. Once you use this property, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

entries.name: Gift of Wind
entries: You can transfer the pennant's magic to a nonmagical item—a suit of armor, a pair of boots, or a cloak—by tracing the vind rune there with your finger. The transfer takes 8 hours of work that requires the two items to be within 5 feet of each other. At the end, the pennant is destroyed, and the rune appears in silver on the chosen item, which gains a benefit based on its form:

items.name: Armor
items.entry: The armor is now an uncommon magic item that requires attunement. You gain a bonus to {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} of 5 feet while you wear the armor, and if it normally imposes {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on {@skill Stealth} {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks}, it no longer does so.

items.name: Boots/Cloak
items.entry: The pair of boots or cloak is now a rare magic item that requires attunement. While wearing the item, you can convert up to 20 feet of your movement on each of your turns into flight. If you don't land at the end of this flight, you fall unless you have another means of staying aloft. You can also cast {@spell Feather Fall|Ishiir} once from the item, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

item.name: Ring of Swimming
entries: You have a {@variantrule Swim Speed|Ishiir} of 40 feet while wearing this ring.

item.name: Slippers of Spider Climbing
entries: While you wear these light shoes, you can move up, down, and across vertical surfaces and upside down along ceilings, while leaving your hands free. You have a {@variantrule Climb Speed|Ishiir} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir}. However, the slippers don't allow you to move this way on a slippery surface, such as one covered by ice or oil.

item.name: Goggles of the Night
entries: While wearing these dark lenses, you have {@sense darkvision} out to a range of 60 feet. If you already have {@sense darkvision}, wearing the goggles increases its range by 60 feet.

item.name: Arcanist's Goggles
entries: These leather-framed goggles feature purple crystal lenses. While wearing the goggles, you have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}) {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks} made to reveal information about a creature or object you can see.
In addition, you can cast the {@spell Identify|Ishiir} spell using the googles. Once you do so, you can't do so again until the next dawn.

item.name: Driftglobe
entries: This small sphere of thick glass weighs 1 pound. If you are within 60 feet of it, you can speak its command word and cause it to emanate the {@spell Light|Ishiir} or {@spell Daylight|Ishiir} spell. Once used, the {@spell Daylight|Ishiir} effect can't be used again until the next dawn.

You can speak another command word as an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to make the illuminated globe rise into the air and float no more than 5 feet off the ground. The globe hovers in this way until you or another creature grasps it. If you move more than 60 feet from the hovering globe, it follows you until it is within 60 feet of you. It takes the shortest route to do so. If prevented from moving, the globe sinks gently to the ground and becomes inactive, and its light winks out.

item.name: Figurine of Wondrous Power: Silver Raven
entries: A figurine of wondrous power is a statuette of a beast small enough to fit in a pocket. If you use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to speak the command word and throw the figurine to a point on the ground within 60 feet of you, the figurine becomes a living creature. If the space where the creature would appear is occupied by other creatures or objects, or if there isn't enough space for the creature, the figurine doesn't become a creature.
The creature is friendly to you and your companions. It understands your languages and obeys your spoken commands. If you issue no commands, the creature defends itself but takes no other actions.

The creature exists for a duration specific to each figurine. At the end of the duration, the creature reverts to its figurine form. It reverts to a figurine early if it drops to 0 hit points or if you use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to speak the command word again while touching it. When the creature becomes a figurine again, its property can't be used again until a certain amount of time has passed, as specified in the figurine's description.
{@creature raven||Silver Raven}.

This silver statuette of a raven can become a raven for up to 12 hours. Once it has been used, it can't be used again until 2 days have passed. While in raven form, the figurine allows you to cast the {@spell Animal Messenger|Ishiir} spell on it at will.

item.name: Helm of Comprehending Languages
entries: While wearing this helm, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to cast the {@spell Comprehend Languages|Ishiir} spell from it at will.

item.name: Lyre of Charming
entries: You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to play this lyre and cast one of the following spells from it: {@spell Animal Friendship|Ishiir}, {@spell Charm Person|Ishiir}, {@spell Enthrall|Ishiir}, {@spell Suggestion|Ishiir}. If the spell requires a {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, the spell save DC is 13.
Once the instrument has been used to cast a spell, it can't be used to cast that spell again until the next dawn.

item.name: Helm of Underwater Action
entries: While wearing this brass helmet, you can breathe underwater, you gain {@sense darkvision} with a range of 60 feet, and you gain a {@variantrule Swim Speed|Ishiir} of 30 feet.

item.name: Knave's Eye Patch
entries: While wearing this eye patch, you gain these benefits:

items: You have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks} that rely on sight.
If you have the Sunlight Sensitivity trait, you are unaffected by the trait.

You are {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir|Immune} to magic that allows other creatures to read your thoughts or determine whether you are lying. Creatures can communicate telepathically with you only if you allow it.

item.name: Ring of Mind Shielding
entries: While wearing this ring, you are {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir|Immune} to magic that allows other creatures to read your thoughts, determine whether you are lying, know your alignment, or know your creature type. Creatures can telepathically communicate with you only if you allow it.
You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to cause the ring to become {@condition Invisible} until you use another action to make it visible, until you remove the ring, or until you die.

If you die while wearing the ring, your soul enters it, unless it already houses a soul. You can remain in the ring or depart for the afterlife. As long as your soul is in the ring, you can telepathically communicate with any creature wearing it. A wearer can't prevent this telepathic communication.

item.name: Robe of Useful Items
entries: This robe has cloth patches of various shapes and colors covering it. While wearing the robe. you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to detach one of the patches, causing it to become the object or creature it represents. Once the last patch is removed, the robe becomes an ordinary garment.
The robe has two of each of the following patches:

items: Dagger
Bullseye lantern (filled and lit)
Steel mirror
10-foot pole
Hempen rope (50 feet, coiled)
Sack

entries: In addition, the robe has {@dice 4d4} other patches. The DM chooses the patches or determines them randomly.

rows: Silver coffer (1 foot long, 6 inches wide and deep) worth 500 gp
Iron door (up to 10 feet wide and 10 feet high, barred on one side of your choice), which you can place in an opening you can reach; it conforms to fit the opening, attaching and hinging itself
A {@creature riding horse} with saddle bags
Pit (a cube 10 feet on a side), which you can place on the ground within 10 feet of you
Spell scroll containing one spell of 1st to 3rd level
Window (2 feet by 4 feet, up to 2 feet deep), which you can place on a vertical surface you can reach

item.name: Staff of the Adder
item.reqAttune: by a cleric, druid, or warlock
entries: You can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to speak this staff's command word and make the head of the staff become that of an animate poisonous snake for 1 minute. By using another {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to speak the command word again, you return the staff to its normal inanimate form.

You can make a melee attack using the snake head, which has a reach of 5 feet. Your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus applies to the {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir}. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d6} piercing damage and must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or take {@damage 3d6} poison damage.

The snake head can be attacked while it is animate. It has an Armor Class of 15 and 20 hit points. If the head drops to 0 hit points, the staff is destroyed. As long as it's not destroyed, the staff regains all lost hit points when it reverts to its inanimate form.

item.name: Everbloody Gauntlets
entries: These gauntlets are perpetually covered by blood. You gain the following benefits while wearing them:

items: Once per turn when you roll damage for a melee attack with a weapon, you can reroll the weapon's damage dice. If you do so, you must use the second total.
Your weapon attacks that deal slashing damage score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20 on the {@dice d20}.

item.name: Coiling Grasp Tattoo
entries: Produced by a special needle, this magic tattoo has long intertwining designs.

entries.name: Tattoo Attunement
entries: To attune to this item, you hold the needle to your skin where you want the tattoo to appear, pressing the needle there throughout the attunement process. When the attunement is complete, the needle turns into the ink that becomes the tattoo, which appears on the skin.
If your attunement to the tattoo ends, the tattoo vanishes, and the needle reappears in your space.

entries.name: Grasping Tendrils
entries: While the tattoo is on your skin, you can, as an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, cause the tattoo to extrude into inky tendrils, which reach for a creature you can see within 15 feet of you. The creature must succeed on a DC 14 Strength {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or take {@damage 3d6} force damage and be {@condition Grappled|Ishiir} by you. As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, the creature can escape the grapple by succeeding on a DC 14 Strength ({@skill Athletics}) or Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check. The grapple also ends if you halt it (no action required), if the creature is ever more than 15 feet away from you, or if you use this tattoo on a different creature.

item.name: Helm of Telepathy
entries: While wearing this helm, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to cast the {@spell Detect Thoughts|Ishiir} spell (save DC 13) from it. As long as you maintain {@condition Concentration|Ishiir} on the spell, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to send a telepathic message to a creature you are focused on. It can reply—using a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to do so—while your focus on it continues.

While focusing on a creature with {@spell Detect Thoughts|Ishiir}, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to cast the {@spell Suggestion|Ishiir} spell (save DC 13) from the helm on that creature. Once used, the suggestion property can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Sage's Signet (Songbird)
entries: This gilded ring bears a beautiful engraving and is imbued with powers of keen wisdom and foresight. While wearing this ring, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to cast the {@spell Augury|Ishiir} spell from the ring. Once you use the ring to cast the spell, the ring can't cast the spell again until the next dawn.

While wearing the Sage's Signet, you can cast the {@spell Charm Person|Ishiir} and {@spell Hypnotic Pattern|Ishiir} once each from the ring using your spellcasting ability. Once you cast each spell from the ring, the ring can't cast the spell again until the next dawn.

item.name: Wand of Entangle
entries: This wand has 7 charges. While holding it, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to expend 1 of its charges to cast the {@spell Entangle|Ishiir} spell (save DC 13) from it.
The wand regains {@dice 1d6 + 1} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the wand crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

item.name: Wand of Magic Missile
entries: This wand has 7 charges. While holding it, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast the {@spell Magic Missile|Ishiir} spell from it. For 1 charge, you cast the 1st-level version of the spell. You can increase the spell slot level by one for each additional charge you expend.
The wand regains {@dice 1d6 + 1} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the wand crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

item.name: Box of Paper Birds
entries: After you write a message of fifty words or fewer on this magic sheet of parchment and speak a creature's name, the parchment magically folds into a Tiny paper bird and flies to the recipient whose name you uttered. The recipient must be on the same plane of existence as you, otherwise the bird turns into ash as it takes flight.

The bird is an object that has 1 hit point, an Armor Class of 13, a {@variantrule Fly Speed|Ishiir} of 60 feet, a Dexterity of 16 (+3), and a score of 1 (−5) in all other abilities, and it is {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir|Immune} to poison and psychic damage.

It travels to within 5 feet of its intended recipient by the most direct route, whereupon it turns into a nonmagical and inanimate sheet of parchment that can be unfolded only by the intended recipient. If the bird's hit points or {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} is reduced to 0 or if it is otherwise immobilized, it turns into ash.
Paper birds usually come in small, flat boxes containing {@dice 1d6 + 3} sheets of the parchment.

item.name: Brooch of Shielding
entries: While wearing this brooch, you have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to force damage, and you have {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir} to damage from the {@spell Magic Missile|Ishiir} spell.

item.name: Broom of Flying
entries: This wooden broom, which weighs 3 pounds, functions like a mundane broom until you stand astride it and speak its command word. It then hovers beneath you and can be ridden in the air. It has a {@variantrule Fly Speed|Ishiir} of 50 feet. It can carry up to 400 pounds, but its {@variantrule Fly Speed|Ishiir} becomes 30 feet while carrying over 200 pounds. The broom stops hovering when you land.

You can send the broom to travel alone to a destination within 1 mile of you if you speak the command word, name the location, and are familiar with that place. The broom comes back to you when you speak another command word, provided that the broom is still within 1 mile of you.

item.name: Elemental Gem (Corundum)
entries: This gem contains a mote of elemental energy. When you use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to break the gem, a {@creature fire elemental} is summoned as if you had cast the {@spell Conjure Elemental|Ishiir} spell, and the gem's magic is lost.

item.name: Elemental Gem (Diamond)
entries: This gem contains a mote of elemental energy. When you use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to break the gem, an {@creature earth elemental} is summoned as if you had cast the {@spell Conjure Elemental|Ishiir} spell, and the gem's magic is lost.

item.name: Elemental Gem (Emerald)
entries: This gem contains a mote of elemental energy. When you use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to break the gem, a {@creature water elemental} is summoned as if you had cast the {@spell Conjure Elemental|Ishiir} spell, and the gem's magic is lost.

item.name: Elemental Gem (Sapphire)
entries: This gem contains a mote of elemental energy. When you use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to break the gem, an {@creature air elemental} is summoned as if you had cast the {@spell Conjure Elemental|Ishiir} spell, and the gem's magic is lost.

item.name: Living Gloves
entries: These symbiotic gloves pulse with a life of their own. To attune to them, you must wear them for the entire attunement period, during which the gloves bond with your skin.
While attuned to these gloves, you gain one of the following proficiencies (your choice when you attune to the gloves):

items: {@skill Sleight of Hand}
{@item Thieves' tools|PHB}
One kind of {@item artisan's tools|Ishiir} of your choice
One kind of {@item musical instrument|PHB} of your choice

entries: When you make an {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir} using the chosen {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir}, you add double your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus to the check, instead of your normal {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus.

entries.name: Symbiotic Nature
entries: The gloves can't be removed from you while you're attuned to them, and you can't voluntarily end your attunement to them. If you're targeted by a spell that ends a curse, your attunement to the gloves ends, and they can be removed.

item.name: Mirror of the Past
entries: The holder of this platinum hand mirror can learn something about the history of a specific object or creature by taking an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to gaze into the mirror and think of the target. Instead of the holder's reflection, the mirror presents scenes from the target's past. Information conveyed is accurate, but it is random and cryptic, and presented in no particular order. Once it is activated, the mirror gives its information for 1 minute or less, then returns to normal. It can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Nightstrider Cape
entries: This cape smells faintly of brimstone. While wearing it, you can use it to cast the {@spell Dimension Door|Ishiir} spell as an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}. This property of the cape can't be used again until the next dawn.

When you disappear, you leave behind a cloud of smoke, and you appear in a similar cloud of smoke at your destination. The smoke lightly obscures the space you left and the space you appear in, and it dissipates at the end of your next turn. A light or stronger wind disperses the smoke.

item.name: Periapt of Wound Closure
entries: While you wear this pendant, you stabilize whenever you are dying at the start of your turn. In addition, whenever you roll a Hit Die to regain hit points, double the number of hit points it restores.

item.name: Ring of Warmth
entries: While wearing this ring, you have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to cold damage. In addition, you and everything you wear and carry are unharmed by temperatures as low as -50 degrees Fahrenheit.

item.name: Ring of Water Walking
entries: While wearing this ring, you can stand on and move across any liquid surface as if it were solid ground.

item.name: Wand of Secrets
entries: The wand has 3 charges. While holding it, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to expend 1 of its charges, and if a secret door or trap is within 30 feet of you, the wand pulses and points at the one nearest to you. The wand regains {@dice 1d3} expended charges daily at dawn.

item.name: Ring of the Ram
entries: This ring has 3 charges, and it regains {@dice 1d3} expended charges daily at dawn. While wearing the ring, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to expend 1 to 3 of its charges to make a ranged spell attack against one creature you can see within 60 feet of you. The ring produces a spectral ram's head and makes its {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} with a +7 bonus. On a hit, for each charge you spend, the target takes {@damage 2d10} force damage and is pushed 5 feet away from you.

Alternatively, you can expend 1 to 3 of the ring's charges as an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to try to break an object you can see within 60 feet of you that isn't being worn or carried. The ring makes a Strength check with a +5 bonus for each charge you spend.

item.name: Rope of Entanglement
entries: This rope is 30 feet long and weighs 3 pounds. If you hold one end of the rope and use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to speak its command word, the other end darts forward to entangle a creature you can see within 20 feet of you. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or become {@condition Restrained|Ishiir}.

You can release the creature by using a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to speak a second command word. A target {@condition Restrained|Ishiir} by the rope can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to make a DC 15 Strength or Dexterity check (target's choice). On a success, the creature is no longer {@condition Restrained|Ishiir} by the rope.
The rope has AC 20 and 20 hit points. It regains 1 hit point every 5 minutes as long as it has at least 1 hit point. If the rope drops to 0 hit points, it is destroyed.

item.name: Boots of the Winterlands
entries: These furred boots are snug and feel quite warm. While you wear them, you gain the following benefits:

items: You have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to cold damage.
You ignore {@quickref difficult terrain||3} created by ice or snow.
You can tolerate temperatures as low as -50 degrees Fahrenheit without any additional protection. If you wear heavy clothes, you can tolerate temperatures as low as -100 degrees Fahrenheit.

item.name: Medallion of Thoughts
entries: The medallion has 3 charges. While wearing it, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} and expend 1 charge to cast the {@spell Detect Thoughts|Ishiir} spell (save DC 13) from it. The medallion regains {@dice 1d3} expended charges daily at dawn.

item.name: Sage's Signet (Serpent)
entries: This gilded ring bears a beautiful engraving and is imbued with powers of keen wisdom and foresight. While wearing this ring, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to cast the {@spell Augury|Ishiir} spell from the ring. Once you use the ring to cast the spell, the ring can't cast the spell again until the next dawn.

While wearing the Sage's Signet, you can cast the {@spell Fear|Ishiir} and {@spell Hex|Ishiir} once each from the ring using your spellcasting ability. Once you cast each spell from the ring, the ring can't cast the spell again until the next dawn.

item.name: Lantern of Revealing
entries: While lit, this {@item hooded lantern|phb} burns for 6 hours on 1 pint of oil, shedding bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. {@condition Invisible} creatures and objects are visible as long as they are in the lantern's bright light. You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to lower the hood, reducing the light to dim light in a 5-foot radius.

item.name: Robe of Summer
entries: This elegant garment is made from fine cloth in hues of red, orange, and gold. While you wear the robe, you have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to cold damage. In addition, you are comfortable as if the temperature were that of a balmy day, so you suffer no ill effects from the weather's temperature extremes.

item.name: Wand of Viscid Globs
entries: Crafted by the {@creature drow}, this slim black wand has 7 charges. While holding it, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to expend 1 of its charges to cause a small glob of viscous material to launch from the tip at one creature within 60 feet of you. Make a ranged {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} against the target, with a bonus equal to your spellcasting modifier (or your Intelligence modifier, if you don't have a spellcasting modifier) plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus. On a hit, the glob expands and dries on the target, which is {@condition Restrained|Ishiir} for 1 hour. After that time, the viscous material cracks and falls away.

Applying a pint or more of alcohol to the {@condition Restrained|Ishiir} creature dissolves the glob instantly, as does the application of {@item oil of etherealness|Ishiir} or {@item universal solvent|Ishiir}. The glob also dissolves instantly if exposed to sunlight. No other nonmagical process can remove the viscous material until it deteriorates on its own.
The wand regains {@dice 1d6 + 1} expended charges daily at midnight. If you expend the wands last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the wand melts into harmless slime and is destroyed.
A wand of viscous globs is destroyed if exposed to sunlight for 1 hour without interruption.

item.name: Dispelling Stone
entries: This smooth, rainbow-colored, egg-shaped stone can be thrown up to 30 feet and explodes in a 10-foot-radius sphere of magical energy on impact, destroying the stone. Any active spell of 5th level or lower in the sphere ends.

item.name: Ring of Free Action
entries: While you wear this ring, {@quickref difficult terrain||3} doesn't cost you extra movement. In addition, magic can neither reduce your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} nor cause you to be {@condition Paralyzed|Ishiir} or {@condition Restrained|Ishiir}.

item.name: Feather of Terror Bird Summoning
entries: This bright plume is made from the feather of a {@creature diatryma|wdh} (pronounced dee-ah-TRY-mah), a Large, colorful, flightless bird native to the Underdark. If you use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to speak the command word and throw the feather into a Large unoccupied space on the ground within 5 feet of you, the feather becomes a living diatryma for up to 6 hours, after which it reverts to its feather form. It reverts to feather form early if it drops to 0 hit points or if you use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to speak the command word again while touching the bird.
When the diatryma reverts to feather form, the magic of the feather can't be used again until 7 days have passed.

The diatryma uses the statistics of an {@creature axe beak}, except that its beak deals piercing damage instead of slashing damage. The creature is friendly to you and your companions, and it can be used as a mount. It understands your languages and obeys your spoken commands. If you issue no commands, the diatryma defends itself but takes no other actions.

item.name: Figurine of Wondrous Power: Ebony Fly
entries: A figurine of wondrous power is a statuette of a beast small enough to fit in a pocket. If you use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to speak the command word and throw the figurine to a point on the ground within 60 feet of you, the figurine becomes a living creature. If the space where the creature would appear is occupied by other creatures or objects, or if there isn't enough space for the creature, the figurine doesn't become a creature.
The creature is friendly to you and your companions. It understands your languages and obeys your spoken commands. If you issue no commands, the creature defends itself but takes no other actions.

The creature exists for a duration specific to each figurine. At the end of the duration, the creature reverts to its figurine form. It reverts to a figurine early if it drops to 0 hit points or if you use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to speak the command word again while touching it. When the creature becomes a figurine again, its property can't be used again until a certain amount of time has passed, as specified in the figurine's description.
{@creature giant fly|dmg|Ebony Fly}.

This ebony statuette is carved in the likeness of a horsefly. It can become a {@creature giant fly|dmg} for up to 12 hours and can be ridden as a mount. Once it has been used, it can't be used again until 2 days have passed.

item.name: Figurine of Wondrous Power: Serpentine Owl
entries: A figurine of wondrous power is a statuette of a beast small enough to fit in a pocket. If you use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to speak the command word and throw the figurine to a point on the ground within 60 feet of you, the figurine becomes a living creature. If the space where the creature would appear is occupied by other creatures or objects, or if there isn't enough space for the creature, the figurine doesn't become a creature.
The creature is friendly to you and your companions. It understands your languages and obeys your spoken commands. If you issue no commands, the creature defends itself but takes no other actions.

The creature exists for a duration specific to each figurine. At the end of the duration, the creature reverts to its figurine form. It reverts to a figurine early if it drops to 0 hit points or if you use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to speak the command word again while touching it. When the creature becomes a figurine again, its property can't be used again until a certain amount of time has passed, as specified in the figurine's description.
{@creature giant owl||Serpentine Owl}.

This serpentine statuette of an owl can become a {@creature giant owl} for up to 8 hours. Once it has been used, it can't be used again until 2 days have passed. The owl can telepathically communicate with you at any range if you and it are on the same plane of existence.

item.name: Gauntlets of Ogre Power
entries: Your Strength score is 19 while you wear these gauntlets. They have no effect on you if your Strength is already 19 or higher without them.

item.name: Gloves of Swimming and Climbing
entries: While wearing these gloves, {@variantrule Climb Speed|Ishiir|climbing} and {@variantrule Swim Speed|Ishiir|swimming} don't cost you extra movement, and you gain a +5 bonus to Strength ({@skill Athletics}) {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks} made to climb or swim.

item.name: Headband of Intellect
entries: Your Intelligence score is 19 while you wear this headband. It has no effect on you if your Intelligence is already 19 or higher without it.

item.name: Nature's Mantle
entries: This cloak shifts color and texture to blend with the terrain surrounding you. While wearing the cloak, you can use it as a spellcasting focus for your druid and ranger spells.
While you are in an area that is lightly obscured, you can {@action Hide} as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} even if you are being directly observed.

item.name: Quaal's Feather Token: Swan Boat
entries: This tiny object looks like a feather. Different types of feather tokens exist, each with a different single-use effect.

entries.name: Swan Boat
entries: You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to touch the token to a body of water at least 60 feet in diameter. The token disappears, and a 50-foot-long, 20-foot-wide boat shaped like a swan takes its place. The boat is self-propelled and moves across water at a speed of 6 miles per hour. You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} while on the boat to command it to move or to turn up to 90 degrees. The boat can carry up to thirty-two Medium or smaller creatures. A Large creature counts as four Medium creatures, while a Huge creature counts as nine. The boat remains for 24 hours and then disappears. You can dismiss the boat as an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}.

item.name: Ring of Resistance
entries: {#itemEntry Ring of Resistance}

item.name: Sending Stones
entries: Sending stones come in pairs, with each smooth stone carved to match the other so the pairing is easily recognized. While you touch one stone, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to cast the {@spell Sending|Ishiir} spell from it. The target is the bearer of the other stone. If no creature bears the other stone, you know that fact as soon as you use the stone and don't cast the spell.
Once {@spell Sending|Ishiir} is cast through the stones, they can't be used again until the next dawn. If one of the stones in a pair is destroyed, the other one becomes nonmagical.

item.name: Sylvan Cloak
entries: Your Charisma score is 19 while you wear this cloak. It has no effect on you if your Charisma is already 19 or higher without it.

item.name: Chime of Opening
entries: This hollow metal tube measures about 1 foot long and weighs 1 pound. You can strike it as an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, pointing it at an object within 120 feet of you that can be opened, such as a door, lid, or lock. The chime issues a clear tone, and one lock or latch on the object opens unless the sound can't reach the object. If no locks or latches remain, the object itself opens.
The chime can be used ten times. After the tenth time it cracks and becomes useless.

item.name: Horseshoes of a Zephyr
entries: These iron horseshoes come in a set of four. While all four shoes are affixed to the hooves of a horse or similar creature, they allow the creature to move normally while floating 4 inches above the ground. This effect means the creature can cross or stand above nonsolid or unstable surfaces, such as water or lava. The creature leaves no tracks and ignores {@quickref difficult terrain||3}. In addition, the creature can move at normal speed for up to 12 hours a day without suffering {@condition Exhaustion|Ishiir} from a forced march.

item.name: Naushindhor's Stone: Regeneration
entries: An {@italic Ioun stone} is named after Ioun, a god of knowledge and prophecy revered on some worlds. Many types of {@italic Ioun stone} exist, each type a distinct combination of shape and color.

When you use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to toss one of these stones into the air, the stone orbits your head at a distance of {@dice 1d3} feet and confers a benefit to you. Thereafter, another creature must use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to grasp or net the stone to separate it from you, either by making a successful {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} against AC 24 or a successful DC 24 Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check. You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to seize and stow the stone, ending its effect.
A stone has AC 24, 10 hit points, and {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to all damage. It is considered to be an object that is being worn while it orbits your head.
You regain 15 hit points at the end of each hour this pearly white spindle orbits your head, provided that you have at least 1 hit point.

item.name: Winged Boots
entries: While you wear these boots, you have a {@variantrule Fly Speed|Ishiir} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir}. You can use the boots to fly for up to 4 hours, all at once or in several shorter flights, each one using a minimum of 1 minute from the duration. If you are flying when the duration expires, you descend at a rate of 30 feet per round until you land.
The boots regain 2 hours of flying capability for every 12 hours they aren't in use.

item.name: Rod of the Treasure Hunter
entries: The {@creature fire giant} Duke Zalto hired a wizard to craft several of these adamantine rods. Each measures 4 feet long, weighs 100 pounds, and is sized to fit comfortably in a {@creature fire giant||fire giant's} hand. The rod has two prongs at one end and a molded handle grip on the opposite end.

The rod has 10 charges and regains {@dice 1d6 + 4} of its expended charges daily at dawn. As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can grasp it by the handle and expend 1 charge to cast the {@spell Locate Object|Ishiir} spell from it. When the rod is used to detect objects made of adamantine, such as fragments of the Vonindod construct, its range increases to 10 miles.

item.name: Bag of Holding
entries: This bag has an interior space considerably larger than its outside dimensions, roughly 2 feet in diameter at the mouth and 4 feet deep. The bag can hold up to 500 pounds, not exceeding a volume of 64 cubic feet. The bag weighs 15 pounds, regardless of its contents. Retrieving an item from the bag requires an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}.

If the bag is overloaded, pierced, or torn, it ruptures and is destroyed, and its contents are scattered in the Astral Plane. If the bag is turned inside out, its contents spill forth, unharmed, but the bag must be put right before it can be used again. Breathing creatures inside the bag can survive up to a number of minutes equal to 10 divided by the number of creatures (minimum 1 minute), after which time they begin to suffocate.

Placing a bag of holding inside an extradimensional space created by a {@item Heward's handy haversack}, {@item portable hole}, or similar item instantly destroys both items and opens a gate to the Astral Plane. The gate originates where the one item was placed inside the other. Any creature within 10 feet of the gate is sucked through it to a random location on the Astral Plane. The gate then closes. The gate is one-way only and can't be reopened.

item.name: Bracers of Archery
entries: While wearing these bracers, you have {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} with the longbow and shortbow, and you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls on ranged attacks made with such weapons.

item.name: Bracers of Defense
entries: While wearing these bracers, you gain a +2 bonus to AC if you are wearing no armor and using no shield.

item.name: Cloak of the Manta Ray
entries: While wearing this cloak with its hood up, you can breathe underwater, and you have a {@variantrule Swim Speed|Ishiir} of 60 feet. Pulling the hood up or down requires an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}.

item.name: Deck of Oracles
entries: The illustrations on this deck of oracle cards move or change subtly when viewed indirectly. When you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}, you can spend 10 minutes consulting the cards for an omen of the coming day. Roll a {@dice d20} and record the number rolled. Once in the next 8 hours, immediately after a creature within 60 feet of you makes an {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir}, an {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir}, or a {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to discard the {@dice d20} roll; the creature must use the number you rolled in place of its roll.
Additionally, while holding the cards, you can cast {@spell Divination|Ishiir} from them. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Dimensional Shackles
entries: You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to place these shackles on an {@condition Incapacitated|Ishiir} creature. The shackles adjust to fit a creature of Small to Large size. In addition to serving as mundane manacles, the shackles prevent a creature bound by them from using any method of extradimensional movement, including teleportation or travel to a different plane of existence. They don't prevent the creature from passing-through an interdimensional portal.

You and any creature you designate when you use the shackles can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to remove them. Once every 30 days, the bound creature can make a DC 30 Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check. On a success, the creature breaks free and destroys the shackles.

item.name: Naushindhor's Stone: Agility
entries: An {@italic Ioun stone} is named after Ioun, a god of knowledge and prophecy revered on some worlds. Many types of {@italic Ioun stone} exist, each type a distinct combination of shape and color.

When you use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to toss one of these stones into the air, the stone orbits your head at a distance of {@dice 1d3} feet and confers a benefit to you. Thereafter, another creature must use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to grasp or net the stone to separate it from you, either by making a successful {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} against AC 24 or a successful DC 24 Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check. You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to seize and stow the stone, ending its effect.
A stone has AC 24, 10 hit points, and {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to all damage. It is considered to be an object that is being worn while it orbits your head.
Your Dexterity score increases by 2, to a maximum of 20, while this deep red sphere orbits your head.

item.name: Naushindhor's Stone: Fortitude
entries: An {@italic Ioun stone} is named after Ioun, a god of knowledge and prophecy revered on some worlds. Many types of {@italic Ioun stone} exist, each type a distinct combination of shape and color.

When you use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to toss one of these stones into the air, the stone orbits your head at a distance of {@dice 1d3} feet and confers a benefit to you. Thereafter, another creature must use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to grasp or net the stone to separate it from you, either by making a successful {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} against AC 24 or a successful DC 24 Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check. You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to seize and stow the stone, ending its effect.
A stone has AC 24, 10 hit points, and {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to all damage. It is considered to be an object that is being worn while it orbits your head.
Your Constitution score increases by 2, to a maximum of 20, while this pink rhomboid orbits your head.

item.name: Naushindhor's Stone: Insight
entries: An {@italic Ioun stone} is named after Ioun, a god of knowledge and prophecy revered on some worlds. Many types of {@italic Ioun stone} exist, each type a distinct combination of shape and color.

When you use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to toss one of these stones into the air, the stone orbits your head at a distance of {@dice 1d3} feet and confers a benefit to you. Thereafter, another creature must use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to grasp or net the stone to separate it from you, either by making a successful {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} against AC 24 or a successful DC 24 Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check. You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to seize and stow the stone, ending its effect.
A stone has AC 24, 10 hit points, and {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to all damage. It is considered to be an object that is being worn while it orbits your head.
Your Wisdom score increases by 2, to a maximum of 20, while this incandescent blue sphere orbits your head.

item.name: Naushindhor's Stone: Intellect
entries: An {@italic Ioun stone} is named after Ioun, a god of knowledge and prophecy revered on some worlds. Many types of {@italic Ioun stone} exist, each type a distinct combination of shape and color.

When you use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to toss one of these stones into the air, the stone orbits your head at a distance of {@dice 1d3} feet and confers a benefit to you. Thereafter, another creature must use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to grasp or net the stone to separate it from you, either by making a successful {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} against AC 24 or a successful DC 24 Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check. You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to seize and stow the stone, ending its effect.
A stone has AC 24, 10 hit points, and {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to all damage. It is considered to be an object that is being worn while it orbits your head.
Your Intelligence score increases by 2, to a maximum of 20, while this marbled scarlet and blue sphere orbits your head.

item.name: Naushindhor's Stone: Leadership
entries: An {@italic Ioun stone} is named after Ioun, a god of knowledge and prophecy revered on some worlds. Many types of {@italic Ioun stone} exist, each type a distinct combination of shape and color.

When you use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to toss one of these stones into the air, the stone orbits your head at a distance of {@dice 1d3} feet and confers a benefit to you. Thereafter, another creature must use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to grasp or net the stone to separate it from you, either by making a successful {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} against AC 24 or a successful DC 24 Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check. You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to seize and stow the stone, ending its effect.
A stone has AC 24, 10 hit points, and {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to all damage. It is considered to be an object that is being worn while it orbits your head.
Your Charisma score increases by 2, to a maximum of 20, while this marbled pink and green sphere orbits your head.

item.name: Naushindhor's Stone: Protection
entries: An {@italic Ioun stone} is named after Ioun, a god of knowledge and prophecy revered on some worlds. Many types of {@italic Ioun stone} exist, each type a distinct combination of shape and color.

When you use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to toss one of these stones into the air, the stone orbits your head at a distance of {@dice 1d3} feet and confers a benefit to you. Thereafter, another creature must use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to grasp or net the stone to separate it from you, either by making a successful {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} against AC 24 or a successful DC 24 Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check. You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to seize and stow the stone, ending its effect.
A stone has AC 24, 10 hit points, and {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to all damage. It is considered to be an object that is being worn while it orbits your head.
You gain a +1 bonus to AC while this dusty rose prism orbits your head.

item.name: Naushindhor's Stone: Strength
entries: An {@italic Ioun stone} is named after Ioun, a god of knowledge and prophecy revered on some worlds. Many types of {@italic Ioun stone} exist, each type a distinct combination of shape and color.

When you use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to toss one of these stones into the air, the stone orbits your head at a distance of {@dice 1d3} feet and confers a benefit to you. Thereafter, another creature must use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to grasp or net the stone to separate it from you, either by making a successful {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} against AC 24 or a successful DC 24 Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check. You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to seize and stow the stone, ending its effect.
A stone has AC 24, 10 hit points, and {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to all damage. It is considered to be an object that is being worn while it orbits your head.
Your Strength score increases by 2, to a maximum of 20, while this pale blue rhomboid orbits your head.

item.name: Quaal's Feather Token: Bird
entries: This tiny object looks like a feather. Different types of feather tokens exist, each with a different single-use effect.

entries.name: Bird
entries: You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to toss the token 5 feet into the air. The token disappears and an enormous, multicolored bird takes its place. The bird has the statistics of a {@creature roc}, but it obeys your simple commands and can't attack. It can carry up to 500 pounds while flying at its maximum speed (16 miles an hour for a maximum of 144 miles per day. with a one-hour rest for every 3 hours of flying), or 1,000 pounds at half that speed. The bird disappears after flying its maximum distance for a day or if it drops to 0 hit points. You can dismiss the bird as an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}.

item.name: Reincarnation Dust
entries: When you drink this clear potion, you gain two Fragments of Possibility, each of which looks like a Tiny, grayish bead of energy that follows you around, staying within 1 foot of you at all times. Each fragment lasts for 8 hours or until used.

When you make an {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir}, an {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir}, or a {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, you can expend your fragment to roll an additional {@dice d20} and choose which of the {@dice d20}s to use. Alternatively, when an {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} is made against you, you can expend your fragment to roll a {@dice d20} and choose which of the {@dice d20}s to use, the one you rolled or the one the attacker rolled.

If the original {@dice d20} roll has {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} or {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir}, you roll your {@dice d20} after {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} or {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} has been applied to the original roll.
While you have one or more Fragments of Possibility from this potion, you can't gain another Fragment of Possibility from any source.

item.name: Sage's Signet (Bear)
entries: This gilded ring bears a beautiful engraving and is imbued with powers of keen wisdom and foresight. While wearing this ring, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to cast the {@spell Augury|Ishiir} spell from the ring. Once you use the ring to cast the spell, the ring can't cast the spell again until the next dawn.

While wearing the Sage's Signet, you can cast the {@spell Enlarge/Reduce|Ishiir} and {@spell Polymorph|Ishiir} once each from the ring using your spellcasting ability. Once you cast each spell from the ring, the ring can't cast the spell again until the next dawn.

item.name: Sage's Signet (Wolf)
entries: This gilded ring bears a beautiful engraving and is imbued with powers of keen wisdom and foresight. While wearing this ring, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to cast the {@spell Augury|Ishiir} spell from the ring. Once you use the ring to cast the spell, the ring can't cast the spell again until the next dawn.

While wearing the Sage's Signet, you can cast the {@spell Freedom of Movement|Ishiir} and {@spell Pass without Trace|Ishiir} once each from the ring using your spellcasting ability. Once you cast each spell from the ring, the ring can't cast the spell again until the next dawn.

item.name: Ingot of the Skold Rune
entries: This appears to be a simple ingot of iron ore, about a foot long and a few inches across. Inspection of its surface reveals the faint, silvery outline of the skold (shield) rune. The ingot has the following properties, which work only while it's on your person.

entries.name: Runic Shield
entries: You have a +1 bonus to AC.

entries.name: Shield Bond
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, choose a creature that you can see within 30 feet of you, other than yourself. Until the end of your next turn, any damage the target takes is reduced to 1, but you take half the damage prevented in this way. The damage you take can't be reduced in any way. Once you use this property, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

entries.name: Shield Ward
entries: You can transfer the ingot's magic to a nonmagical item—a shield or a two-handed melee weapon-by tracing the skold rune there with your finger. The transfer takes 8 hours of work that requires the two items to be within 5 feet of each other. At the end, the ingot is destroyed, and the rune appears in silver on the chosen item, which gains a benefit based on its form:

items.name: Shield
items.entry: The shield is now a rare magic item that requires attunement. Its magic gives you a +1 bonus to AC, and the first time after each of your {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir|Long Rests} that damage reduces you to 0 hit points, you are instead reduced to 1 hit point. You must be wielding the shield to gain these benefits.

items.name: Weapon
items.entry: The weapon is now an uncommon magic weapon. It grants you a +1 bonus to AC while you're holding it.

item.name: Nightwalker Ward
item.reqAttune: by a creature of good alignment
entries: The Icon of Ravenloft is a 12-inch tall statuette made of the purest silver, weighing 10 pounds. It depicts a cleric kneeling in supplication.
The icon was given to Strahd by the archpriest Ciril Romulich, an old family friend, to consecrate the castle and its chapel.

While within 30 feet of the icon, a creature is under the effect of a {@spell Protection from Evil and Good|Ishiir} spell against fiends and undead. Only a creature attuned to the icon can use its other properties.

entries.name: Augury
entries: You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to cast an {@spell Augury|Ishiir} spell from the icon, with no material components required. Once used, this property can't be used again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Bane of the Undead
entries: You can use the icon as a holy symbol while using the Turn Undead or Turn the Unholy feature. If you do so, increase the save DC by 2.

entries.name: Cure Wounds
entries: While holding the icon, you can take an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to heal one creature that you can see within 30 feet of you. The target regains {@dice 3d8 + 3} hit points, unless it is an undead, a construct, or a fiend. Once used, this property can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Chest of Plenty
entries: An abracadabrus is an ornate, gemstone-studded wooden chest that weighs 25 pounds while empty. Its interior compartment is a cube measuring 1½ feet on a side.

The chest has 20 charges. A creature can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to touch the closed lid of the chest and expend 1 of the chest's charges while naming one or more nonmagical objects (including raw materials, foodstuffs, and liquids) worth a total of 1 gp or less. The named objects magically appear in the chest, provided they can all fit inside it and the chest doesn't contain anything else. For example, the chest can conjure a plate of strawberries, a bowl of hot soup, a flagon of water, a stuffed animal, or a bag of twenty caltrops. Food and drink conjured by the chest are delicious, and they spoil if not consumed after 24 hours. Gems and precious metals created by the chest disappear after 1 minute.

The chest regains {@dice 1d20} expended charges daily at dawn. If the item's last charge is expended, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the chest loses its magic (becoming an ordinary chest), and its gemstones turn to dust.

item.name: Libram of Soul and Flesh
entries: With covers made of skin and fittings of bone, this tome is cold to the touch, and it whispers faintly. When found, the book contains the following spells, which are wizard spells for you while you are attuned to the book: {@spell Animate Dead|Ishiir}, {@spell Circle of Death|Ishiir}, {@spell False Life|Ishiir}, {@spell Finger of Death|Ishiir}, {@spell Speak with Dead|Ishiir}, {@spell Summon Undead|Ishiir}, and {@spell Vampiric Touch|Ishiir}. It functions as a spellbook for you.
While you are holding the book, you can use it as a spellcasting focus for your wizard spells.
The book has 3 charges, and it regains {@dice 1d3} expended charges daily at dawn. You can use the charges in the following ways while holding it:

items: If you spend 1 minute studying the book, you can expend 1 charge to replace one of your prepared wizard spells with a different spell in the book. The new spell must be of the necromancy school.

As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can expend 1 charge to take on a semblance of undeath for 10 minutes. For the duration, you take on a deathly appearance, and undead creatures are indifferent to you, unless you have damaged them. You also appear undead to all outward inspection and to spells used to determine the target's status. The effect ends if you deal damage or force a creature to make a {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}.

item.name: Ring of Animal Influence
entries: This ring has 3 charges, and it regains {@dice 1d3} expended charges daily at dawn. While wearing the ring, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to expend 1 of its charges to cast one of the following spells:

items: {@spell Animal Friendship|Ishiir} (save DC 13)
{@spell Fear|Ishiir} (save DC 13), targeting only beasts that have an Intelligence of 3 or lower
{@spell Speak with Animals|Ishiir}

item.name: Flying Chariot
entries: The chariot's riders and creatures pulling the chariot gain a +1 bonus to their AC.
If this magic chariot is pulled by one or more flying creatures, it too can fly.

entries.name: Chariots
entries: Chariots and the creatures pulling them work like controlled mounts, as described in the mounted combat rules in the {@book Player's Handbook|PHB|9|Mounted Combat}, but with the following differences:

items: Mounting or dismounting a chariot costs you 5 feet of movement, rather than a number of feet equal to half your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir}.
Being mounted on a chariot grants you half cover.
A chariot's {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} is equal to the {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} of the slowest creature pulling it.
If multiple creatures are pulling the chariot, they all act on the same initiative, and they must take the same action on their turn.

item.name: Staff of Dragon Charming
entries: While holding the dragonstaff of Ahghairon, you have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} against the spells and breath weapons of dragons, as well as the breath weapons of other creatures of the dragon type (such as dragon turtles).

A creature of the dragon type that you touch with the staff can move through the city of Waterdeep, ignoring Ahghairon's dragonward (see "Ahghairon's Dragonward," in the Introduction). This effect lasts until the creature is touched again by the staff or until a time you proclaim when you confer the benefit.

The staff has 10 charges. While holding it, you can expend 1 charge as an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to cast the {@spell Command|Ishiir} spell. If you target a dragon with this casting, the dragon has {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on its {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. The staff regains {@dice 1d10} charges daily at dawn.

item.name: Wings of Flying
entries: While wearing this cloak, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to speak its command word. This turns the cloak into a pair of bat wings or bird wings on your back for 1 hour or until you repeat the command word as an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}. The wings give you a {@variantrule Fly Speed|Ishiir} of 60 feet. When they disappear, you can't use them again for {@dice 1d12} hours.

item.name: Wand of Enemy Detection
entries: This wand has 7 charges. While holding it, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} and expend 1 charge to speak its command word. For the next minute, you know the direction of the nearest creature hostile to you within 60 feet, but not its distance from you. The wand can sense the presence of hostile creatures that are ethereal, {@condition Invisible}, disguised, or hidden, as well as those in plain sight. The effect ends if you stop holding the wand.
The wand regains {@dice 1d6 + 1} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the wand crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

item.name: Gavel of the Venn Rune
entries: This wooden gavel is small by giant reckoning but nearly the size of a warhammer in human hands. The venn (friend) rune is inscribed in mithral in the base of the haft. Among giants, this item is used as part of rituals to resolve disputes. The gavel has the following properties.

entries.name: Arbiters Shield
entries: At the start of every combat, {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} against you have {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} before the start of your first turn, provided that the gavel is on your person.

entries.name: Bond of Amity
entries: As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can use the gavel to strike a point on a hard surface. The first time in the next minute that a creature within 60 feet of that point deals damage to another creature with an attack that hits, the attacker takes psychic damage equal to half the damage it dealt to the target. Once you use this property, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

entries.name: Gift of Truth
entries: You can transfer the gavel's magic to a place by tracing the venn rune on the ground with your finger. The point where you trace it becomes the center of a spherical area of magic that has a 30-foot radius and that is fixed to the place. The transfer takes 8 hours of work that requires the gavel to be within 5 feet of you. At the end, the gavel is destroyed, and the area gains the following property:
Whenever a creature utters a lie while within the 30-foot-radius sphere, that creature takes 5 psychic damage and flinches visibly.

item.name: Molten Bronze Skin
entries: This magical {@item breastplate armor|Ishiir} appears as a jug of molten bronze. When you attune to it, the bronze adheres and contours to your skin. The armor can be worn under normal clothes, but it doesn't impede bodily functions. Once you put it on, it can't be removed unless you choose to do so.

While wearing the armor, you have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to fire damage. The armor also doesn't impose {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks}.

item.name: Bead of Force
entries: This small black sphere measures ¾ of an inch in diameter and weighs an ounce. Typically, {@dice 1d4 + 4} {@italic beads of force} are found together.

You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to throw the bead up to 60 feet. The bead explodes on impact and is destroyed. Each creature within a 10-foot radius of where the bead landed must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or take {@damage 5d4} force damage. A sphere of transparent force then encloses the area for 1 minute. Any creature that failed the save and is completely within the area is trapped inside this sphere. Creatures that succeeded on the save, or are partially within the area, are pushed away from the center of the sphere until they are no longer inside it. Only breathable air can pass through the sphere's wall. No attack or other effect can.

An enclosed creature can use its action to push against the sphere's wall, moving the sphere up to half the creature's {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir}. The sphere can be picked up, and its magic causes it to weigh only 1 pound, regardless of the weight of creatures inside.

item.name: Bowl of Commanding Elementals
entries: While this bowl is filled with water, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to speak the bowl's command word and summon a {@creature water elemental}, as if you had cast the {@spell Conjure Elemental|Ishiir} spell. The bowl can't be used this way again until the next dawn.
The bowl is about 1 foot in diameter and half as deep. It weighs 3 pounds and holds about 3 gallons.

item.name: Charm of Plant Command
entries: This fist-sized charm is made from a bundle of dried plant stems wrapped in silver thread. Hung on a leather thong, it is typically worn around the neck or attached to a belt.

This charm has 3 charges. While you bear the charm, you can expend 1 charge as an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to cast the {@spell Speak with Plants|Ishiir} spell. For the duration of the spell, you also have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on Charisma {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks} made to influence the behavior, demeanor, and attitude of plants. The charm regains all expended charges at dawn each day.

item.name: Cloak of the Bat
entries: While wearing this cloak, you have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks}. In an area of dim light or darkness, you can grip the edges of the cloak with both hands and use it to fly at a {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} of 40 feet. If you ever fail to grip the cloak's edges while flying in this way, or if you are no longer in dim light or darkness, you lose this {@variantrule Fly Speed|Ishiir}.

While wearing the cloak in an area of dim light or darkness, you can use your action to cast {@spell Polymorph|Ishiir} on yourself, transforming into a {@creature bat}. While you are in the form of the {@creature bat}, you retain your Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores. The cloak can't be used this way again until the next dawn.

item.name: Guardian Emblem
entries: This emblem is the symbol of a deity or a spiritual tradition. As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can attach the emblem to a suit of armor or a shield or remove it.

The emblem has 3 charges. When you or a creature you can see within 30 feet of you suffers a critical hit while you're wearing the armor or wielding the shield that bears the emblem, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to expend 1 charge to turn the critical hit into a normal hit instead.
The emblem regains all expended charges daily at dawn.

item.name: Ring of Evasion
entries: This ring has 3 charges, and it regains {@dice 1d3} expended charges daily at dawn. When you fail a Dexterity {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} while wearing it, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to expend 1 of its charges to succeed on that {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} instead.

item.name: Ring of Spell Storing
entries: This ring stores spells cast into it, holding them until the attuned wearer uses them. The ring can store up to 5 levels worth of spells at a time. When found, it contains {@dice 1d6 - 1} levels of stored spells chosen by the DM.

Any creature can cast a spell of 1st through 5th level into the ring by touching the ring as the spell is cast. The spell has no effect, other than to be stored in the ring. If the ring can't hold the spell, the spell is expended without effect. The level of the slot used to cast the spell determines how much space it uses.

While wearing this ring, you can cast any spell stored in it. The spell uses the slot level, spell save DC, spell attack bonus, and spellcasting ability of the original caster, but is otherwise treated as if you cast the spell. The spell cast from the ring is no longer stored in it, freeing up space.

item.name: Steelskin Tattoo
entries: This tattoo depicts protective imagery and uses ink that resembles liquid metal. While you aren't wearing armor, the tattoo grants you an Armor Class of 18. You can use a shield and still gain this benefit.

entries.name: Tattoo Attunement
entries: To attune to this item, you hold the needle to your skin where you want the tattoo to appear, pressing the needle there throughout the attunement process. When the attunement is complete, the needle turns into the ink that becomes the tattoo, which appears on the skin. If you have multiple magic tattoos, they count as a single magic item with regard to the number of magic items you can attune to.
If your attunement to the tattoo ends, the tattoo vanishes, and the needle reappears in the closest unoccupied space to you.

item.name: Swift Greaves
entries: The greaves have 3 charges. While wearing these greaves, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to expend 1 charge to increase your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} by 30 feet, and you have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on Dexterity {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws}.
