These effects last for 1 minute. The greaves regain {@dice 1d3} expended charges daily at dawn.

item.name: Necklace of Fireballs
entries: This necklace has {@dice 1d6 + 3} beads hanging from it. You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to detach a bead and throw it up to 60 feet away. When it reaches the end of its trajectory, the bead detonates as a 3rd-level {@spell Fireball|Ishiir} spell (save DC 15).
You can hurl multiple beads, or even the whole necklace, as one action. When you do so, increase the level of the {@spell Fireball|Ishiir} by 1 for each bead beyond the first.

item.name: Necklace of Prayer Beads
item.reqAttune: by a cleric, druid, or paladin
entries: This necklace has {@dice 1d4 + 2} magic beads made from aquamarine, black pearl, or topaz. It also has many nonmagical beads made from stones such as amber, bloodstone, citrine, coral, jade, pearl, or quartz. If a magic bead is removed from the necklace, that bead loses its magic.

Six types of magic beads exist. The DM decides the type of each bead on the necklace or determines it randomly. A necklace can have more than one bead of the same type. To use one, you must be wearing the necklace. Each bead contains a spell that you can cast from it as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} (using your spell save DC if a save is necessary). Once a magic bead's spell is cast, that bead can't be used again until the next dawn.

rows: {@spell Cure Wounds|Ishiir} (2nd level) or {@spell Lesser Restoration|Ishiir}

item.name: Pipes of Haunting
entries: You must be {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir|proficient} with wind instruments to use these pipes. They have 3 charges. You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to play them and expend 1 charge to create an eerie, spellbinding tune. Each creature within 30 feet of you that hears you play must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or become {@condition Frightened|Ishiir} of you for 1 minute. If you wish, all creatures in the area that aren't hostile toward you automatically succeed on the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. A creature that fails the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} can repeat it at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. A creature that succeeds on its {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} is {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir|Immune} to the effect of these pipes for 24 hours. The pipes regain {@dice 1d3} expended charges daily at dawn.

item.name: Staff of Withering
item.reqAttune: by a cleric, druid, or warlock
entries: This staff has 3 charges and regains {@dice 1d3} expended charges daily at dawn.

The staff can be wielded as a magic quarterstaff. On a hit, it deals damage as a normal quarterstaff, and you can expend 1 charge to deal an extra {@damage 2d10} necrotic damage to the target. In addition, the target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or have {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} for 1 hour on any {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir} or {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} that uses Strength or Constitution.

item.name: Crystalline Chronicle
entries: An etched crystal sphere the size of a grapefruit hums faintly and pulses with irregular flares of inner light. While you are touching the crystal, you can retrieve and store information and spells within the crystal at the same rate as reading and writing. When found, the crystal contains the following spells: {@spell Detect Thoughts|Ishiir}, {@spell Intellect Fortress|Ishiir}, {@spell Rary's Telepathic Bond|Ishiir}, {@spell Sending|Ishiir}, {@spell Telekinesis|Ishiir}, {@spell Tasha's Mind Whip|Ishiir}, and {@spell Tenser's Floating Disk|Ishiir}. It functions as a spellbook for you, with its spells and other writing psychically encoded within it.

While you are holding the crystal, you can use it as a spellcasting focus for your wizard spells, and you know the {@spell Mage Hand|Ishiir}, {@spell Mind Sliver|Ishiir} (appears in this book), and {@spell Message|Ishiir} cantrips if you don't already know them.
The crystal has 3 charges, and it regains {@dice 1d3} expended charges daily at dawn. You can use the charges in the following ways while holding it:

items: If you spend 1 minute studying the information within the crystal, you can expend 1 charge to replace one of your prepared wizard spells with a different spell in the book.
When you cast a wizard spell, you can expend 1 charge to cast the spell without verbal, somatic, or material components of up to 100 gp value.

item.name: Fulminating Treatise
entries: This thick, scorched spellbook reeks of smoke and ozone, and sparks of energy crackles along the edges of its pages. When found, the book contains the following spells: {@spell Contingency|Ishiir}, {@spell Fireball|Ishiir}, {@spell Gust of Wind|Ishiir}, {@spell Leomund's Tiny Hut|Ishiir}, {@spell Magic Missile|Ishiir}, {@spell Thunderwave|Ishiir}, and {@spell Wall of Force|Ishiir}. It functions as a spellbook for you.
While you are holding the book, you can use it as a spellcasting focus for your wizard spells.
The book has 3 charges, and it regains {@dice 1d3} expended charges daily at dawn. You can use the charges in the following ways while holding it:

items: If you spend 1 minute studying the book, you can expend 1 charge to replace one of your prepared wizard spells with a different spell in the book. The new spell must be of the evocation school.

When one creature you can see takes damage from an evocation spell you cast, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} and expend 1 charge to deal an extra {@damage 2d6} force damage to the creature and knock the creature {@condition Prone|Ishiir} if it is Large or smaller.

item.name: Ruby Weave Gem
entries: While you are holding this gem, you can use it as a spellcasting focus for your spells.

The gem has 3 charges and regains all expended charges daily at dawn. When you cast a spell while holding this gem, you can expend up to 3 charges to ignore the spell's material components with a gold piece cost, up to 500 gp per charge expended.

When you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}, choose a spell from any class list. The spell you choose must be of a level you can cast. You know the chosen spell and can cast it with your spell slots of the appropriate level until the end of your next {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

item.name: Seeker's Orb
entries: This onyx sphere bears deep, spiraling grooves and dangles from an iron chain. While the orb is on your person, you gain the following benefits:

items: Your Wisdom score increases by 2, as does your maximum for that score.
You gain {@sense darkvision} out to a range of 60 feet. If you already have {@sense darkvision}, the orb increases its range by 60 feet.
You have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on Wisdom {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks} to find hidden doors and paths.

item.name: Stone of Good Luck
entries: While this polished agate is on your person, you gain a +1 bonus to {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|Ability Checks} and {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws}.

item.name: Wand of Wonder
entries: This wand has 7 charges. While holding it, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to expend 1 of its charges and choose a target within 120 feet of you. The target can be a creature, an object, or a point in space. Roll {@dice d100} and consult the following table to discover what happens.
If the effect causes you to cast a spell from the wand, the spell's save DC is 15. If the spell normally has a range expressed in feet, its range becomes 120 feet if it isn't already.
If an effect covers an area, you must center the spell on and include the target. If an effect has multiple possible subjects, the DM randomly determines which ones are affected.
The wand regains {@dice 1d6 + 1} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the wand crumbles into dust and is destroyed.

rows: You are {@condition Stunned|Ishiir} until the start of your next turn, believing something awesome just happened.
You cast {@spell Detect Thoughts|Ishiir} on the target you chose. If you didn't target a creature, you instead take {@damage 1d6} psychic damage.
Heavy rain falls in a 60-foot radius centered on the target. The area becomes lightly obscured. The rain falls until the start of your next turn.

An animal appears in the unoccupied space nearest the target. The animal isn't under your control and acts as it normally would. Roll a {@dice d100} to determine which animal appears. On a 01-25, a {@creature rhinoceros} appears; on a 26-50, an {@creature elephant} appears; and on a 51-100, a {@creature rat} appears.
A cloud of 600 oversized butterflies fills a 30-foot radius centered on the target. The area becomes heavily obscured. The butterflies remain for 10 minutes.
You enlarge the target as if you had cast {@spell Enlarge/reduce|Ishiir}. If the target can't be affected by that spell or if you didn't target a creature, you become the target.
Grass grows on the ground in a 60-foot radius centered on the target. If grass is already there, it grows to ten times its normal size and remains overgrown for 1 minute.
An object of the DM's choice disappears into the Ethereal Plane. The object must be neither worn nor carried, within 120 feet of the target, and no larger than 10 feet in any dimension.
You shrink yourself as if you had cast {@spell Enlarge/reduce|Ishiir} on yourself.

Leaves grow from the target. If you chose a point in space as the target, leaves sprout from the creature nearest to that point. Unless they are picked off, the leaves turn brown and fall off after 24 hours.

A stream of {@dice 1d4 × 10} gems, each worth 1 gp, shoots from the wand's tip in a line 30 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each gem deals 1 bludgeoning damage, and the total damage of the gems is divided equally among all creatures in the line.

A burst of colorful shimmering light extends from you in a 30-foot radius. You and each creature in the area that can see must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or become {@condition Blinded|Ishiir} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
The target's skin turns bright blue for {@dice 1d10} days. If you chose a point in space, the creature nearest to that point is affected.

If you targeted a creature, it must make a DC 15 Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. If you didn't target a creature, you become the target and must make the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. If the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} fails by 5 or more, the target is instantly {@condition Petrified|Ishiir}. On any other failed save, the target is {@condition Restrained|Ishiir} and begins to turn to stone. While {@condition Restrained|Ishiir} in this way, the target must repeat the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} at the end of its next turn, becoming {@condition Petrified|Ishiir} on a failure or ending the effect on a success. The petrification lasts until the target is freed by the {@spell Greater Restoration|Ishiir} spell or similar magic.

item.name: Staff of Defense
entries: This slender, hollow staff is made of glass yet is as strong as oak. It weighs 3 pounds. You must be attuned to the staff to gain its benefits and cast its spells.
While holding the staff, you have a +1 bonus to your Armor Class.

The staff has 10 charges, which are used to fuel the spells within it. With the staff in hand, you can use your action to cast one of the following spells from the staff if the spell is on your class's spell list: {@spell Mage Armor|Ishiir} (1 charge) or {@spell Shield|Ishiir} (2 charges). No components are required.
The staff regains {@dice 1d6 + 4} expended charges each day at dawn. If you expend the staff's last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the staff shatters and is destroyed.

item.name: Staff of Healing
item.reqAttune: by a bard, cleric, or druid
entries: This staff has 10 charges. While holding it, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it, using your spell save DC and spellcasting ability modifier: {@spell Cure Wounds|Ishiir} (1 charge per spell level, up to 4th), {@spell Lesser Restoration|Ishiir} (2 charges). or {@spell Mass Cure Wounds|Ishiir} (5 charges).
The staff regains {@dice 1d6 + 4} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1. the staff vanishes in a flash of light, lost forever.

item.name: Wand of Web
entries: This wand has 7 charges. While holding it, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to expend 1 of its charges to cast the {@spell Web|Ishiir} spell (save DC 15) from it.
The wand regains {@dice 1d6 + 1} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the wand crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

item.name: Staff of Charming
item.reqAttune: by a bard, cleric, druid, sorcerer, warlock, or wizard
entries: While holding this staff, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to expend 1 of its 10 charges to cast {@spell Charm Person|Ishiir}, {@spell Command|Ishiir}, or {@spell Comprehend Languages|Ishiir} from it using your spell save DC. The staff can also be used as a magic quarterstaff.

If you are holding the staff and fail a {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against an enchantment spell that targets only you, you can turn your failed save into a successful one. You can't use this property of the staff again until the next dawn. If you succeed on a save against an enchantment spell that targets only you, with or without the staff's intervention, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to expend 1 charge from the staff and turn the spell back on its caster as if you had cast the spell.
The staff regains {@dice 1d8 + 2} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the staff becomes a nonmagical quarterstaff.

item.name: Amulet of Health
entries: Your Constitution score is 19 while you wear this amulet. It has no effect on you if your Constitution score is already 19 or higher without it.
{@b Masterwork}: Your Constitution score becomes 20 instead.

item.name: Atlas of Endless Horizons
entries: This thick book is bound in dark leather, crisscrossed with inlaid silver lines suggesting a map or chart. When found, the book contains the following spells, which are wizard spells for you while you are attuned to the book: {@spell Arcane Gate|Ishiir}, {@spell Dimension Door|Ishiir}, {@spell Gate|Ishiir}, {@spell Misty Step|Ishiir}, {@spell Plane Shift|Ishiir}, {@spell Teleportation Circle|Ishiir}, and {@spell Word of Recall|Ishiir}. It functions as a spellbook for you.
While you are holding the book, you can use it as a spellcasting focus for your wizard spells.
The book has 3 charges, and it regains {@dice 1d3} expended charges daily at dawn. You can use the charges in the following ways while holding it:

items: If you spend 1 minute studying the book, you can expend 1 charge to replace one of your prepared wizard spells with a different spell in the book. The new spell must be of the conjuration school.

When you are hit by an attack, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to expend 1 charge to teleport up to 10 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. If your new position is out of range of the attack, it misses you.

item.name: Belt of Strength
entries: While wearing this belt, your Strength score changes to 21. The item has no effect on you if your Strength without the belt is equal to or greater than the belt's score.

item.name: Bracers of Swiftness
entries: Your Dexterity score is 19 while you wear these bracers. It has no effect on you if your Dexterity is already 19 or higher without it.

item.name: Greater Molten Bronze Skin
entries: This magical {@item halfplate armor|Ishiir} appears as a jug of molten bronze. When you attune to it, the bronze adheres and contours to your skin. The armor can be worn under normal clothes, but it doesn't impede bodily functions. Once you put it on, it can't be removed unless you choose to do so.

While wearing the armor, you have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to fire damage. The armor also doesn't impose {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks}.

item.name: Naushindhor's Stone: Absorption
entries: An {@italic Ioun stone} is named after Ioun, a god of knowledge and prophecy revered on some worlds. Many types of {@italic Ioun stone} exist, each type a distinct combination of shape and color.

When you use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to toss one of these stones into the air, the stone orbits your head at a distance of {@dice 1d3} feet and confers a benefit to you. Thereafter, another creature must use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to grasp or net the stone to separate it from you, either by making a successful {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} against AC 24 or a successful DC 24 Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check. You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to seize and stow the stone, ending its effect.
A stone has AC 24, 10 hit points, and {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to all damage. It is considered to be an object that is being worn while it orbits your head.
While this pale lavender ellipsoid orbits your head, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to cancel a spell of 4th level or lower cast by a creature you can see and targeting only you.

Once the stone has canceled 20 levels of spells, it burns out and turns dull gray, losing its magic. If you are targeted by a spell whose level is higher than the number of spell levels the stone has left, the stone can't cancel it.

item.name: Orb of the Stein Rune
entries: This orb of granite is about the size of an adult human's fist. The stein (stone) rune appears on it in the form of crystalline veins that run across the surface. The orb has the following properties, which work only while it's on your person.

entries.name: Indomitable Stand
entries: As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can channel the orb's magic to hold your ground. For the next minute or until you move any distance, you have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on all {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks} and {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} to resist effects that force you to move. In addition, any enemy that moves to a space within 10 feet of you must succeed on a DC 12 Strength {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or be unable to move any farther this turn.

entries.name: Stone Soul
entries: You can't be {@condition Petrified|Ishiir}.

entries.name: Earthen Step
entries: You can cast {@spell Meld into Stone|Ishiir} as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}. Once you use this property, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

entries.name: Gift of Stone
entries: You can transfer the orb's magic to a nonmagical item—a shield or a pair of boots—by tracing the stein rune there with your finger. The transfer takes 8 hours of work that requires the two items to be within 5 feet of each other. At the end, the orb is destroyed, and the rune appears in silver on the chosen item, which gains a benefit based on its form:

items.name: Shield
items.entry: The shield is now a rare magic item that requires attunement. While you wield it, you have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to all damage dealt by ranged weapon attacks.

items.name: Boots
items.entry: The pair of boots is now an uncommon magic item that requires attunement. While you wear the boots, you have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on Strength {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws}, and you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to avoid being knocked {@condition Prone|Ishiir}.

item.name: Periapt of Wisdom
entries: Your Wisdom score is 19 while you wear this periapt. It has no effect on you if your Wisdom is already 19 or higher without it.

item.name: Astromancy Archive
entries: This brass disc of articulated, concentric rings unfolds into an armillary sphere. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can unfold it into the sphere or back into a disc. When found, it contains the following spells, which are wizard spells for you while you are attuned to it: {@spell Augury|Ishiir}, {@spell Divination|Ishiir}, {@spell Find the Path|Ishiir}, {@spell Foresight|Ishiir}, {@spell Locate Creature|Ishiir}, and {@spell Locate Object|Ishiir}. It functions as a spellbook for you, with spells encoded on the rings.
While you are holding the archive, you can use it as a spellcasting focus for your wizard spells.
The archive has 3 charges, and it regains {@dice 1d3} expended charges daily at dawn. You can use the charges in the following ways while holding it:

items: If you spend 1 minute studying the archive, you can expend 1 charge to replace one of your prepared wizard spells with a different spell in the archive. The new spell must be of the divination school.

When a creature you can see within 30 feet of you makes an {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir}, an {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir}, or a {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to expend 1 charge and force the creature to roll a {@dice d4} and apply the number rolled as a bonus or penalty (your choice) to the original roll. You can do this after you see the roll but before its effects are applied.

item.name: Duplicitious Manuscript
entries: To you, this book is a magical spellbook. To anyone else, the book appears to be a volume of verbose romance fiction. As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can change the book's appearance and alter the plot of the romance.

When found, the book contains the following spells: {@spell Hallucinatory Terrain|Ishiir}, {@spell Major Image|Ishiir}, {@spell Mirror Image|Ishiir}, {@spell Mislead|Ishiir}, {@spell Nystul's Magic Aura|Ishiir}, {@spell Phantasmal Force|Ishiir}, and {@spell Silent Image|Ishiir}. It functions as a spellbook for you.
While you are holding the book, you can use it as a spellcasting focus for your wizard spells.
The book has 3 charges, and it regains {@dice 1d3} expended charges daily at dawn. You can use the charges in the following ways while holding it:

items: If you spend 1 minute studying the book, you can expend 1 charge to replace one of your prepared wizard spells with a different spell in the book. The new spell must be of the illusion school.

When a creature you can see makes an Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check to discern the true nature of an illusion spell you cast, or makes a {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against an illusion spell you cast, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} and expend 1 charge to impose {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on the roll.

item.name: Wand of Fear
entries: This wand has 7 charges for the following properties. It regains {@dice 1d6 + 1} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the wand crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

entries.name: Command
entries: While holding the wand, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to expend 1 charge and command another creature to flee or grovel, as with the {@spell Command|Ishiir} spell (save DC 15).

entries.name: Cone of Fear
entries: While holding the wand, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to expend 2 charges, causing the wand's tip to emit a 60-foot cone of amber light. Each creature in the cone must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or become {@condition Frightened|Ishiir} of you for 1 minute. While it is {@condition Frightened|Ishiir} in this way, a creature must spend its turns trying to move as far away from you as it can, and it can't willingly move to a space within 30 feet of you. It also can't take {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir|Reactions}. For its action, it can use only the {@action Dash} action or try to escape from an effect that prevent it from moving. If it has nowhere it can move, the creature can use the {@action Dodge} action. At the end of each of its turns, a creature can repeat the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, ending the effect on itself on a success.

item.name: Arcane Grimoire +1
entries: While you are holding this leather-bound book, you can use it as a spellcasting focus for your wizard spells, and you gain a +1 bonus to spell {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} and to the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} DCs of your wizard spells.
You can use this book as a spellbook. In addition, when you use your Arcane Recovery feature, you can increase the number of spell slot levels you regain by 1.

item.name: Ebonhand Tattoo
entries: Produced by a special needle, this magic tattoo depicts clawlike forms and other jagged shapes.

entries.name: Tattoo Attunement
entries: To attune to this item, you hold the needle to your skin where you want the tattoo to appear, pressing the needle there throughout the attunement process. When the attunement is complete, the needle turns into the ink that becomes the tattoo, which appears on the skin.
If your attunement to the tattoo ends, the tattoo vanishes, and the needle reappears in your space.

entries.name: Magical Strikes
entries: While the tattoo is on your skin, your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|Ishiir|Unarmed Strikes} are considered magical for the purpose of overcoming {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir} and {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to nonmagical attacks, and you gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls with {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|Ishiir|Unarmed Strikes}.

entries.name: Eldritch Maul
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can empower the tattoo for 1 minute. For the duration, each of your melee attacks with a weapon or an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|Ishiir} can reach a target up to 15 feet away from you, as inky tendrils launch toward the target. In addition, your melee attacks deal an extra {@damage 1d6} force damage on a hit. Once used, this {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Rogue's Mantle
entries: This dark, hooded mantle of thick cloth is infused with secretive and deceptive magic. While wearing it, you gain the following benefits:

items.name: Darkvision
entries: You gain {@sense darkvision} within a range of 60 feet. If you already have {@sense darkvision}, the mantle increases your {@sense darkvision}'s range by 60 feet instead.

items.name: Move in Shadows
entries: While you are in {@quickref Vision and Light||2||dim light} or darkness, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to teleport, along with anything you are wearing or carrying, up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see that is also in {@quickref Vision and Light||2||dim light} or darkness. You then have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on the first melee attack you make before the end of the turn.

items.name: Willful Enmity
entries: You can cast the {@spell Antagonize|Ishiir} spell (save DC 15) from the mantle. Once the mantle has cast the spell, it can't cast the spell again until the next dawn.

item.name: Instrument of the Bards: Mac-Fuirmidh Cittern
entries: An instrument of the bards is an exquisite example of its kind, superior to an ordinary instrument in every way. Seven types of these instruments exist, each named after a legendary bard college. A creature that attempts to play the instrument without being attuned to it must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or take {@damage 2d4} psychic damage.

You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to play the instrument and cast one of its spells. Once the instrument has been used to cast a spell, it can't be used to cast that spell again until the next dawn. The spells use your spellcasting ability and spell save DC.

You can play the instrument while casting a spell that causes any of its targets to be {@condition Charmed|Ishiir} on a failed {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, thereby imposing {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on the save. This effect applies only if the spell has a somatic or a material component.
All instruments of the bards can be used to cast the following spells: {@spell Fly|Ishiir}, {@spell Invisibility|Ishiir}, {@spell Levitate|Ishiir}, and {@spell Protection from Evil and Good|Ishiir}.
In addition, the Mac-Fuirmidh cittern can be used to cast {@spell Barkskin|Ishiir}, {@spell Cure Wounds|Ishiir}, and {@spell Fog Cloud|Ishiir}.

item.name: Cauldron of Rebirth
entries: This Tiny pot bears relief scenes of heroes on its cast iron sides. You can use the cauldron as a spellcasting focus for your spells, and it functions as a suitable component for the {@spell Scrying|Ishiir} spell. When you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}, you can use the cauldron to create a {@item potion of healing (greater)|Ishiir}. The potion lasts for 24 hours, then loses its magic if not consumed.

As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can cause the cauldron to grow large enough for a Medium creature to crouch within. You can revert the cauldron to its normal size as an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, harmlessly shunting anything that can't fit inside to the nearest unoccupied space.

If you place the corpse of a humanoid into the cauldron and cover the corpse with 200 pounds of salt (which costs 10 gp) for at least 8 hours, the salt is consumed and the creature returns to life as if by {@spell Raise Dead|Ishiir} at the next dawn. Once used, this property can't be used again for 7 days.

item.name: Cloak of Arachnida
entries: This fine garment is made of black silk interwoven with faint silvery threads. While wearing it, you gain the following benefits:

items: You have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to poison damage.
You have a {@variantrule Climb Speed|Ishiir} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir}.
You can move up, down, and across vertical surfaces and upside down along ceilings, while leaving your hands free.
You can't be caught in webs of any sort and can move through webs as if they were {@quickref difficult terrain||3}.

You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to cast the {@spell Web|Ishiir} spell (save DC 13). The web created by the spell fills twice its normal area. Once used, this property of the cloak can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Instrument of the Bards: Fochlucan Bandore
entries: An instrument of the bards is an exquisite example of its kind, superior to an ordinary instrument in every way. Seven types of these instruments exist, each named after a legendary bard college. A creature that attempts to play the instrument without being attuned to it must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or take {@damage 2d4} psychic damage.

You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to play the instrument and cast one of its spells. Once the instrument has been used to cast a spell, it can't be used to cast that spell again until the next dawn. The spells use your spellcasting ability and spell save DC.

You can play the instrument while casting a spell that causes any of its targets to be {@condition Charmed|Ishiir} on a failed {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, thereby imposing {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on the save. This effect applies only if the spell has a somatic or a material component.
All instruments of the bards can be used to cast the following spells: {@spell Fly|Ishiir}, {@spell Invisibility|Ishiir}, {@spell Levitate|Ishiir}, and {@spell Protection from Evil and Good|Ishiir}.
In addition, the Fochlucan bandore can be used to cast {@spell Entangle|Ishiir}, {@spell Faerie Fire|Ishiir}, {@spell Shillelagh|Ishiir}, and {@spell Speak with Animals|Ishiir}.

item.name: Wand of Binding
entries: This wand has 7 charges for the following properties. It regains {@dice 1d6 + 1} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the wand crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

entries.name: Spells
entries: While holding the wand, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to expend some of its charges to cast one of the following spells (save DC 17): {@spell Hold Monster|Ishiir} (5 charges) or {@spell Hold Person|Ishiir} (2 charges).

entries.name: Assisted Escape
entries: While holding the wand, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to expend 1 charge and gain {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on a {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} you make to avoid being {@condition Paralyzed|Ishiir} or {@condition Restrained|Ishiir}, or you can expend 1 charge and gain {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on any check you make to escape a grapple.

item.name: Rhythm-Maker's Drum
entries: While holding this {@item drum|PHB}, you gain a +1 bonus to spell {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} and to the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} DCs of your bard spells.

As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can play the {@item drum|PHB} to regain one use of your Bardic Inspiration feature. This property of the {@item drum|PHB} can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Ring of Spell Turning
entries: While wearing this ring, you have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} against any spell that targets only you (not in an area of effect). In addition, if you roll a 20 for the save and the spell is 7th level or lower, the spell has no effect on you and instead targets the caster, using the slot level, spell save DC, attack bonus, and spellcasting ability of the caster.

item.name: Wand of the War Mage
entries: While you are holding this wand, you gain a +1 bonus to spell {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls}. In addition, you ignore half cover when making a spell attack.

item.name: Staff of the Ivory Claw
entries: This gray-and-cerulean staff is topped with a small dragon claw carved from ivory. While holding the staff, you gain a +1 bonus to spell {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls}. Whenever you score a critical hit with a spell attack, the target takes an extra {@damage 3d6} radiant damage.

item.name: Instrument of the Bards: Doss Lute
entries: An instrument of the bards is an exquisite example of its kind, superior to an ordinary instrument in every way. Seven types of these instruments exist, each named after a legendary bard college. A creature that attempts to play the instrument without being attuned to it must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or take {@damage 2d4} psychic damage.

You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to play the instrument and cast one of its spells. Once the instrument has been used to cast a spell, it can't be used to cast that spell again until the next dawn. The spells use your spellcasting ability and spell save DC.

You can play the instrument while casting a spell that causes any of its targets to be {@condition Charmed|Ishiir} on a failed {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, thereby imposing {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on the save. This effect applies only if the spell has a somatic or a material component.
All instruments of the bards can be used to cast the following spells: {@spell Fly|Ishiir}, {@spell Invisibility|Ishiir}, {@spell Levitate|Ishiir}, and {@spell Protection from Evil and Good|Ishiir}.
In addition, the Doss lute can be used to cast {@spell Animal Friendship|Ishiir}, {@spell Protection from Energy|Ishiir} (fire only), and {@spell Protection from Poison|Ishiir}.

item.name: Elemental Essence Shard (Earth)
entries: This crackling crystal contains the essence of an elemental plane. As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can attach the shard to a Tiny object (such as a weapon or a piece of jewelry) or detach it. It falls off if your attunement to it ends. You can use the shard as a spellcasting focus while you hold or wear it.
When you use a Metamagic option on a spell while you are holding or wearing the shard, you can use the following property:

entries.name: Property
entries: You gain {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to a damage type of your choice until the start of your next turn.

item.name: Elemental Essence Shard (Water)
entries: This crackling crystal contains the essence of an elemental plane. As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can attach the shard to a Tiny object (such as a weapon or a piece of jewelry) or detach it. It falls off if your attunement to it ends. You can use the shard as a spellcasting focus while you hold or wear it.
When you use a Metamagic option on a spell while you are holding or wearing the shard, you can use the following property:

entries.name: Property
entries: You create a wave of water that bursts out from you in a 10-foot radius. Each creature of your choice that you can see in that area takes {@damage 2d6} cold damage and must succeed on a Strength {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against your spell save DC or be pushed 10 feet away from you and fall {@condition Prone|Ishiir}.

item.name: Moon Sickle +1
entries: This silver-bladed sickle glimmers softly with moonlight. While holding the weapon, you gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it, and you gain a +1 bonus to spell {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} and the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} DCs of your druid and ranger spells. In addition, you can use the sickle as a spellcasting focus for your druid and ranger spells.
When you cast a spell that restores hit points, you can roll a {@dice d4} and add the number rolled to the amount of hit points restored, provided you are holding the sickle.

item.name: Opal of the Ild Rune
entries: This triangular fire opal measures about three inches on each side and is half an inch thick. The ild (fire) rune shimmers within its core, causing it to be slightly warm to the touch. The opal has the following properties, which work only while it's on your person.

entries.name: Ignite
entries: As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can ignite an object within 10 feet of you. The object must be flammable, and the fire starts in a circle no larger than 1 foot in diameter.

entries.name: Fires Friend
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to cold damage.

entries.name: Fire Tamer
entries: As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can extinguish any open flame within 10 feet of you. You choose how much fire to extinguish in that radius.

entries.name: Gift of Flame
entries: You can transfer the opal's magic to a nonmagical item—a weapon or a suit of armor—by tracing the ild rune there with your finger. The transfer takes 8 hours of work that requires the two items to be within 5 feet of each other. At the end, the opal is destroyed, and the rune appears in red on the chosen item, which gains a benefit based on its form:

items.name: Weapon
items.entry: The weapon is now an uncommon magic weapon. It deals an extra {@damage 1d6} fire damage to any target it hits.

items.name: Armor
items.entry: The armor is now a rare magic item that requires attunement. You have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to cold damage while wearing the armor.

item.name: Shard of Madness
entries: This writhing crystal is steeped in the warped essence of the Far Realm. As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can attach the shard to a Tiny object (such as a weapon or a piece of jewelry) or detach it. It falls off if your attunement to it ends. You can use the shard as a spellcasting focus while you hold or wear it.

When you use a Metamagic option on a spell while you are holding or wearing the shard, you can cause a slimy tentacle to rip through the fabric of reality and strike one creature you can see within 30 feet of you. The creature must succeed on a Charisma {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against your spell save DC or take {@damage 3d6} psychic damage and become {@condition Frightened|Ishiir} of you until the start of your next turn.

item.name: Stonespeaker Crystal
entries: Created by the stone giant librarians of Gravenhollow, this nineteen-inch-long shard of quartz grants you {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks} while it is on your person.

The crystal has 10 charges. While holding it, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to expend some of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it: {@spell Speak with Animals|Ishiir} (2 charges), {@spell Speak with Dead|Ishiir} (4 charges), or {@spell Speak with Plants|Ishiir} (3 charges).

When you cast a {@filter divination|spells|school=D} spell, you can use the crystal in place of one material component that would normally be consumed by the spell, at a cost of 1 charge per level of the spell. The crystal is not consumed when used in this way.
The crystal regains {@dice 1d6 + 4} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the crystal's last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the crystal vanishes, lost forever.

item.name: Bracer of Flying Daggers
entries: This armband appears to have thin {@item dagger|Ishiir|daggers} strapped to it. As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can pull up to two magic daggers from the bracer and immediately hurl them, making a ranged attack with each dagger. A dagger vanishes if you don't hurl it right away, and the daggers disappear right after they hit or miss. The bracer never runs out of daggers.

item.name: Figurine of Wondrous Power: Golden Saber Cats
entries: A figurine of wondrous power is a statuette of a beast small enough to fit in a pocket. If you use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to speak the command word and throw the figurine to a point on the ground within 60 feet of you, the figurine becomes a living creature. If the space where the creature would appear is occupied by other creatures or objects, or if there isn't enough space for the creature, the figurine doesn't become a creature.
The creature is friendly to you and your companions. It understands your languages and obeys your spoken commands. If you issue no commands, the creature defends itself but takes no other actions.

The creature exists for a duration specific to each figurine. At the end of the duration, the creature reverts to its figurine form. It reverts to a figurine early if it drops to 0 hit points or if you use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to speak the command word again while touching it. When the creature becomes a figurine again, its property can't be used again until a certain amount of time has passed, as specified in the figurine's description.
{@creature lion||Golden Lions}.

These gold statuettes of lions are always created in pairs. You can use one figurine or both simultaneously. Each can become a {@creature lion} for up to 1 hour. Once a {@creature lion} has been used, it can't be used again until 7 days have passed.

item.name: Gem of Seeing
entries: This gem has 3 charges. As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can speak the gem's command word and expend 1 charge. For the next 10 minutes, you have {@sense truesight} out to 120 feet when you peer through the gem.
The gem regains {@dice 1d3} expended charges daily at dawn.

item.name: Ring of Regeneration
entries: While wearing this ring, you regain {@dice 1d6} hit points every 10 minutes, provided that you have at least 1 hit point. If you lose a body part, the ring causes the missing part to regrow and return to full functionality after {@dice 1d6 + 1} days if you have at least 1 hit point the whole time.

item.name: Ring of Telekinesis
entries: While wearing this ring, you can cast the {@spell Telekinesis|Ishiir} spell at will, but you can target only objects that aren't being worn or carried.

item.name: Sage's Signet (Hart)
entries: This gilded ring bears a beautiful engraving and is imbued with powers of keen wisdom and foresight. While wearing this ring, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to cast the {@spell Augury|Ishiir} spell from the ring. Once you use the ring to cast the spell, the ring can't cast the spell again until the next dawn.

While wearing the Sage's Signet, you can cast the {@spell Aura of Vitality|Ishiir} and {@spell Mass Cure Wounds|Ishiir} once each from the ring using your spellcasting ability. Once you cast each spell from the ring, the ring can't cast the spell again until the next dawn.

item.name: Sage's Signet (Lion)
entries: This gilded ring bears a beautiful engraving and is imbued with powers of keen wisdom and foresight. While wearing this ring, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to cast the {@spell Augury|Ishiir} spell from the ring. Once you use the ring to cast the spell, the ring can't cast the spell again until the next dawn.

While wearing the Sage's Signet, you can cast the {@spell Destructive Wave|Ishiir} and {@spell Fireball|Ishiir} once each from the ring using your spellcasting ability. Once you cast each spell from the ring, the ring can't cast the spell again until the next dawn.

item.name: Supreme Molten Bronze Skin
entries: This magical {@item full plate Armor|Ishiir} appears as a jug of molten bronze. When you attune to it, the bronze adheres and contours to your skin. The armor can be worn under normal clothes, but it doesn't impede bodily functions. Once you put it on, it can't be removed unless you choose to do so.

While wearing the armor, you have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to fire damage. The armor also doesn't impose {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks}.

item.name: Tentacle Rod
entries: Made by the {@creature drow}, this rod is a magic weapon that ends in three rubbery tentacles. While holding the rod, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to direct each tentacle to attack a creature you can see within 15 feet of you. Each tentacle makes a melee {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} with a +9 bonus. On a hit, the tentacle deals {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage. If you hit a target with all three tentacles, it must make a DC 15 Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. On a failure, the creature's {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} is halved, it has {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on Dexterity {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws}, and it can't use {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir|Reactions} for 1 minute. Moreover, on each of its turns, it can take either an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} or a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, but not both. At the end of each of its turns, it can repeat the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, ending the effect on itself on a success.

item.name: Wraps of Unarmed Prowess +1
entries: While you're wearing these cloth wraps, your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|Ishiir|Unarmed Strikes} are considered magical for the purpose of overcoming {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir} and {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to nonmagical attacks and damage, and you gain a +1 bonus to the attack and damage rolls of your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|Ishiir|Unarmed Strikes}.

item.name: Amulet of the Devout +1
entries: This amulet bears the symbol of a deity inlaid with precious stones or metals. While you wear the holy symbol, you gain a +1 bonus to spell {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} and the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} DCs of your spells.
While you wear this amulet, you can use your Channel Divinity feature without expending one of the feature's uses. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Bloodwell Vial +1
entries: To attune to this vial, you must place a few drops of your blood into it. The vial can't be opened while your attunement to it lasts. If your attunement to the vial ends, the contained blood turns to ash. You can use the vial as a spellcasting focus for your spells while wearing or holding it, and you gain a +1 bonus to spell {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} and to the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} DCs of your sorcerer spells.
In addition, when you roll any Hit Dice to recover hit points while you are carrying the vial, you can regain 5 sorcery points. This property of the vial can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Dragonhide Belt +1
entries: This finely detailed belt is made of dragonhide. While wearing it, you gain a +1 bonus to the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} DCs of your ki features. In addition, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to regain ki points equal to a roll of your Martial Arts die. You can't use this action again until the next dawn.

item.name: Cloak of Protection
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to AC and {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} while you wear this cloak.

item.name: Naushindhor's Stone of Mastery
entries: An {@italic Ioun stone} is named after Ioun, a god of knowledge and prophecy revered on some worlds. Many types of {@italic Ioun stone} exist, each type a distinct combination of shape and color.

When you use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to toss one of these stones into the air, the stone orbits your head at a distance of {@dice 1d3} feet and confers a benefit to you. Thereafter, another creature must use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to grasp or net the stone to separate it from you, either by making a successful {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} against AC 24 or a successful DC 24 Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check. You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to seize and stow the stone, ending its effect.
A stone has AC 24, 10 hit points, and {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to all damage. It is considered to be an object that is being worn while it orbits your head.
Your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus increases by 1 while this pale green prism orbits your head.

item.name: Ring of Protection
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to AC and {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} while wearing this ring.

item.name: Sentinel Amulet
entries: A badge of the Watch is given only to those who have earned the trust of the Open Lord of Waterdeep. The badge, signifying the rank of captain in Waterdeep's City Watch, bears the emblem of Waterdeep and is meant to be worn or carried.
While wearing the badge, you gain a +2 bonus to AC if you aren't using a {@item shield|Ishiir}.

If the badge is more than 5 feet away from you for more than 1 minute, it vanishes and harmlessly reappears on a surface within 5 feet of the Open Lord. While holding the badge, the Open Lord knows your location, provided the two of you are on the same plane of existence and your attunement to the badge hasn't ended.
As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, the Open Lord can touch the badge and end your attunement to it.

item.name: Sundering Sphere
entries: This marble-size crystal sphere glows with extraplanar energy.

As part of attuning to this item, you press the crystal sphere to the hilt of a nonmagical melee weapon of your choice, magically attaching the sphere to the weapon. The weapon becomes a magic weapon with a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls. While wielding this weapon, you gain the following benefits:

items.name: Dimensional Anchor
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} against spells or effects that would send you to an extradimensional space, a demiplane, or another plane of existence against your will.

items.name: Isolating Smite
entries: When you hit a creature with this weapon, you can force the creature to make a DC 16 Charisma {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. On a failed save, the creature is banished to a harmless demiplane until the end of its next turn. When the banished creature returns, it reappears in the space it left or the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.
When you end your attunement to the sphere, the sphere harmlessly detaches from the weapon, and the weapon reverts to a nonmagical piece of equipment.

item.name: Heart Weaver's Primer
entries: This pristine book smells faintly of a random scent you find pleasing. When found, the book contains the following spells: {@spell Antipathy/sympathy|Ishiir}, {@spell Charm Person|Ishiir}, {@spell Dominate Person|Ishiir}, {@spell Enthrall|Ishiir}, {@spell Hypnotic Pattern|Ishiir}, {@spell Modify Memory|Ishiir}, and {@spell Suggestion|Ishiir}. It functions as a spellbook for you.
While you are holding the book, you can use it as a spellcasting focus for your wizard spells.
The book has 3 charges, and it regains {@dice 1d3} expended charges daily at dawn. You can use the charges in the following ways while holding it:

items: If you spend 1 minute studying the book, you can expend 1 charge to replace one of your prepared wizard spells with a different spell in the book. The new spell must be of the enchantment school.
When you cast an enchantment spell, you can expend 1 charge to impose {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on the first {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} one target makes against the spell.

item.name: Crystal Ball
entries: This crystal ball is about 6 inches in diameter. While touching it, you can cast the {@spell Scrying|Ishiir} spell (save DC 17) with it.

item.name: Absorbing Tattoo
entries: This tattoo incorporates designs that emphasize one color more than others. While the tattoo is on your skin, you have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to a type of damage associated with that color, as shown on the table below. The DM chooses the color or determines it randomly.

entries.name: Damage Absorption
entries: When you take damage of the chosen type, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to gain {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir} against that instance of the damage, and you regain a number of hit points equal to half the damage you would have taken. Once this {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Tattoo Attunement
entries: To attune to this item, you hold the needle to your skin where you want the tattoo to appear, pressing the needle there throughout the attunement process. When the attunement is complete, the needle turns into the ink that becomes the tattoo, which appears on the skin. If you have multiple magic tattoos, they count as a single magic item with regard to the number of magic items you can attune to.
If your attunement to the tattoo ends, the tattoo vanishes, and the needle reappears in the closest unoccupied space to you.

item.name: Belt of Dwarvenkind
entries: While wearing this belt, you gain the following benefits:

items: Your Constitution score increases by 2, to a maximum of 20.
You have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks} made to interact with dwarves.

entries: In addition, while attuned to the belt, you have a {@chance 50} chance each day at dawn of growing a full beard if you're capable of growing one, or a visibly thicker beard if you already have one.
If you aren't a dwarf, you gain the following additional benefits while wearing the belt:

items: You have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} against poison, and you have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} against poison damage.
You have {@sense darkvision} out to a range of 60 feet.
You can speak, read, and write Dwarvish.

item.name: Shadowmantle Tattoo
entries: Produced by a special needle, this magic tattoo is dark in color and abstract.

entries.name: Tattoo Attunement
entries: To attune to this item, you hold the needle to your skin where you want the tattoo to appear, pressing the needle there throughout the attunement process. When the attunement is complete, the needle turns into the ink that becomes the tattoo, which appears on the skin.
If your attunement to the tattoo ends, the tattoo vanishes, and the needle reappears in your space.

entries.name: Shadow Essence
entries: You gain {@sense darkvision} with a range of 60 feet, and you have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks}.

entries.name: Shadowy Defense
entries: When you take damage, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to become insubstantial for a moment, halving the damage you take. Then the {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} can't be used again until the next sunset.

item.name: Gem of Brightness
entries: This prism has 50 charges. While you are holding it, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to speak one of three command words to cause one of the following effects:

items: The first command word causes the gem to shed bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. This effect doesn't expend a charge. It lasts until you use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to repeat the command word or until you use another function of the gem.

The second command word expends 1 charge and causes the gem to fire a brilliant beam of light at one creature you can see within 60 feet of you. The creature must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or become {@condition Blinded|Ishiir} for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

The third command word expends 5 charges and causes the gem to flare with blinding light in a 30-foot cone originating from it. Each creature in the cone must make a {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} as if struck by the beam created with the second command word.

entries: When all of the gem's charges are expended, the gem becomes a nonmagical jewel worth 50 gp.

item.name: Instrument of Bards: Canaith Mandolin
entries: An instrument of the bards is an exquisite example of its kind, superior to an ordinary instrument in every way. Seven types of these instruments exist, each named after a legendary bard college. A creature that attempts to play the instrument without being attuned to it must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or take {@damage 2d4} psychic damage.

You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to play the instrument and cast one of its spells. Once the instrument has been used to cast a spell, it can't be used to cast that spell again until the next dawn. The spells use your spellcasting ability and spell save DC.

You can play the instrument while casting a spell that causes any of its targets to be {@condition Charmed|Ishiir} on a failed {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, thereby imposing {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on the save. This effect applies only if the spell has a somatic or a material component.
All instruments of the bards can be used to cast the following spells: {@spell Fly|Ishiir}, {@spell Invisibility|Ishiir}, {@spell Levitate|Ishiir}, and {@spell Protection from Evil and Good|Ishiir}.
In addition, the Canaith mandolin can be used to cast {@spell Cure Wounds|Ishiir} (3rd level), {@spell Dispel Magic|Ishiir}, and {@spell Protection from Energy|Ishiir} (lightning only).

item.name: Umbral Shard
entries: This flickering crystal holds the essence of an Outer Plane. As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can attach the shard to a Tiny object (such as a weapon or a piece of jewelry) or detach it. It falls off if your attunement to it ends. You can use the shard as a spellcasting focus while you hold or wear it.
When you use a Metamagic option on a spell while you are holding or wearing the shard, you can use that property.

entries.name: Property
entries: Choose one creature who takes damage from the spell. That target takes an extra {@damage 3d6} necrotic damage.

item.name: Figurine of Wondrous Power: Ivory Goats
entries: A figurine of wondrous power is a statuette of a beast small enough to fit in a pocket. If you use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to speak the command word and throw the figurine to a point on the ground within 60 feet of you, the figurine becomes a living creature. If the space where the creature would appear is occupied by other creatures or objects, or if there isn't enough space for the creature, the figurine doesn't become a creature.
The creature is friendly to you and your companions. It understands your languages and obeys your spoken commands. If you issue no commands, the creature defends itself but takes no other actions.

The creature exists for a duration specific to each figurine. At the end of the duration, the creature reverts to its figurine form. It reverts to a figurine early if it drops to 0 hit points or if you use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to speak the command word again while touching it. When the creature becomes a figurine again, its property can't be used again until a certain amount of time has passed, as specified in the figurine's description.
{@creature riding horse||Ivory Goats}.
These ivory statuettes of goats are always created in sets of three. Each goat looks unique and functions differently from the others. Their properties are as follows:

items: The goat of traveling can become a Large goat with the same statistics as a {@creature riding horse}. It has 24 charges, and each hour or portion thereof it spends in beast form costs 1 charge. While it has charges, you can use it as often as you wish. When it runs out of charges, it reverts to a figurine and can't be used again until 7 days have passed, when it regains all its charges.
The goat of travail becomes a {@creature giant goat} for up to 3 hours. Once it has been used, it can't be used again until 30 days have passed.

The goat of terror becomes a {@creature giant goat} for up to 3 hours. The goat can't attack, but you can remove its horns and use them as weapons. One horn becomes a +1 lance, and the other becomes a +2 longsword. Removing a horn requires an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, and the weapons disappear and the horns return when the goat reverts to figurine form. In addition, the goat radiates a 30-foot-radius aura of terror while you are riding it. Any creature hostile to you that starts its turn in the aura must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or be {@condition Frightened|Ishiir} of the goat for 1 minute, or until the goat reverts to figurine form. The {@condition Frightened|Ishiir} creature can repeat the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Once it successfully saves against the effect, a creature is {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir|Immune} to the goat's aura for the next 24 hours. Once the figurine has been used, it can't be used again until 15 days have passed.

item.name: Staff of Gravity
entries: This staff of polished gray wood bears numerous runes carved along its length. The staff has 10 charges and regains {@dice 1d6 + 4} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the staff turns into dust and is destroyed.

While holding the staff, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to expend 2 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it, using your spell save DC and spell attack bonus: {@spell Fortune's Favor|Ishiir} (2 charges), {@spell Pulse Wave|Ishiir} (3 charges), or {@spell Gravity Sinkhole|Ishiir} (4 charges).

entries.name: New Possibility
entries: If you are holding the staff and fail a {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against a spell that targets only you, you can turn your failed save into a successful one. This property can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Alchemical Compendium
entries: Acrid odors cling to this stained, heavy volume. The book's metal fittings are copper, iron, lead, silver, and gold, some frozen mid-transition from one metal to another. When found, the book contains the following spells: {@spell Enlarge/reduce|Ishiir}, {@spell Feather Fall|Ishiir}, {@spell Flesh  to Stone|Ishiir}, {@spell Gaseous Form|Ishiir}, {@spell Magic Weapon|Ishiir}, and {@spell Polymorph|Ishiir}. It functions as a spellbook for you.
While you are holding the book, you can use it as a spellcasting focus for your wizard spells.
The book has 3 charges, and it regains {@dice 1d3} expended charges daily at dawn. You can use the charges in the following ways while holding it:

items: If you spend 1 minute studying the book, you can expend 1 charge to replace one of your prepared wizard spells with a different spell in the book. The new spell must be of the transmutation school.

As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can touch a nonmagical object that isn't being worn or carried and spend a number of charges to transform the target into another object. For 1 charge, the object can be no larger than 1 foot on a side. You can spend additional charges to increase the maximum dimensions by 2 feet per charge. The new object must have a gold value equal to or less than the original.

item.name: Elemental Essence Shard (Fire)
entries: This crackling crystal contains the essence of an elemental plane. As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can attach the shard to a Tiny object (such as a weapon or a piece of jewelry) or detach it. It falls off if your attunement to it ends. You can use the shard as a spellcasting focus while you hold or wear it.
When you use a Metamagic option on a spell while you are holding or wearing the shard, you can use the following property:

entries.name: Property
entries: One target of the spell that you can see catches fire. The burning target takes {@damage 2d10} fire damage at the start of its next turn, and then the flames go out.

item.name: Ring of Shooting Stars
entries: While wearing this ring in dim light or darkness, you can cast {@spell Dancing Lights|Ishiir} and {@spell Light|Ishiir} from the ring at will. Casting either spell from the ring requires an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}.
The ring has 6 charges for the following other properties. The ring regains {@dice 1d6} expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Faerie Fire
entries: You can expend 1 charge as an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to cast {@spell Faerie Fire|Ishiir} from the ring.

entries.name: Ball Lightning
entries: You can expend 2 charges as an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to create one to four 3-foot-diameter spheres of lightning. The more spheres you create, the less powerful each sphere is individually.

Each sphere appears in an unoccupied space you can see within 120 feet of you. The spheres last as long as you concentrate (as if concentrating on a spell), up to 1 minute. Each sphere sheds dim light in a 30-foot radius.

As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can move each sphere up to 30 feet, but no farther than 120 feet away from you. When a creature other than you comes within 5 feet of a sphere, the sphere discharges lightning at that creature and disappears. That creature must make a DC 15 Dexterity {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. On a failed save, the creature takes lightning damage based on the number of spheres you created. (4 spheres = {@dice 2d4}, 3 spheres = {@dice 2d6}, 2 spheres = {@dice 5d4}, 1 sphere = {@dice 4d12})

entries.name: Shooting Stars
entries: You can expend 1 to 3 charges as an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}. For every charge you expend, you launch a glowing mote of light from the ring at a point you can see within 60 feet of you. Each creature within a 15-foot cube originating from that point is showered in sparks and must make a DC 15 Dexterity {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, taking {@damage 5d4} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

item.name: Staff of Fire
item.reqAttune: by a druid, sorcerer, warlock, or wizard
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to fire damage while you hold this staff.

The staff has 10 charges. While holding it, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it, using your spell save DC: {@spell Burning Hands|Ishiir} (1 charge), {@spell Fireball|Ishiir} (3 charges), or {@spell Wall of Fire|Ishiir} (4 charges).
The staff regains {@dice 1d6 + 4} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the staff blackens, crumbles into cinders, and is destroyed.

item.name: Black Crystal Tablet
item.reqAttune: by a creature that has {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in the {@skill Arcana} skill
entries: Any creature that attunes to the tablet must make a DC 20 Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} at the end of its next {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}. On a failed save, the creature becomes afflicted with a random form of long-term madness (see "{@book Madness|dmg|8|Madness}" in chapter 8 of the {@book Dungeon Master's Guide|dmg}).

As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, a creature attuned to the Black Crystal Tablet can use it to cast {@spell Eyebite|Ishiir} or {@spell Gate|Ishiir} (the portal created by this spell links to the Far Realm only). After the tablet is used to cast a spell, it cannot be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Lifeward Tattoo
entries: Produced by a special needle, this magic tattoo features symbols of life and rebirth.

entries.name: Tattoo Attunement
entries: To attune to this item, you hold the needle to your skin where you want the tattoo to appear, pressing the needle there throughout the attunement process. When the attunement is complete, the needle turns into the ink that becomes the tattoo, which appears on the skin.
If your attunement to the tattoo ends, the tattoo vanishes, and the needle reappears in your space.

entries.name: Necrotic Resistance
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to necrotic damage.

entries.name: Life Ward
entries: When you would be reduced to 0 hit points, you drop to 1 hit point instead. Once used, this property can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: All-Purpose Tool +1
entries: This simple screwdriver can transform into a variety of tools; as an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can touch the item and transform it into any type of artisan's tool of your choice (see the "Equipment" chapter in the {@book Player's Handbook|PHB} for a list of {@item artisan's tools|Ishiir}). Whatever form the tool takes, you are {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir|proficient} with it.
While holding this tool, you gain a +1 bonus to the spell {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} and the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} DCs of your artificer spells.

As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can focus on the tool to channel your creative forces. Choose a cantrip that you don't know from any class list. For 8 hours, you can cast that cantrip, and it counts as an artificer cantrip for you. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Conch of Teleporation
entries: This item is an ordinary, albeit rather large, conch shell that has been inscribed with the uvar rune. The conch measures 2½ feet long and weighs 20 pounds.

As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can cast the {@spell Teleport|Ishiir} spell by blowing into the shell. The destination is fixed, and there is no chance of either a mishap or the spell being off target. Anyone teleported by the conch appears in a specific location designated by the item's creator at the time the uvar rune is inscribed on the conch. It doesn't allow teleportation to any other destination. Once its spell is cast, the conch can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Rod of the Pact Keeper
entries: While holding this rod, you gain a +1 bonus to spell {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} and to the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} DCs of your warlock spells.
In addition, you can regain one warlock spell slot as an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} while holding the rod. You can't use this property again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

item.name: Shadowstride Tattoo
entries: Produced by a special needle, this tattoo shifts and wavers on the skin, parts of it appearing blurred.

entries.name: Tattoo Attunement
entries: To attune to this item, you hold the needle to your skin where you want the tattoo to appear, pressing the needle there throughout the attunement process. When the attunement is complete, the needle turns into the ink that becomes the tattoo, which appears on the skin.
If your attunement to the tattoo ends, the tattoo vanishes, and the needle reappears in your space.

entries.name: Ghostly Form
entries: The tattoo has 3 charges, and it regains all expended charges daily at dawn. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} while the tattoo is on your skin, you can expend 1 of the tattoo's charges to become incorporeal until the end of your next turn. For the duration, you gain the following benefits:

items: You have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks.
You can't be {@condition Grappled|Ishiir} or {@condition Restrained|Ishiir}.

You can move through creatures and solid objects as if they were {@quickref difficult terrain||3}. If you end your turn in a solid object, you take {@damage 1d10} force damage. If the effect ends while you are inside a solid object, you instead are shunted to the nearest unoccupied space, and you take {@damage 1d10} force damage for every 5 feet traveled.

item.name: Shard of the Ise Rune
entries: This shard of ice is long and slender, roughly the size of a dagger. The ise (ice) rune glows within it. The shard has the following properties, which work only while it's on your person.

entries.name: Frigid Touch
entries: As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can touch a body of water and freeze the water in a 10-foot-radius sphere around the spot you touched. Once you use this property, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

entries.name: Frost Friend
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to fire damage.

entries.name: Icy Mantle
entries: As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can touch yourself or another creature with water on your finger. The water creates an icy mantle of protection. The next time within the next minute that the target takes bludgeoning, slashing, or piercing damage, that damage is reduced to 0, and the mantle is destroyed. Once you use this property, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

entries.name: Winters Howl
entries: As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can cast {@spell Sleet Storm|Ishiir} (spell save DC 17). You regain this ability after you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

entries.name: Gift of Frost
entries: You can transfer the shard's magic to a nonmagical item—a cloak or a pair of boots-by tracing the ise rune there with your finger. The transfer takes 8 hours of work that requires the two items to be within 5 feet of each other. At the end, the shard is destroyed, and the rune appears in blue on the chosen item, which gains a benefit based on its form:

items.name: Cloak
items.entry: The cloak is now a rare magic item that requires attunement. While wearing it, you have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to fire damage, and you have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks} made while in snowy terrain.

items.name: Boots
items.entry: The pair of boots is now a rare magic item that requires attunement. While wearing it, you ignore {@quickref difficult terrain||3} while walking, and you can walk on water.

item.name: Wand of Fireballs
entries: This wand has 7 charges. While holding it, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast the {@spell Fireball|Ishiir} spell (save DC 15) from it. For 1 charge, you cast the 3rd-level version of the spell. You can increase the spell slot level by one for each additional charge you expend.
The wand regains {@dice 1d6 + 1} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the wand crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

item.name: Wand of Lightning Bolts
entries: This wand has 7 charges. While holding it, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast the {@spell Lightning Bolt|Ishiir} spell (save DC 15) from it. For 1 charge, you cast the 3rd-level version of the spell. You can increase the spell slot level by one for each additional charge you expend.
The wand regains {@dice 1d6 + 1} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the wand crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

item.name: Staff of Swarming Insects
item.reqAttune: by a bard, cleric, druid, sorcerer, warlock, or wizard
entries: This staff has 10 charges and regains {@dice 1d6 + 4} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, a {@creature swarm of insects} consumes and destroys the staff, then disperses.

entries.name: Spells
entries: While holding the staff, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to expend some of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it, using your spell save DC: {@spell Giant Insect|Ishiir} (4 charges) or {@spell Insect Plague|Ishiir} (5 charges).

entries.name: Insect Cloud
entries: While holding the staff, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} and expend 1 charge to cause a swarm of harmless flying insects to spread out in a 30-foot radius from you. The insects remain for 10 minutes, making the area heavily obscured for creatures other than you. The swarm moves with you, remaining centered on you. A wind of at least 10 miles per hour disperses the swarm and ends the effect.

item.name: Instrument of Bards: Cli Lyre
entries: An instrument of the bards is an exquisite example of its kind, superior to an ordinary instrument in every way. Seven types of these instruments exist, each named after a legendary bard college. A creature that attempts to play the instrument without being attuned to it must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or take {@damage 2d4} psychic damage.

You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to play the instrument and cast one of its spells. Once the instrument has been used to cast a spell, it can't be used to cast that spell again until the next dawn. The spells use your spellcasting ability and spell save DC.

You can play the instrument while casting a spell that causes any of its targets to be {@condition Charmed|Ishiir} on a failed {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, thereby imposing {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on the save. This effect applies only if the spell has a somatic or a material component.
All instruments of the bards can be used to cast the following spells: {@spell Fly|Ishiir}, {@spell Invisibility|Ishiir}, {@spell Levitate|Ishiir}, and {@spell Protection from Evil and Good|Ishiir}.
In addition, the Cli lyre can be used to cast {@spell Stone Shape|Ishiir}, {@spell Wall of Fire|Ishiir}, and {@spell Wind Wall|Ishiir}.

item.name: Belt of Greater Strength
entries: While wearing this belt, your Strength score changes to 23. The item has no effect on you if your Strength without the belt is equal to or greater than the belt's score.

item.name: Invigorating Shard
entries: This flickering crystal holds the essence of an Outer Plane. As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can attach the shard to a Tiny object (such as a weapon or a piece of jewelry) or detach it. It falls off if your attunement to it ends. You can use the shard as a spellcasting focus while you hold or wear it.
