When you use a Metamagic option on a spell while you are holding or wearing the shard, you can use that property.

entries.name: Property
entries: You or one creature of your choice that you can see within 30 feet of you gains {@dice 3d6} temporary hit points.

item.name: Living Ooze Serum
entries: This opalescent, symbiotic goo comes sealed in a jar and slowly shifts and moves, as if endlessly exploring the jar's interior. To attune to this item, you must first drink the contents of the jar, unlocking the following properties.

entries.name: Resistant
entries: While attuned to it, you have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to poison and acid damage, and you're {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir|Immune} to the {@condition Poisoned|Ishiir} condition.

entries.name: Amorphous
entries: As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can speak a command word and cause your body to assume the amorphous qualities of an ooze. For the next minute, you (along with any equipment you're wearing or carrying) can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. Once you use this property, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Acid Breath
entries: As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can exhale acid in a 30-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a DC 15 Dexterity {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, taking 36 ({@damage 8d8}) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Once you use this property, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Symbiotic Nature
entries: The ooze can't be removed from you while you're attuned to it, and you can't voluntarily end your attunement to it. If you're targeted by a spell that ends a curse, your attunement to the ooze ends, as it seeps out of you.
If you die while the ooze is inside you, it bursts out and engulfs you, turning your corpse into a {@creature black pudding}.

item.name: Mantle of Spell Resistance
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} against spells while you wear this cloak.

item.name: Amulet of the Planes
entries: While wearing this amulet, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to name a location that you are familiar with on another plane of existence. Then make a DC 15 Intelligence check. On a successful check, you cast the {@spell Plane Shift|Ishiir} spell. On a failure, you and each creature and object within 15 feet of you travel to a random destination. Roll a {@dice d100}. On a 1-60, you travel to a random location on the plane you named. On a 61-100, you travel to a randomly determined plane of existence.

item.name: Arcane Grimoire +2
entries: While you are holding this leather-bound book, you can use it as a spellcasting focus for your wizard spells, and you gain a +2 bonus to spell {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} and to the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} DCs of your wizard spells.
You can use this book as a spellbook. In addition, when you use your Arcane Recovery feature, you can increase the number of spell slot levels you regain by 1.

item.name: Rhythm-Maker's Drum +2
entries: While holding this {@item drum|PHB}, you gain a +2 bonus to spell {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} and to the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} DCs of your bard spells.

As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can play the {@item drum|PHB} to regain one use of your Bardic Inspiration feature. This property of the {@item drum|PHB} can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Robe of Eyes
entries: This robe is adorned with eyelike patterns. While you wear the robe, you gain the following benefits:

items: The robe lets you see in all directions, and you have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks} that rely on sight.
You have {@sense darkvision} out to a range of 120 feet.
You can see {@condition Invisible} creatures and objects, as well as see into the Ethereal Plane, out to a range of 120 feet.

entries: The eyes on the robe can't be closed or averted. Although you can close or avert your own eyes, you are never considered to be doing so while wearing this robe.

A {@spell Light|Ishiir} spell cast on the robe or a {@spell Daylight|Ishiir} spell cast within 5 feet of the robe causes you to be {@condition Blinded|Ishiir} for 1 minute. At the end of each of your turns, you can make a Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} (DC 11 for {@spell Light|Ishiir} or DC 15 for {@spell Daylight|Ishiir}), ending the blindness on a success.

item.name: Wand of the War Mage +2
entries: While you are holding this wand, you gain a +2 bonus to spell {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls}. In addition, you ignore half cover when making a spell attack.

item.name: Moon Sickle +2
entries: This silver-bladed sickle glimmers softly with moonlight. While holding the weapon, you gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it, and you gain a +2 bonus to spell {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} and the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} DCs of your druid and ranger spells. In addition, you can use the sickle as a spellcasting focus for your druid and ranger spells.
When you cast a spell that restores hit points, you can roll a {@dice d4} and add the number rolled to the amount of hit points restored, provided you are holding the sickle.

item.name: Carpet of Flying
entries: You can speak the carpet's command word as an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to make the carpet hover and fly. It moves according to your spoken directions, provided that you are within 30 feet of it.

A 4 ft. × 6 ft. carpet can carry up to 400 lb. at a {@variantrule Fly Speed|Ishiir} of 60 feet. A carpet can carry up to twice this weight, but it flies at half {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} if it carries more than its normal capacity.

item.name: Wraps of Unarmed Prowess +2
entries: While you're wearing these cloth wraps, your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|Ishiir|Unarmed Strikes} are considered magical for the purpose of overcoming {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir} and {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to nonmagical attacks and damage, and you gain a +2 bonus to the attack and damage rolls of your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|Ishiir|Unarmed Strikes}.

item.name: Amulet of the Devout +2
entries: This amulet bears the symbol of a deity inlaid with precious stones or metals. While you wear the holy symbol, you gain a +2 bonus to spell {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} and the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} DCs of your spells.
While you wear this amulet, you can use your Channel Divinity feature without expending one of the feature's uses. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Bloodwell Vial +2
entries: To attune to this vial, you must place a few drops of your blood into it. The vial can't be opened while your attunement to it lasts. If your attunement to the vial ends, the contained blood turns to ash. You can use the vial as a spellcasting focus for your spells while wearing or holding it, and you gain a +2 bonus to spell {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} and to the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} DCs of your sorcerer spells.
In addition, when you roll any Hit Dice to recover hit points while you are carrying the vial, you can regain 5 sorcery points. This property of the vial can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Dragonhide Belt +2
entries: This finely detailed belt is made of dragonhide. While wearing it, you gain a +2 bonus to the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} DCs of your ki features. In addition, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to regain ki points equal to a roll of your Martial Arts die. You can't use this action again until the next dawn.

item.name: Protective Verses
entries: This leather-bound spellbook is reinforced with iron and silver fittings and an iron lock (DC 20 to open). As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can touch the book's cover and cause it to lock as if you cast {@spell Arcane Lock|Ishiir} on it. When found, the book contains the following spells: {@spell Arcane Lock|Ishiir}, {@spell Dispel Magic|Ishiir}, {@spell Globe of Invulnerability|Ishiir}, {@spell Glyph of Warding|Ishiir}, {@spell Mordenkainen's Private Sanctum|Ishiir}, {@spell Protection from Evil and Good|Ishiir|protection from evil}, and {@spell Symbol|Ishiir}. It functions as a spellbook for you.
While you are holding the book, you can use it as a spellcasting focus for your wizard spells.
The book has 3 charges, and it regains {@dice 1d3} expended charges daily at dawn. You can use the charges in the following ways while holding it:

items: If you spend 1 minute studying the book, you can expend 1 charge to replace one of your prepared wizard spells with a different spell in the book. The new spell must be of the abjuration school.
When you cast an abjuration spell, you can expend 1 charge to grant a creature you can see within 30 feet of you {@dice 2d10} temporary hit points.

item.name: Rod of Rulership
entries: You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to present the rod and command obedience from each creature of your choice that you can see within 120 feet of you. Each target must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or be {@condition Charmed|Ishiir} by you for 8 hours. While {@condition Charmed|Ishiir} in this way, the creature regards you as its trusted leader. If harmed by you or your companions, or commanded to do something contrary to its nature, a target ceases to be {@condition Charmed|Ishiir} in this way. The rod can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Shield of the Uven Rune
entries: This shield is made from the scale of an ancient white dragon. It has a rune burned into its outward-facing side. A character who examines the rune and succeeds on a DC 20 Intelligence ({@skill History}) check recognizes it as an uven ("enemy" in Giant) rune that confers great power.
While holding the shield, you benefit from the following properties.

entries.name: Winter's Friend
entries: You are {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir|Immune} to cold damage.

entries.name: Deadly Rebuke
entries: Immediately after a creature hits you with a melee attack, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to deal {@damage 3d6} necrotic damage to that creature.

entries.name: Bane
entries: You can cast the {@spell Bane|Ishiir} spell from the shield (save DC 17). The spell does not require {@condition Concentration|Ishiir} and lasts for 1 minute. Once you cast the spell from the shield, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

entries.name: Gift of Vengeance
entries: You can transfer the shield's magic to a nonmagical weapon by tracing the uven rune on the weapon with one finger. The transfer takes 8 hours of work that requires the two items to be within 5 feet of each other. At the end, the shield is destroyed, and the rune is etched or burned into the chosen weapon. This weapon becomes a rare magic item that requires attunement. It has the properties of a +1 weapon. The bonus increases to +3 when the weapon is used against one of the following creature types, chosen by you at the time of the magic weapon's creation: aberrations, celestials, constructs, dragons, elementals, fey, fiends, giants, or undead.

item.name: Ring of Death Denied
entries: If you die while wearing this gray crystal ring, you vanish and reappear in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the space you left (or the nearest unoccupied space). You have a number of hit points equal to {@dice 3d6} + your Constitution modifier. If your hit point maximum is lower than the number of hit points you regain, your hit point maximum rises to a similar amount. If you have any levels of {@condition Exhaustion|Ishiir}, reduce your level of {@condition Exhaustion|Ishiir} by 1. Once the ring is used, it turns to dust and is destroyed.

item.name: Scarab of Protection
entries: If you hold this beetle-shaped medallion in your hand for 1 round, an inscription appears on its surface revealing its magical nature. It provides two benefits while it is on your person:

items: You have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} against spells.

The scarab has 12 charges. If you fail a {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against a necromancy spell or a harmful effect originating from an undead creature, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to expend 1 charge and turn the failed save into a successful one. The scarab crumbles into powder and is destroyed when its last charge is expended.

item.name: Candle of Invocation
entries: This slender taper is dedicated to a deity and shares that deity's alignment. The candle's alignment can be detected with the {@spell Detect Evil and Good|Ishiir} spell. The DM chooses the god and associated alignment or determines the alignment randomly.

The candle's magic is activated when the candle is lit, which requires an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}. After burning for 4 hours, the candle is destroyed. You can snuff it out early for use at a later time. Deduct the time it burned in increments of 1 minute from the candle's total burn time.

While lit, the candle sheds dim light in a 30-foot radius. Any creature within that light whose alignment matches that of the candle makes {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls}, {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws}, and {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|Ability Checks} with {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir}. In addition, a cleric or druid in the light whose alignment matches the candle's can cast 1st-level spells he or she has prepared without expending spell slots, though the spell's effect is as if cast with a 1st-level slot.
Alternatively, when you light the candle for the first time, you can cast the {@spell Gate|Ishiir} spell with it. Doing so destroys the candle.

item.name: Marvelous Sylvan Pigments
entries: Typically found in {@dice 1d4} pots inside a fine wooden box with a brush (weighing 1 pound in total), these pigments allow you to create three-dimensional objects by painting them in two dimensions. The paint flows from the brush to form the desired object as you concentrate on its image.

Each pot of paint is sufficient to cover 1,000 square feet of a surface, which lets you create inanimate objects or terrain features—such as a door, a pit, flowers, trees, cells, rooms, or weapons—that are up to 10,000 cubic feet. It takes 10 minutes to cover 100 square feet.

When you complete the painting, the object or terrain feature depicted becomes a real, nonmagical object. Thus, painting a door on a wall creates an actual door that can be opened to whatever is beyond. Painting a pit on a floor creates a real pit, and its depth counts against the total area of objects you create.

Nothing created by the pigments can have a value greater than 25 gp. If you paint an object of greater value (such as a diamond or a pile of gold), the object looks authentic, but close inspection reveals it is made from paste, bone, or some other worthless material.
If you paint a form of energy such as fire or lightning, the energy appears but dissipates as soon as you complete the painting, doing no harm to anything.

item.name: Periapt of Proof against Poison
entries: This delicate silver chain has a brilliant-cut black gem pendant. While you wear it, poisons have no effect on you. You are {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir|Immune} to the {@condition Poisoned|Ishiir} condition and have {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir} to poison damage.

item.name: Spell Bottle
entries: This glass bottle can store one spell of up to 5th level at a time. When found, roll a {@dice d6} and subtract 1; the total determines the level of spell in the bottle (the DM chooses the spell, and 0 means the bottle is empty). A swirling blue vapor fills the bottle while it contains a spell.
When the bottle is empty, any creature can cast a spell of 1st through 5th level into it by touching it while casting. The spell has no effect other than to be stored in the bottle.

While holding the bottle, you can cast the spell stored in it. The spell uses the slot level, spell save DC, spell attack bonus, and spellcasting ability of the original caster, but is otherwise treated as if you cast the spell. The bottle becomes empty once the spell is cast.

If you're holding the empty bottle when you see a creature casting a spell within 60 feet of you, you can open the bottle as a {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} in an attempt to interrupt the spell. If the creature is casting a spell of 3rd level or lower, the spell has no effect, and it is stored in the bottle. If it is casting a spell of 4th level or higher, make an Intelligence check. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level. On a success, the spell has no effect, and it is stored in the bottle.

item.name: Sun Staff
item.reqAttune: by a cleric, druid, sorcerer or wizard
entries: Veins of sunstone run through this wooden staff. This staff can be wielded as a magic quarterstaff that grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. When you hit with an {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} using this staff, the target takes an extra {@damage 1d8} fire damage.

entries.name: Solar Focus
entries: You can use the staff as a spellcasting focus. While holding the staff, you can reroll a number of damage dice up to your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus when you use a spell slot to cast a spell that deals fire or radiant damage. You must use the new rolls. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Sunny Glow
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can cause the staff to glow with sunlight. While glowing, the staff sheds {@quickref Vision and Light||2||bright light} in a 15-foot radius and {@quickref Vision and Light||2||dim light} for an additional 15 feet. The light lasts until you use another {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to extinguish it.

item.name: Tattoo of Sanguine Fury
entries: Produced by a special needle, this magic tattoo evokes fury in its form and colors.

entries.name: Tattoo Attunement
entries: To attune to this item, you hold the needle to your skin where you want the tattoo to appear, pressing the needle there throughout the attunement process. When the attunement is complete, the needle turns into the ink that becomes the tattoo, which appears on the skin.
If your attunement to the tattoo ends, the tattoo vanishes, and the needle reappears in your space.

entries.name: Bloodthirsty Strikes
entries: The tattoo has 10 charges, and it regains all expended charges daily at dawn. While this tattoo is on your skin, you gain the following benefits:

items: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend a charge to deal an extra {@damage 4d6} necrotic damage to the target, and you regain a number of hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt.

When a creature you can see damages you, you can expend a charge and use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to make a melee attack against that creature, with {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on your {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir}.

item.name: Wand of Polymorph
entries: This wand has 7 charges. While holding it, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to expend 1 of its charges to cast the {@spell Polymorph|Ishiir} spell (save DC 15) from it.
The wand regains {@dice 1d6 + 1} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the wand crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

item.name: Crystal Ball of Mindreading
entries: This {@item crystal ball} is about 6 inches in diameter. While touching it, you can cast the {@spell Scrying|Ishiir} spell (save DC 17) with it.

You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to cast the {@spell Detect Thoughts|Ishiir} spell (save DC 17) while you are {@spell Scrying|Ishiir} with the {@item crystal ball}, targeting creatures you can see within 30 feet of the spell's sensor. You don't need to concentrate on this {@spell Detect Thoughts|Ishiir} to maintain it during its duration, but it ends if {@spell Scrying|Ishiir} ends.

item.name: All-Purpose Tool +2
entries: This simple screwdriver can transform into a variety of tools; as an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can touch the item and transform it into any type of artisan's tool of your choice (see the "Equipment" chapter in the {@book Player's Handbook|PHB} for a list of {@item artisan's tools|Ishiir}). Whatever form the tool takes, you are {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir|proficient} with it.
While holding this tool, you gain a +2 bonus to the spell {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} and the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} DCs of your artificer spells.

As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can focus on the tool to channel your creative forces. Choose a cantrip that you don't know from any class list. For 8 hours, you can cast that cantrip, and it counts as an artificer cantrip for you. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Rod of the Pact Keeper +2
entries: While holding this rod, you gain a +2 bonus to spell {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} and to the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} DCs of your warlock spells.
In addition, you can regain one warlock spell slot as an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} while holding the rod. You can't use this property again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

item.name: Sylvan Shard
entries: This crystal is a solidified shard of the Astral Plane, swirling with silver mist. As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can attach the shard to a Tiny object (such as a weapon or a piece of jewelry) or detach it. It falls off if your attunement to it ends. You can use the shard as a spellcasting focus while you hold or wear it.
When you use a Metamagic option on a spell while you are holding or wearing the shard, immediately after casting the spell you can teleport to an unoccupied space you can see within 30 feet of you.

item.name: Crown of Whirling Comets
entries: This delicate silver tiara is decorated with stellar iconography. While you wear the crown, the gems on the tiara's points detach and closely orbit your head.
The crown has 6 charges for the following properties, which you can use while wearing the crown:

items.name: Star Flight
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can spend 1 charge to gain the power of flight for 10 minutes. For the duration, you gain a {@variantrule Fly Speed|Ishiir} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir}, and you can hover. While flying, you glow faintly with starlight.

items.name: Starlight Strike
entries: As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can spend any number of charges to launch bolts of frigid starlight. You launch a number of bolts equal to the number of charges spent, and you can direct the bolts to target one creature or several, so long as all creatures are within 120 feet of you and you can see them. The bolts automatically strike their targets, and each bolt deals {@damage 2d4} cold damage.

items.name: Whirling Hail
entries: As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can spend 3 charges and cast the {@spell Ice Storm|Ishiir} spell (save DC 16).
The crown regains {@dice 1d6} expended charges daily at dawn.

item.name: Rod of Alertness
entries: This rod has a flanged head and the following properties.

entries.name: Alertness
entries: While holding the rod, you have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks} and on rolls for initiative.

entries.name: Spells
entries: While holding the rod, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to cast one of the following spells from it: {@spell Detect Evil and Good|Ishiir}, {@spell Detect Magic|Ishiir}, {@spell Detect Poison and Disease|Ishiir}, or {@spell See Invisibility|Ishiir}.

entries.name: Protective Aura
entries: As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can plant the haft end of the rod in the ground, whereupon the rod's head sheds bright light in a 60-foot radius and dim light for an additional 60 feet. While in that bright light, you and any creature that is friendly to you gain a +1 bonus to AC and {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} and can sense the location of any {@condition Invisible} hostile creature that is also in the bright light.

The rod's head stops glowing and the effect ends after 10 minutes, or when a creature uses an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to pull the rod from the ground. This property can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Wand of Winter
entries: This wand looks and feels like an icicle. You must be attuned to the wand to use it.

The wand has 7 charges, which are used to fuel the spells within it. With the wand in hand, you can use your action to cast one of the following spells from the wand, even if you are incapable of casting spells: {@spell Ray of Frost|Ishiir} (no charges, or 1 charge to cast at 5th level; +5 to hit with ranged spell attack), {@spell Sleet Storm|Ishiir} (3 charges; spell save DC 15), or {@spell Ice Storm|Ishiir} (4 charges; spell save DC 15). No components are required. The wand regains {@dice 1d6 + 1} expended charges each day at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 20, the wand melts away, forever destroyed.

item.name: Platinum Scarf
entries: This scarf is made of sturdy cloth and covered in platinum-colored scales.
As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can pull a scale from the scarf and speak a command word. When you do so, choose one of the following effects:

entries.name: Breath of Life
entries: The scale disappears, and you or a creature you touch regains {@dice 10d4} hit points.

entries.name: Platinum Shield
entries: For 1 hour or until you dismiss it (no action required), the scale becomes a +1 {@item shield|Ishiir}, which you or another creature can use. A creature wielding the shield has {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir} to radiant damage.

entries.name: Radiant Hammer
entries: For 1 hour or until you dismiss it (no action required), the scale becomes a magic {@item light hammer|Ishiir}, which you or another creature can use. The weapon deals {@damage 2d4} radiant damage, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for a light hammer. It deals an extra {@damage 2d4} radiant damage to chromatic dragons.

Once three scales have been pulled from the scarf, no more scales can be removed until the next dawn, when all the missing scales grow back. If you pull off a scale but don't speak a command word, it disappears after 1 minute.

item.name: Staff of Frost
item.reqAttune: by a druid, sorcerer, warlock, or wizard
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to cold damage while you hold this staff.

The staff has 10 charges. While holding it, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it, using your spell save DC: {@spell Cone of Cold|Ishiir} (5 charges), {@spell Fog Cloud|Ishiir} (1 charge), {@spell Ice Storm|Ishiir} (4 charges), or {@spell Wall of Ice|Ishiir} (4 charges).
The staff regains {@dice 1d6 + 4} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1. the staff turns to water and is destroyed.

item.name: Planecaller's Codex
entries: The pages of this book are bound in fiend hide, and its cover is embossed with a diagram of the Great Wheel of the multiverse. When found, the book contains the following spells: {@spell Banishment|Ishiir}, {@spell Find Familiar|Ishiir}, {@spell Gate|Ishiir}, {@spell Magic Circle|Ishiir}, {@spell Planar Binding|Ishiir}, and {@spell Summon Elemental|Ishiir}. It functions as a spellbook for you.
While you are holding the book, you can use it as a spellcasting focus for your wizard spells.
The book has 3 charges, and it regains {@dice 1d3} expended charges daily at dawn. You can use the charges in the following ways while holding it:

items: If you spend 1 minute studying the book, you can expend 1 charge to replace one of your prepared wizard spells with a different spell in the book. The new spell must be of the conjuration school.

When you cast a conjuration spell that summons or creates one creature, you can expend 1 charge to grant that creature {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} for 1 minute.

item.name: Figurine of Wondrous Power: Bronze Greif
entries: A figurine of wondrous power is a statuette of a beast small enough to fit in a pocket. If you use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to speak the command word and throw the figurine to a point on the ground within 60 feet of you, the figurine becomes a living creature. If the space where the creature would appear is occupied by other creatures or objects, or if there isn't enough space for the creature, the figurine doesn't become a creature.
The creature is friendly to you and your companions. It understands your languages and obeys your spoken commands. If you issue no commands, the creature defends itself but takes no other actions.

The creature exists for a duration specific to each figurine. At the end of the duration, the creature reverts to its figurine form. It reverts to a figurine early if it drops to 0 hit points or if you use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to speak the command word again while touching it. When the creature becomes a figurine again, its property can't be used again until a certain amount of time has passed, as specified in the figurine's description.
{@creature griffon||Bronze Griffon}.
This bronze statuette is of a {@creature griffon} rampant. It can become a {@creature griffon} for up to 6 hours. Once it has been used, it can't be used again until 5 days have passed.

item.name: Banner of the Krig Rune
entries: Crafted from a thick, red fabric, this banner measures 5 feet high and 3 feet wide. The krig (war) rune is displayed on the fabric with round, metal plates sewn into it. It can be attached to a 10-foot pole to serve as a standard. Furling or unfurling the banner requires an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}. The banner has the following properties.

entries.name: Mark of Courage
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can touch the unfurled banner and cause it to emanate courage. You and your allies are {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir|Immune} to the {@condition Frightened|Ishiir} condition while within 20 feet of it. This benefit lasts for 10 minutes or until the banner is furled. Once you use this property, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

entries.name: Sentinel Standard
entries: You can see {@condition Invisible} creatures while they are within 20 feet of the unfurled banner and within your line of sight.

entries.name: Standard's Shield
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can touch the unfurled banner and invoke this power. Any ranged {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} that targets you or an ally of yours has {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} if the target is within 20 feet of the unfurled banner. This benefit lasts for 1 minute or until the banner is furled. Once you use this property, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

entries.name: Gift of Battle
entries: You can transfer the banner's magic to a place by tracing the krig rune on the ground with your finger. The point where you trace it becomes the center of a spherical area of magic that has a 500-foot radius and that is fixed to the place. The transfer takes 8 hours of work that requires the banner to be within 5 feet of you and during which you choose creatures, creature types, or both that will benefit from the magic. At the end, the banner is destroyed, and the area gains the following property:

While in the 500-foot-radius sphere, the creatures you chose during the transfer process are {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir|Immune} to the {@condition Frightened|Ishiir} condition and gain a +1 bonus to {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} and AC.

item.name: Claw of Wyrm Rune
entries: This dragon's claw has been covered with a coat of molten silver, upon which has been inscribed the wyrm (dragon) rune. The claw has the following properties.

entries.name: Wyrmslayer
entries: As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can point the claw at a dragon within 30 feet of you. The dragon must then succeed on a DC 15 Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or gain vulnerability to all damage types until the end of your next turn. This property can be used three times. The claw regains all expended uses at the next dawn.

entries.name: Wyrm Shield
entries: While the claw is displayed on your person, you have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to the damage caused by any dragon's breath weapon.

entries.name: Wyrm Ward
entries: You can transfer the claw's magic to a place by tracing the wyrm rune on the ground with your finger. The point where you trace it becomes the center of a spherical area of magic that has a 100-foot radius and that is fixed to the place. The transfer takes 8 hours of work that requires the claw to be within 5 feet of you. At the end, the claw is destroyed, and the area gains the following property:

While in the 100-foot-radius sphere, any dragon has {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} and can have a {@variantrule Fly Speed|Ishiir} no higher than 10 feet.

item.name: Dust of Deliciousness
entries: This reddish brown dust can be sprinkled over any edible substance to greatly improve the flavor. The dust also dulls the eater's senses: anyone eating food treated with this dust has {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on Wisdom {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|Ability Checks} and Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} for 1 hour. There is enough dust to flavor six servings.

item.name: Crystal Ball of Telepathy
entries: This {@item crystal ball} is about 6 inches in diameter. While touching it, you can cast the {@spell Scrying|Ishiir} spell (save DC 17) with it.

While {@spell Scrying|Ishiir} with the {@item crystal ball}, you can communicate telepathically with creatures you can see within 30 feet of the spell's sensor. You can also use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to cast the {@spell Suggestion|Ishiir} spell (save DC 17) through the sensor on one of those creatures. You don't need to concentrate on this suggestion to maintain it during its duration, but it ends if {@spell Scrying|Ishiir} ends. Once used, the suggestion power of the {@item crystal ball} can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Universal Solvent
entries: This tube holds milky liquid with a strong alcohol smell. You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to pour the contents of the tube onto a surface within reach. The liquid instantly dissolves up to 1 square foot of adhesive it touches, including {@item sovereign glue|Ishiir}.

item.name: Deck of Dimensions
entries: The backs of the cards in this deck are decorated with intricate designs representing different planes of existence. The deck has 6 charges. While holding it, you can expend 1 or more of its charges to use the following properties:

items.name: Marked Card
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can expend 1 charge to draw a card from the deck and place it in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you. The card then becomes marked with an invisible sigil. Once within the next 24 hours, as an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can speak the marked card's name and teleport to the card's location, along with any equipment you are wearing or carrying, appearing in the closest unoccupied space to the card. After you teleport in this way, or after 8 hours, the card returns to the deck, and the mark on it fades.

items.name: Riffling Portal
entries: As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can expend 3 charges to cast the {@spell Arcane Gate|Ishiir} spell from the deck. The deck vanishes, and fluttering cards create the spell's portal rings. When the spell ends, the deck reappears in your possession.

items.name: Shuffling Stride
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can expend 1 charge to throw a card from the deck to an unoccupied space within 60 feet of yourself and teleport, along with any equipment you're wearing or carrying, to that space. The card then vanishes and returns to the deck.
The deck regains {@dice 1d6} expended charges daily at dawn.

item.name: Lyre of Building
entries: While holding this {@item lyre|PHB}, you can cast {@spell Mending|Ishiir} as an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}. You can also play the {@item lyre|PHB} as a {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} when an object or a structure you can see within 300 feet of you takes damage, causing it to be {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir|Immune} to that damage and any further damage of the same type until the start of your next turn.

In addition, you can play the {@item lyre|PHB} as an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to cast {@spell Fabricate|Ishiir}, {@spell Move Earth|Ishiir}, {@spell Passwall|Ishiir}, or {@spell Summon Construct|Ishiir}, and that spell can't be cast from it again until the next dawn.

item.name: Reveler's Concertina
entries: While holding this concertina, you gain a +2 bonus to the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} DC of your bard spells.

As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can use the concertina to cast {@spell Otto's Irresistible Dance|Ishiir} from the item. This property of the concertina can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Elemental Essence Shard (Air)
entries: This crackling crystal contains the essence of an elemental plane. As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can attach the shard to a Tiny object (such as a weapon or a piece of jewelry) or detach it. It falls off if your attunement to it ends. You can use the shard as a spellcasting focus while you hold or wear it.
When you use a Metamagic option on a spell while you are holding or wearing the shard, you can use the following property:

entries.name: Property
entries: You can immediately fly up to 60 feet without provoking opportunity attacks.

item.name: Crystal Ball of True Seeing
entries: This {@item crystal ball} is about 6 inches in diameter. While touching it, you can cast the {@spell Scrying|Ishiir} spell (save DC 17) with it.
While {@spell Scrying|Ishiir} with the {@item crystal ball}, you have {@sense truesight} with a radius of 120 feet centered on the spell's sensor.

item.name: Belt of Superior Strength
entries: While wearing this belt, your Strength score changes to 25. The item has no effect on you if your Strength without the belt is equal to or greater than the belt's score.

item.name: Scroll of Calamity
entries: By using an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to read the scroll, you cause a comet to fall from the sky and crash to the ground at a point you can see up to 1 mile away from you. You must be outdoors when you use the scroll, or nothing happens and the scroll is wasted.

The comet creates a 50-foot-deep, 500-foot-radius crater on impact. Any creature in that radius must make a DC 20 Dexterity {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, taking {@damage 30d10} force damage on a failed {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, or half as much damage on a successful one. All structures in the crater are destroyed, as are all nonmagical objects that aren't being worn or held.

item.name: Arcane Grimoire +3
entries: While you are holding this leather-bound book, you can use it as a spellcasting focus for your wizard spells, and you gain a +3 bonus to spell {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} and to the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} DCs of your wizard spells.
You can use this book as a spellbook. In addition, when you use your Arcane Recovery feature, you can increase the number of spell slot levels you regain by 1.

item.name: Rhythm-Maker's Drum +3
entries: While holding this {@item drum|PHB}, you gain a +3 bonus to spell {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} and to the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} DCs of your bard spells.

As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can play the {@item drum|PHB} to regain one use of your Bardic Inspiration feature. This property of the {@item drum|PHB} can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Wand of the War Mage +3
entries: While you are holding this wand, you gain a +3 bonus to spell {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls}. In addition, you ignore half cover when making a spell attack.

item.name: Moon Sickle +3
entries: This silver-bladed sickle glimmers softly with moonlight. While holding the weapon, you gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it, and you gain a +3 bonus to spell {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} and the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} DCs of your druid and ranger spells. In addition, you can use the sickle as a spellcasting focus for your druid and ranger spells.
When you cast a spell that restores hit points, you can roll a {@dice d4} and add the number rolled to the amount of hit points restored, provided you are holding the sickle.

item.name: Wraps of Unarmed Prowess +3
entries: While you're wearing these cloth wraps, your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|Ishiir|Unarmed Strikes} are considered magical for the purpose of overcoming {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir} and {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to nonmagical attacks and damage, and you gain a +3 bonus to the attack and damage rolls of your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|Ishiir|Unarmed Strikes}.

item.name: Amulet of the Devout +3
entries: This amulet bears the symbol of a deity inlaid with precious stones or metals. While you wear the holy symbol, you gain a +3 bonus to spell {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} and the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} DCs of your spells.
While you wear this amulet, you can use your Channel Divinity feature without expending one of the feature's uses. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Bloodwell Vial +3
entries: To attune to this vial, you must place a few drops of your blood into it. The vial can't be opened while your attunement to it lasts. If your attunement to the vial ends, the contained blood turns to ash. You can use the vial as a spellcasting focus for your spells while wearing or holding it, and you gain a +3 bonus to spell {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} and to the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} DCs of your sorcerer spells.
In addition, when you roll any Hit Dice to recover hit points while you are carrying the vial, you can regain 5 sorcery points. This property of the vial can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Dragonhide Belt +3
entries: This finely detailed belt is made of dragonhide. While wearing it, you gain a +3 bonus to the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} DCs of your ki features. In addition, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to regain ki points equal to a roll of your Martial Arts die. You can't use this action again until the next dawn.

item.name: Eldritch Crown
entries: This symbiotic crown is carved from dark purple and mauve stone, with ten points like stalks set with gemstones resembling the eyestalks of a {@creature beholder}. To attune to this item, you must wear it on your head for the entire attunement period, during which the crown's hidden tendrils burrow into your scalp to bond with your skull.
While wearing the crown, you can see normally in darkness, both magical and nonmagical, to a distance of 120 feet.

entries.name: Spells
entries: The crown has 10 charges. While wearing it, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to expend some of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it (spell save DC 16): {@spell Charm Person|Ishiir} (1 charge), {@spell Disintegrate|Ishiir} (6 charges), {@spell Fear|Ishiir} (3 charges), {@spell Finger of Death|Ishiir} (7 charges), {@spell Flesh  to Stone|Ishiir} (6 charges), {@spell Hold Person|Ishiir} (2 charges), {@spell Ray of Enfeeblement|Ishiir} (2 charges), {@spell Sleep|Ishiir} (1 charge), {@spell Slow|Ishiir} (3 charges), {@spell Telekinesis|Ishiir} (5 charges).
The crown regains {@dice 1d6 + 3} expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Symbiotic Nature
entries: The crown can't be removed from you while you're attuned to it, and you can't voluntarily end your attunement to it. If you're targeted by a spell that ends a curse, your attunement to the crown ends, and it detaches from you.

item.name: Staff of Thunder and Lightning
entries: This staff can be wielded as a magic quarterstaff that grants a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. It also has the following additional properties. When one of these properties is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Lightning
entries: When you hit with a melee attack using the staff, you can cause the target to take an extra {@damage 2d6} lightning damage.

entries.name: Thunder
entries: When you hit with a melee attack using the staff, you can cause the staff to emit a crack of thunder, audible out to 300 feet. The target you hit must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or become {@condition Stunned|Ishiir} until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Lightning Strike
entries: You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to cause a bolt of lightning to leap from the staff's tip in a line that is 5 feet wide and 120 feet long. Each creature in that line must make a DC 17 Dexterity {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, taking {@damage 9d6} lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Thunderclap
entries: You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to cause the staff to issue a deafening thunderclap, audible out to 600 feet. Each creature within 60 feet of you (not including you) must make a DC 17 Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 2d6} thunder damage and becomes {@condition Deafened|Ishiir} for 1 minute. On a successful save, a creature takes half damage and isn't {@condition Deafened|Ishiir}.

entries.name: Thunder and Lightning
entries: You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to use the Lightning Strike and Thunderclap properties at the same time. Doing so doesn't expend the daily use of those properties, only the use of this one.

item.name: Cloak of Invisibility
entries: While wearing this cloak, you can pull its hood over your head to cause yourself to become {@condition Invisible}. While you are {@condition Invisible}, anything you are carrying or wearing is {@condition Invisible} with you. You become visible when you cease wearing the hood. Pulling the hood up or down requires an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}.

Deduct the time you are {@condition Invisible|Ishiir}, in increments of 1 minute, from the cloak's maximum duration of 2 hours. After 2 hours of use, the cloak ceases to function. For every uninterrupted period of 12 hours the cloak goes unused, it regains 1 hour of duration.

item.name: Staff of Striking
entries: This staff can be wielded as a magic quarterstaff that grants a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it.

The staff has 10 charges. When you hit with a melee attack using it, you can expend up to 3 of its charges. For each charge you expend, the target takes an extra {@damage 1d6} force damage. The staff regains {@dice 1d6 + 4} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the staff becomes a nonmagical quarterstaff.

item.name: Ring of Fire Elemental Command
entries: While wearing this ring, you have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} against elementals from the Elemental Plane of Fire and they have {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} against you. In addition, you have access to properties based on the Elemental Plane of Fire.
The ring has 5 charges. It regains {@dice 1d4 + 1} expended charges daily at dawn. Spells cast from the ring have a save DC of 17.

You can expend 2 of the ring's charges to cast {@spell Dominate Monster|Ishiir} on a {@creature fire elemental}. In addition, you have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to fire damage. You can also speak and understand Ignan.
If you help slay a {@creature fire elemental} while attuned to the ring, you gain access to the following additional properties:

items: You are {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir|Immune} to fire damage.

You can cast the following spells from the ring, expending the necessary number of charges: {@spell Burning Hands|Ishiir} (1 charge), {@spell Fireball|Ishiir} (2 charges), and {@spell Wall of Fire|Ishiir} (3 charges).

item.name: All-Purpose Tool +3
entries: This simple screwdriver can transform into a variety of tools; as an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can touch the item and transform it into any type of artisan's tool of your choice (see the "Equipment" chapter in the {@book Player's Handbook|PHB} for a list of {@item artisan's tools|Ishiir}). Whatever form the tool takes, you are {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir|proficient} with it.
While holding this tool, you gain a +3 bonus to the spell {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} and the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} DCs of your artificer spells.

As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can focus on the tool to channel your creative forces. Choose a cantrip that you don't know from any class list. For 8 hours, you can cast that cantrip, and it counts as an artificer cantrip for you. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Holy Symbol of the Long Road
item.reqAttune: by a cleric or paladin of good alignment
entries: The Holy Symbol of Ravenkind is a unique holy symbol sacred to the good-hearted faithful of Barovia. It predates the establishment of any church in Barovia. According to legend, it was delivered to a paladin named Lugdana by a giant raven—or an angel in the form of a giant raven. Lugdana used the holy symbol to root out and destroy nests of vampires until her death. The high priests of Ravenloft kept and wore the holy symbol after Lugdana's passing.
The holy symbol is a platinum amulet shaped like the sun, with a large crystal embedded in its center.
The holy symbol has 10 charges for the following properties. It regains {@dice 1d6 + 4} charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Hold Vampires
entries: As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can expend 1 charge and present the holy symbol to make it flare with holy power. Vampires and {@creature vampire spawn} within 30 feet of the holy symbol when it flares must make a DC 15 Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. On a failed save, a target is {@condition Paralyzed|Ishiir} for 1 minute. It can repeat the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} at the end of its turns to end the effect on itself.

entries.name: Turn Undead
entries: If you have the Turn Undead or the Turn the Unholy feature, you can expend 3 charges when you present the holy symbol while using that feature. When you do so, undead have {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on their {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} against the effect.

entries.name: Sunlight
entries: As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can expend 5 charges while presenting the holy symbol to make it shed bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. The light is sunlight and lasts for 10 minutes or until you end the effect (no action required).

item.name: Rod of the Pact Keeper +3
entries: While holding this rod, you gain a +3 bonus to spell {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} and to the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} DCs of your warlock spells.
In addition, you can regain one warlock spell slot as an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} while holding the rod. You can't use this property again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

item.name: Blast Scepter
entries: The Blast Scepter can be used as an {@item Arcane Focus|PHB}.

Whoever is attuned to the Blast Scepter gains {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to fire and lightning damage and can, as an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, use it to cast {@spell Thunderwave|Ishiir} as a 4th-level spell (save DC 16) without expending a spell slot.

item.name: Eyes of the Truthseeker
entries: While wearing these goggles, you can see normally in darkness, both magical and nonmagical, to a distance of 60 feet. Additionally, you have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) and Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks} that rely on sight.

You see {@condition Invisible} creatures and objects within 60 feet of you as if they were visible, and you can see into the Ethereal Plane. Ethereal creatures and objects appear ghostly and translucent.

You automatically detect illusions you can see and automatically succeed on {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} against them. In addition, you see a bright aura around any creature that isn't in its true form.

As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can speak a command word and use the goggles to see into and through solid matter. This vision has a radius of 60 feet and lasts for 1 minute. To you, solid objects within that radius appear transparent. The vision can penetrate 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, or up to 3 feet of wood or dirt. Thicker substances block the vision, as does a thin sheet of lead. This property can't be used again until the next dawn.

As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can speak a command word to switch the goggles into spyglass mode. While in this mode, creatures and objects viewed through the goggles are magnified to twice their size. Speaking the command word again reverts the goggles to their normal operation.
As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can cast the {@spell Antimagic Field|Ishiir} spell from the visor. This property can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Visage of Cunning
item.reqAttune: by a bard, sorcerer, or warlock
entries: This colorful, harlequin domino mask is edged with pearls. While wearing this mask, you gain the following benefits:

items.name: Charismatic Focus
entries: You can use the mask as a spellcasting focus. You gain a +3 bonus to any spell {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} and spell {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} DCs that use Charisma as the spellcasting ability.

items.name: Marvelous Escape
entries: When a creature hits you with an {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir}, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to disappear in a puff of smoke and colorful sparkles. You take no damage and instead teleport, along with anything you are wearing or carrying, to an unoccupied space you can see within 30 feet of yourself. Once this {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

items.name: Topsy-Turvy
entries: When you roll a 1 on a {@dice d20}, you can treat the roll as if you rolled a 20 instead. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Ring of Earth Elemental Command
entries: While wearing this ring, you have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} against elementals from the Elemental Plane of Earth and they have {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} against you. In addition, you have access to properties based on the Elemental Plane of Earth.
The ring has 5 charges. It regains {@dice 1d4 + 1} expended charges daily at dawn. Spells cast from the ring have a save DC of 17.

You can expend 2 of the ring's charges to cast {@spell Dominate Monster|Ishiir} on an {@creature earth elemental}. In addition, you can move in {@quickref difficult terrain||3} that is composed of rubble, rocks, or dirt as if it were normal terrain. You can also speak and understand Terran.
If you help slay an {@creature earth elemental} while attuned to the ring, you gain access to the following additional properties:

items: You have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to acid damage.
You can move through solid earth or rock as if those areas were {@quickref difficult terrain||3}. If you end your turn there, you are shunted out to the nearest unoccupied space you last occupied.

You can cast the following spells from the ring, expending the necessary number of charges: {@spell Stone Shape|Ishiir} (2 charges), {@spell Stoneskin|Ishiir} (3 charges), or {@spell Wall of Stone|Ishiir} (3 charges).

item.name: Ring of Air Elemental Command
entries: While wearing this ring, you have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} against elementals from the Elemental Plane of Air, and they have {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} against you. In addition, you have access to properties based on the Elemental Plane of Air.
The ring has 5 charges. It regains {@dice 1d4 + 1} expended charges daily at dawn. Spells cast from the ring have a save DC of 17.

You can expend 2 of the ring's charges to cast {@spell Dominate Monster|Ishiir} on an {@creature air elemental}. In addition, when you fall, you descend 60 feet per round and take no damage from falling. You can also speak and understand Auran.
If you help slay an {@creature air elemental} while attuned to the ring, you gain access to the following additional properties:

items: You have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to lightning damage.
You have a {@variantrule Fly Speed|Ishiir} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} and can hover.

You can cast the following spells from the ring, expending the necessary number of charges: {@spell Chain Lightning|Ishiir} (3 charges), {@spell Gust of Wind|Ishiir} (2 charges), or {@spell Wind Wall|Ishiir} (1 charge).

item.name: Wand of Paralysis
entries: This wand has 7 charges. While holding it, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to expend 1 of its charges to cause a thin blue ray to streak from the tip toward a creature you can see within 60 feet of you. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or be {@condition Paralyzed|Ishiir} for 1 minute. At the end of each of the target's turns, it can repeat the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, ending the effect on itself on a success.
The wand regains {@dice 1d6 + 1} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the wand crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

item.name: Amethyst Lodestone
entries: This fist-sized chunk of amethyst is infused with an amethyst dragon's ability to bend gravitational forces. While you are carrying the lodestone, you have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on Strength {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws}.
The lodestone has 6 charges for the following properties, which you can use while you are holding the stone. The stone regains {@dice 1d6} expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Flight
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can expend 1 charge to gain the power of flight for 10 minutes. For the duration, you gain a {@variantrule Fly Speed|Ishiir} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir}, and you can hover.

entries.name: Gravitational Thrust
entries: As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can expend 1 charge to focus gravity around a creature you can see within 60 feet of you. The target must succeed on a DC 18 Strength {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or be pushed up to 20 feet in a direction of your choice.

entries.name: Reverse Gravity
entries: As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can expend 3 charges to cast {@spell Reverse Gravity|Ishiir} from the stone (save DC 18).

item.name: Verminshroud
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to poison damage.
You gain a {@variantrule Climb Speed|Ishiir} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir}.

You have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks} that rely on smell, you are {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir|Immune} to disease, and you have {@sense darkvision} out to a range of 60 feet. If you already have {@sense darkvision}, wearing the cloak increases the range of your {@sense darkvision} by 60 feet.

As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can use the Verminshroud to cast {@spell Polymorph|Ishiir} on yourself, transforming into a {@creature giant rat}, a {@creature rat}, a {@creature giant wasp}, or a {@creature giant scorpion} while retaining your Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores, as well as the properties of the cloak. This property can't be used again until the next dawn.

You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to cast the {@spell Insect Plague|Ishiir} spell (save DC 15) from the Verminshroud, requiring no material components. This property can't be used again until the next dawn.

Your teeth become razor-sharp natural weapons, which you can use to make {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|Ishiir|Unarmed Strikes}. If you hit with them, you deal piercing damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|Ishiir}. You can make this attack as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}. When you bite a creature and deal damage to it, the creature must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or be {@condition Poisoned|Ishiir} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} at the end of each of its turns, ending the condition on itself on a success.

item.name: Staff of the Woods
entries: This staff can be wielded as a magic quarterstaff that grants a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. While holding it, you have a +2 bonus to spell {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls}.

The staff has 10 charges for the following properties. It regains {@dice 1d6 + 4} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the staff loses its properties and becomes a nonmagical quarterstaff.

entries.name: Spells
entries: You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to expend 1 or more of the staff's charges to cast one of the following spells from it, using your spell save DC: {@spell Animal Friendship|Ishiir} (1 charge), {@spell Awaken|Ishiir} (5 charges), {@spell Barkskin|Ishiir} (2 charges), {@spell Locate Animals Or Plants|Ishiir} (2 charges), {@spell Speak with Animals|Ishiir} (1 charge), {@spell Speak with Plants|Ishiir} (3 charges), or {@spell Wall of Thorns|Ishiir} (6 charges).
You can also use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to cast the {@spell Pass without Trace|Ishiir} spell from the staff without using any charges.

entries.name: Tree Form
entries: You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to plant one end of the staff in fertile earth and expend 1 charge to transform the staff into a healthy tree. The tree is 60 feet tall and has a 5-foot-diameter trunk, and its branches at the top spread out in a 20-foot radius. The tree appears ordinary but radiates a faint aura of transmutation magic if targeted by {@spell Detect Magic|Ishiir}. While touching the tree and using another action to speak its command word, you return the staff to its normal form. Any creature in the tree falls when it reverts to a staff.

item.name: Chaos Shard
entries: This flickering crystal holds the essence of an Outer Plane. As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can attach the shard to a Tiny object (such as a weapon or a piece of jewelry) or detach it. It falls off if your attunement to it ends. You can use the shard as a spellcasting focus while you hold or wear it.
When you use a Metamagic option on a spell while you are holding or wearing the shard, you can use that property.

entries.name: Property
entries: Choose one creature who takes damage from the spell. That target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} and {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|Ability Checks} made before the start of your next turn.

item.name: Shard of Greater Malison
entries: This dull, cold crystal sits heavy and leaden, saturated by the Shadowfell's despair. As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can attach the shard to a Tiny object (such as a weapon or a piece of jewelry) or detach it. It falls off if your attunement to it ends. You can use the shard as a spellcasting focus while you hold or wear it.

When you use a Metamagic option on a spell while you are holding or wearing the shard, you can momentarily curse one creature targeted by the spell; choose one ability score, and until the end of your next turn, the creature has {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|Ability Checks} and {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} that use that ability.

item.name: Ring of Water Elemental Command
entries: While wearing this ring, you have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} against elementals from the Elemental Plane of Water and they have {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} against you. In addition, you have access to properties based on the Elemental Plane of Water.
The ring has 5 charges. It regains {@dice 1d4 + 1} expended charges daily at dawn. Spells cast from the ring have a save DC of 17.

You can expend 2 of the ring's charges to cast {@spell Dominate Monster|Ishiir} on a {@creature water elemental}. In addition, you can stand on and walk across liquid surfaces as if they were solid ground. You can also speak and understand Aquan.
If you help slay a {@creature water elemental} while attuned to the ring, you gain access to the following additional properties:

items: You can breathe underwater and have a {@variantrule Swim Speed|Ishiir} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir}.

You can cast the following spells from the ring, expending the necessary number of charges: {@spell Create Or Destroy Water|Ishiir} (1 charge), {@spell Control Water|Ishiir} (3 charges), {@spell Ice Storm|Ishiir} (2 charges), or {@spell Wall of Ice|Ishiir} (3 charges).

item.name: Cube of Force
entries: This cube is about an inch across. Each face has a distinct marking on it that can be pressed. The cube starts with 36 charges, and it regains {@dice 1d20} expended charges daily at dawn.

You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to press one of the cube's faces, expending a number of charges based on the chosen face, as shown in the Cube of Force Faces table. Each face has a different effect. If the cube has insufficient charges remaining, nothing happens. Otherwise, a barrier of {@condition Invisible} force springs into existence, forming a cube 15 feet on a side. The barrier is centered on you, moves with you, and lasts for 1 minute, until you use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to press the cube's sixth face, or the cube runs out of charges. You can change the barrier's effect by pressing a different face of the cube and expending the requisite number of charges, resetting the duration. If your movement causes the barrier to come into contact with a solid object that can't pass through the cube, you can't move any closer to that object as long as the barrier remains.

entries.caption: Cube of Force Faces
rows: Gases, wind, and fog can't pass through the barrier.
Nonliving matter can't pass through the barrier. Walls, floors, and ceilings can pass through at your discretion.
Living matter can't pass through the barrier.
Spell effects can't pass through the barrier.
Nothing can pass through the barrier. Walls, floors, and ceilings can pass through at your discretion.

entries: The cube loses charges when the barrier is targeted by certain spells or comes into contact with certain spell or magic item effects, as shown in the table below.

item.name: Sovereign Glue
entries: This viscous, milky-white substance can form a permanent adhesive bond between any two objects. It must be stored in a jar or flask that has been coated inside with {@item oil of slipperiness|Ishiir}. When found, a container contains {@dice 1d6 + 1} ounces.

One ounce of the glue can cover a 1-foot square surface. The glue takes 1 minute to set. Once it has done so, the bond it creates can be broken only by the application of {@item universal solvent|Ishiir} or {@item oil of etherealness|Ishiir}, or with a {@spell Wish|Ishiir} spell.

item.name: Rod of Hellish Flames
entries: Glowing cinders orbit the flanged head of this black iron rod.
This rod can be used as an {@item Arcane Focus|PHB}. While holding this rod, you gain the following benefits:

items.name: Hellish Resistance
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to fire and necrotic damage.

items.name: Searing Rebuke
entries: You can cast the {@spell Hellish Rebuke|Ishiir} spell as a 4th-level spell (save DC 16) from the rod. Once you use the rod to cast the spell, the rod can't cast the spell again until the next dawn.

items.name: Surge of Brimstone
entries: Whenever you cast a spell that deals fire or necrotic damage, you can use the rod to deal the maximum damage instead of rolling. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Robe of Scintillating Colors
entries: This robe has 3 charges, and it regains {@dice 1d3} expended charges daily at dawn. While you wear it, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} and expend 1 charge to cause the garment to display a shifting pattern of dazzling hues until the end of your next turn. During this time, the robe sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. Creatures that can see you have {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} against you. In addition, any creature in the bright light that can see you when the robe's power is activated must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or become {@condition Stunned|Ishiir} until the effect ends.

item.name: Grimoire Infinitus
entries: Most of the book is blank, but the following spells are recorded in the first pages of the tome: {@spell Alarm|Ishiir}, {@spell Antimagic Field|Ishiir}, {@spell Bigby's Hand|Ishiir}, {@spell Blight|Ishiir}, {@spell Charm Person|Ishiir}, {@spell Confusion|Ishiir}, {@spell Control Weather|Ishiir}, {@spell Create Undead|Ishiir}, {@spell Detect Thoughts|Ishiir}, {@spell Enlarge/reduce|Ishiir}, {@spell Fear|Ishiir}, {@spell Foresight|Ishiir}, {@spell Gaseous Form|Ishiir}, {@spell Glyph of Warding|Ishiir}, {@spell Legend Lore|Ishiir}, {@spell Leomund's Tiny Hut|Ishiir}, {@spell Mass Suggestion|Ishiir}, {@spell Mislead|Ishiir}, {@spell Misty Step|Ishiir}, {@spell Mordenkainen's Faithful Hound|Ishiir}, {@spell Prismatic Spray|Ishiir}, {@spell Ray of Enfeeblement|Ishiir}, {@spell Silent Image|Ishiir}, {@spell Teleport|Ishiir}, and {@spell Thunderwave|Ishiir}.

You can use the grimoire as your spellbook, and you can scribe new spells into it as normal. When you prepare wizard spells using the grimoire, the number of wizard spells you can prepare increases by 3.
While you carry the spellbook, you have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} against spells and magical effects.
You can use your Arcane Recovery feature twice between {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir|Long Rests}, rather than once.

item.name: Gift of the Golden-Winged
entries: This gold statuette is carved in the likeness of a canary and is small enough to fit in a pocket. If you use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to speak the command word and throw the figurine to a point on the ground within 60 feet of you, the figurine becomes a living creature in one of two forms (you choose). If there isn't enough space for the creature where it would appear, the figurine doesn't become a creature. The two forms are as follows:

entries.name: Giant Canary Form
entries: The figurine becomes a {@creature giant canary|FTD} for up to 8 hours and can be ridden as a mount. Once the figurine has become a {@creature giant canary|FTD}, it can't be used this way again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Gold Dragon Form
entries: While you are missing half or more of your hit points, you can speak a different command word and the figurine becomes an {@creature adult gold dragon} (see its stat block in the Monster Manual) for up to 1 hour. The dragon can't use any legendary actions or lair actions. Once the figurine has become an {@creature adult gold dragon}, it can't be used this way again until 1 year has passed.

In either form, the creature is friendly to you and your companions. It understands your languages and obeys your spoken commands. If you issue no commands, the creature defends itself but takes no other actions.

The creature exists for a duration specific to each form. At the end of the duration, the creature reverts to its figurine form. It reverts to a figurine early if it drops to 0 hit points or if you use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to speak the command word again while touching it. When the creature becomes a figurine again, its property can't be used again until a certain amount of time has passed, as specified in the description.

item.name: Instrument of Bards: Anstruth Harp
entries: An instrument of the bards is an exquisite example of its kind, superior to an ordinary instrument in every way. Seven types of these instruments exist, each named after a legendary bard college. A creature that attempts to play the instrument without being attuned to it must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or take {@damage 2d4} psychic damage.

You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to play the instrument and cast one of its spells. Once the instrument has been used to cast a spell, it can't be used to cast that spell again until the next dawn. The spells use your spellcasting ability and spell save DC.

You can play the instrument while casting a spell that causes any of its targets to be {@condition Charmed|Ishiir} on a failed {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, thereby imposing {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on the save. This effect applies only if the spell has a somatic or a material component.
All instruments of the bards can be used to cast the following spells: {@spell Fly|Ishiir}, {@spell Invisibility|Ishiir}, {@spell Levitate|Ishiir}, and {@spell Protection from Evil and Good|Ishiir}.
In addition, the Anstruth harp can be used to cast {@spell Control Weather|Ishiir}, {@spell Cure Wounds|Ishiir} (5th level), and {@spell Wall of Thorns|Ishiir}.

item.name: Belt of Supreme Strength
entries: While wearing this belt, your Strength score changes to 27. The item has no effect on you if your Strength without the belt is equal to or greater than the belt's score.

item.name: Robe of Stars
entries: This black or dark blue robe is embroidered with small white or silver stars. You gain a +1 bonus to {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} while you wear it.

Six stars, located on the robe's upper front portion, are particularly large. While wearing this robe, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to pull off one of the stars and use it to cast {@spell Magic Missile|Ishiir} as a 5th-level spell. Daily at dusk, {@dice 1d6} removed stars reappear on the robe.

While you wear the robe, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to enter the Astral Plane along with everything you are wearing and carrying. You remain there until you use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to return to the plane you were on. You reappear in the last space you occupied, or if that space is occupied, the nearest unoccupied space.

item.name: Rod of Idyll
entries: While holding this rod, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to activate it. The rod then instantly transports you and up to 199 other willing creatures you can see to a paradise that exists in an extraplanar space. You choose the form that the paradise takes. It could be a tranquil garden, lovely glade, cheery tavern, immense palace, tropical island, fantastic carnival, or whatever else you can imagine. Regardless of its nature, the paradise contains enough water and food to sustain its visitors. Everything else that can be interacted with inside the extraplanar space can exist only there. For example, a flower picked from a garden in the paradise disappears if it is taken outside the extraplanar space.

For each hour spent in the paradise, a visitor regains hit points as if it had spent 1 Hit Die. Also, creatures don't age while in the paradise, although time passes normally. Visitors can remain in the paradise for up to 200 days divided by the number of creatures present (round down).

When the time runs out or you use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to end it, all visitors reappear in the location they occupied when you activated the rod, or an unoccupied space nearest that location. The rod can't be used again until ten days have passed.

item.name: Rod of Lordly Might
entries: This rod has a flanged head, and it functions as a magic mace that grants a +3 bonus to attack and damage roll made with it. The rod has properties associated with six different buttons that are set in a row along the haft. It has three other properties as well, detailed below.

entries.name: Six Buttons
entries: You can press one of the rod's six buttons as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}. A button's effect lasts until you push a different button or until you push the same button again, which causes the rod to revert to its normal form.
If you press button 1, the rod becomes a {@item flame tongue|Ishiir} as a fiery blade sprouts from the end opposite the rod's flanged head (you choose the type of sword).

If you press button 2, the rod's flanged head folds down and two crescent-shaped blades spring out, transforming the rod into a magic battleaxe that grants a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it.

If you press button 3, the rod's flanged head folds down, a spear point springs from the rod's tip, and the rod's handle lengthens into a 6-foot haft, transforming the rod into a magic spear that grants a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it.

If you press button 4, the rod transforms into a climbing pole up to 50 feet long, as you specify. In surfaces as hard as granite, a spike at the bottom and three hooks at the top anchor the pole. Horizontal bars 3 inches long fold out from the sides, 1 foot apart, forming a ladder. The pole can bear up to 4,000 pounds. More weight or lack of solid anchoring causes the rod to revert to its normal form.

If you press button 5, the rod transforms into a handheld battering ram and grants its user a +10 bonus to strength {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks} made to break through doors, barricades, and other barriers.

If you press button 6, the rod assumes or remains in its normal form and indicates magnetic north. (Nothing happens if this function of the rod is used in a location that has no magnetic north.) The rod also gives you knowledge of your approximate depth beneath the ground or your height above it.

entries.name: Drain Life
entries: When you hit a creature with a melee attack using the rod, you can force the target to make a DC 17 Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}.
