On a failure, the target rakes an extra {@damage 4d6} necrotic damage, and you regain a number of hit points equal to half that necrotic damage. This property can't be used again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Paralyze
entries: When you hit a creature with a melee attack using the rod, you can force the target to make a DC 17 Strength {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. On a failure, the target is {@condition Paralyzed|Ishiir} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. This property can't be used again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Terrify
entries: While holding the rod, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to force each creature you can see within 30 feet of you to make a DC 17 Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. On a failure, a target is {@condition Frightened|Ishiir} of you for 1 minute. A {@condition Frightened|Ishiir} target can repeat the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. This property can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Instrument of Bards: Ollamh Harp
entries: An instrument of the bards is an exquisite example of its kind, superior to an ordinary instrument in every way. Seven types of these instruments exist, each named after a legendary bard college. A creature that attempts to play the instrument without being attuned to it must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or take {@damage 2d4} psychic damage.

You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to play the instrument and cast one of its spells. Once the instrument has been used to cast a spell, it can't be used to cast that spell again until the next dawn. The spells use your spellcasting ability and spell save DC.

You can play the instrument while casting a spell that causes any of its targets to be {@condition Charmed|Ishiir} on a failed {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, thereby imposing {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on the save. This effect applies only if the spell has a somatic or a material component.
All instruments of the bards can be used to cast the following spells: {@spell Fly|Ishiir}, {@spell Invisibility|Ishiir}, {@spell Levitate|Ishiir}, and {@spell Protection from Evil and Good|Ishiir}.
In addition, the Ollamh harp can be used to cast {@spell Confusion|Ishiir}, {@spell Control Weather|Ishiir}, and {@spell Fire Storm|Ishiir}.

item.name: Helm of Teleportation
entries: This helm has 3 charges. While wearing it, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} and expend 1 charge to cast the {@spell Teleport|Ishiir} spell from it. The helm regains {@dice 1d3} expended charges daily at dawn.

item.name: Horn of Valhalla: Silver
entries: You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to blow this horn. In response, warrior spirits from the plane of Ysgard appear within 60 feet of you. These spirits use the {@creature berserker} statistics. They return to Ysgard after 1 hour or when they drop to 0 hit points. Once you use the horn, it can't be used again until 7 days have passed.
The silver horn summons {@dice 2d4 + 2} {@creature berserker||berserkers}.
The {@creature berserker||berserkers} are friendly to you and your companions and follow your commands.

item.name: Dragon Talisman
entries: This ornament can be jewelry, a cloak, or another wearable accessory. It appears to be fashioned from a dragon's scale, tooth, or claw, or it incorporates images in those shapes.

You gain a +1 bonus to AC, and you can't be {@condition Charmed|Ishiir} or {@condition Frightened|Ishiir}. Moreover, each creature of your choice within 30 feet of you has {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} it makes to avoid being {@condition Charmed|Ishiir} or {@condition Frightened|Ishiir} or to end those conditions on itself.

When you would take damage of the type dealt by the breath of the dragon in whose hoard the ornament became Wakened, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to take no damage instead, and you regain hit points equal to the damage you would have taken. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

While you are wearing the ornament, you gain a {@variantrule Fly Speed|Ishiir} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} and can hover. While you are flying using this {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir}, spectral dragon wings appear on your back.

item.name: Divine Shard
entries: This flickering crystal holds the essence of an Outer Plane. As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can attach the shard to a Tiny object (such as a weapon or a piece of jewelry) or detach it. It falls off if your attunement to it ends. You can use the shard as a spellcasting focus while you hold or wear it.
When you use a Metamagic option on a spell while you are holding or wearing the shard, you can use that property.

entries.name: Property
entries: You can end one of the following conditions affecting yourself or one creature you can see within 30 feet of you: {@condition Charmed|Ishiir}, {@condition Blinded|Ishiir}, {@condition Deafened|Ishiir}, {@condition Frightened|Ishiir}, {@condition Poisoned|Ishiir}, or {@condition Stunned|Ishiir}.

item.name: Helm of Brilliance
entries: This dazzling helm is set with {@dice 1d10} diamonds, {@dice 2d10} rubies, {@dice 3d10} fire opals, and {@dice 4d10} opals. Any gem pried from the helm crumbles to dust. When all the gems are removed or destroyed, the helm loses its magic.
You gain the following benefits while wearing it:

items: You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to cast one of the following spells (save DC 18), using one of the helm's gems of the specified type as a component: {@spell Daylight|Ishiir} (opal), {@spell Fireball|Ishiir} (fire opal), {@spell Prismatic Spray|Ishiir} (diamond), or {@spell Wall of Fire|Ishiir} (ruby). The gem is destroyed when the spell is cast and disappears from the helm.

As long as it has at least one diamond, the helm emits dim light in a 30-foot radius when at least one undead is within that area. Any undead that starts its turn in that area takes {@damage 1d6} radiant damage.
As long as the helm has at least one ruby, you have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to fire damage.

As long as the helm has at least one fire opal, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} and speak a command word to cause one weapon you are holding to burst into flames. The flames emit bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. The flames are harmless to you and the weapon. When you hit with an attack using the blazing weapon, the target takes an extra {@damage 1d6} fire damage. The flames last until you use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to speak the command word again or until you drop or stow the weapon.

entries: Roll a {@dice d20} if you are wearing the helm and take fire damage as a result of failing a {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against a spell. On a roll of 1, the helm emits beams of light from its remaining gems. Each creature within 60 feet of the helm other than you must succeed on a DC 17 Dexterity {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or be struck by a beam, taking radiant damage equal to the number of gems in the helm. The helm and its gems are then destroyed.

item.name: Nightfall Pearl
entries: Used to summon night, this 6-inch-diameter, jet-black orb is cold to the touch. You can spend 10 minutes to activate it, causing the area within 10 miles of it at the moment of activation to become night even if it is daytime. This night lasts for 24 hours, until you cancel it as an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, or until your attunement to the pearl ends. Once used, the pearl can't be used again for 24 hours.

item.name: Ring of Three Wishes
entries: While wearing this ring, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to expend 1 of its 3 charges to cast the {@spell Wish|Ishiir} spell from it. The ring becomes nonmagical when you use the last charge.

item.name: Robe of the Archmagi
item.reqAttune: by a sorcerer, warlock, or wizard
entries: This elegant garment is made from exquisite cloth of white, gray, or black and adorned with silvery runes. The robe's color corresponds to the alignment for which the item was created. A white robe was made for good, gray for neutral, and black for evil. You can't attune to a robe of the archmagi that doesn't correspond to your alignment.
You gain these benefits while wearing the robe:

items: If you aren't wearing armor, your base Armor Class is 15 + your Dexterity modifier.
You have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} against spell and other magical effects.
Your spell save DC and spell attack bonus each increase by 2.

item.name: Talisman of Alignment
item.reqAttune: by a creature of good alignment
entries: This talisman is a mighty symbol of goodness. A creature that is neither good nor evil in alignment takes {@damage 6d6} radiant damage upon touching the talisman. An evil creature takes {@damage 8d6} radiant damage upon touching the talisman. Either sort of creature takes the damage again each time it ends its turn holding or carrying the talisman.
If you are a good cleric or paladin, you can use the talisman as a holy symbol, and you gain a +2 bonus to spell {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} while you wear or hold it.

The talisman has 7 charges. If you are wearing or holding it, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to expend 1 charge from it and choose one creature you can see on the ground within 120 feet of you. If the target is of evil alignment, a flaming fissure opens under it. The target must succeed on a DC 20 Dexterity {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or fall into the fissure and be destroyed, leaving no remains. The fissure then closes, leaving no trace of its existence. When you expend the last charge, the talisman disperses into motes of golden light and is destroyed.

item.name: Rod of Resurrection
item.reqAttune: by a cleric, druid, or paladin
entries: The rod has 5 charges. While you hold it, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to cast one of the following spells from it: {@spell Heal|Ishiir} (expends 1 charge) or {@spell Resurrection|Ishiir} (expends 5 charges).
The rod regains 1 expended charge daily at dawn. If the rod is reduced to 0 charges, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the rod disappears in a burst of radiance.

item.name: Stormgirdle
entries: While wearing the Stormgirdle, you have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to lightning damage and thunder damage, and your Strength score becomes 25 if it isn't already 25 or higher. In addition, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to become a Storm Avatar for 1 minute, gaining the following benefits for the duration:

items: You have {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir} to lightning damage and thunder damage.
You gain a {@variantrule Fly Speed|Ishiir} of 30 feet and can hover.

When you hit with a weapon attack that normally deals bludgeoning damage, it deals thunder damage instead. When you hit with a weapon attack that normally deals piercing or slashing damage, it deals lightning damage instead.

As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can choose one creature you can see within 30 feet of you to be struck by lightning. The target must make a DC 15 Dexterity {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, taking {@damage 5d6} lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries: Once you use the girdle's Storm Avatar property, that property can't be used again until the next dawn.
You can cast the {@spell Control Weather|Ishiir} spell from the girdle. This property can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Horn of Valhalla: Brass
entries: You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to blow this horn. In response, warrior spirits from the plane of Ysgard appear within 60 feet of you. These spirits use the {@creature berserker} statistics. They return to Ysgard after 1 hour or when they drop to 0 hit points. Once you use the horn, it can't be used again until 7 days have passed.
A brass horn summons {@dice 3d4 + 3} {@creature berserker||berserkers}. To use the brass horn, you must be {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir|proficient} with all simple weapons.

If you blow the horn without meeting its requirement, the summoned {@creature berserker||berserkers} attack you. If you meet the requirement, they are friendly to you and your companions and follow your commands.

item.name: Naushindhor's Stone: Greater Absorption
entries: An {@italic Ioun stone} is named after Ioun, a god of knowledge and prophecy revered on some worlds. Many types of {@italic Ioun stone} exist, each type a distinct combination of shape and color.

When you use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to toss one of these stones into the air, the stone orbits your head at a distance of {@dice 1d3} feet and confers a benefit to you. Thereafter, another creature must use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to grasp or net the stone to separate it from you, either by making a successful {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} against AC 24 or a successful DC 24 Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check. You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to seize and stow the stone, ending its effect.
A stone has AC 24, 10 hit points, and {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to all damage. It is considered to be an object that is being worn while it orbits your head.

While this marbled lavender and green ellipsoid orbits your head, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to cancel a spell of 8th level or lower cast by a creature you can see and targeting only you. Once the stone has canceled 50 levels of spells, it burns out and turns dull gray, losing its magic. If you are targeted by a spell whose level is higher than the number of spell levels the stone has left, the stone can't cancel it.

item.name: Mark of the Slayer
entries: This tattoo evokes fury in its form and colors. While this tattoo is on your skin, you gain the following benefits:

items: Your {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} score a critical hit on a d20 roll of 19 or 20.
When you score a critical hit against a creature, that target takes an extra {@damage 4d6} necrotic damage, and you gain a number of temporary hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt.

When a creature you can see damages you, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to make a melee attack against that creature, with {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on your {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir}.

entries.name: Tattoo Attunement
entries: To attune to this item, you hold the needle to your skin where you want the tattoo to appear, pressing the needle there throughout the attunement process. When the attunement is complete, the needle turns into the ink that becomes the tattoo, which appears on the skin. If you have multiple magic tattoos, they count as a single magic item with regard to the number of magic items you can attune to.
If your attunement to the tattoo ends, the tattoo vanishes, and the needle reappears in the closest unoccupied space to you.

item.name: Belt of Legendary Strength
entries: While wearing this belt, your Strength score changes to 29. The item has no effect on you if your Strength without the belt is equal to or greater than the belt's score.

item.name: Deck of Twisted Fate
entries: Not all lingering spirits are tragic souls, lost on their way to the hereafter. Some languish as prisoners, souls so wicked mortals dare not free them upon an unsuspecting afterlife.

Created by a figure of Vistani legend, Luba's Tarokka of Souls shaped the destiny of countless heroes. The prophecies of this deck of cards also revealed great evils and guided its creator into the path of nefarious forces. Untold times the deck's creator, Mother Luba, narrowly escaped doom, spared only by her keen insights. But even for her, not all wickedness could be escaped. In the most dire cases, Mother Luba managed to ensnare beings of pure evil amid the strands of fate, imprisoning them within her tarroka deck. There these foul spirits dwell still, trapped within a nether-realm hidden amid shuffling cards, waiting for fate to turn foul—as it inevitably will.

Like all tarokka decks, the {@i Tarokka of Souls} is a lavishly illustrated collection of fifty-four cards, comprising the fourteen cards of the high deck and forty other cards divided into four suits: coins, glyphs, stars, and swords.

entries.name: Random Properties
entries: The artifact has the following random properties, which you can determine by rolling on the tables in the "Artifacts" section of the {@book Dungeon Master's Guide|DMG}:

items: 2 {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Detrimental Properties|dmg|minor detrimental} properties
2 {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Beneficial Properties|dmg|minor beneficial} properties

entries.name: Spells
entries: While holding the deck, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to cast one of the following spells (save DC 18) from it: {@spell Comprehend Languages|Ishiir}, {@spell Detect Evil and Good|Ishiir}, {@spell Detect Magic|Ishiir}, {@spell Detect Poison and Disease|Ishiir}, {@spell Locate Object|Ishiir}, or {@spell Scrying|Ishiir}. Once you use the deck to cast a spell, you can't cast that spell again from it until the next dawn.

entries.name: Enduring Vision
entries: While holding the deck, you automatically succeed on Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} made to maintain your {@condition Concentration|Ishiir} on divination spells.

entries.name: Twist of Fate
entries: As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can draw a card from the deck and twist the fortune of another creature you can see within 15 feet of you. Choose one of the following effects:

items.name: Weal
items.entry: The creature has {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls}, {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|Ability Checks}, and {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} for the next hour.

items.name: Woe
items.entry: The creature has {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls}, {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|Ability Checks}, and {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} for the next hour.

items: The deck can be used in this way twice, and you regain all expended uses at the next dawn.

entries.name: Prisoners of Fate
entries: Whenever you use the Twist of Fate property, there is a chance that one of the souls trapped in the deck escapes. Roll {@dice d100} and consult the Souls of the Tarokka table. If you roll one of the high cards, the soul associated with it escapes. You can find its statistics in the {@book Monster Manual|MM}. If you roll a soul that has already escaped, roll again.

The released soul appears at a random location within {@dice 10d10} miles of you and terrorizes the living. Until the released soul is destroyed, it gains the benefit of a weal from the deck's Twist of Fate property, and both you and the original target of Twist of Fate suffer the effect of woe.

entries.name: Shuffling Fate
entries: If you go 7 days without using the Twist of Fate property, your attunement to Luba's Tarroka of Souls ends, and you can't attune to it again until after another creature uses Twist of Fate on you.

entries.name: Destroying the Deck
entries: Luba's Tarokka of Souls can be destroyed only if all fourteen souls within are released and destroyed. This reveals a fifteenth soul, a {@creature lich}, that inhabits the Nether card, which appears only when the fourteen souls are defeated. If this ancient entity is destroyed, the Nether card vanishes and the deck becomes a normal tarokka deck, with no special properties, but it includes a new card of the DM's design.

entries.name: Mother Luba and the Vistani
entries: The creator of the Tarokka of Souls, Mother Luba was one of the most influential leaders of the Vistani. For untold generations, the Vistani have wandered the Shadowfell, which includes terrifying demiplanes like the vampire-haunted realm of Barovia. These travelers have learned many secrets of these domains and encountered countless others wandering amid the Shadowfell's horrors. Most Vistani bands accept well-intentioned wayfarers from diverse walks and of disparate origins, embracing any who seek to find a home amid the endless roads and vistas hidden amid the mists.

A halfling Vistani, Mother Luba led one of the largest groups of Vistani in the Shadowfell. She hailed from the same world that Count Strahd von Zarovich and Madam Eva came from, and she created a community of kindness and resilience-ever rare to find in the Plane of Shadow. She led her people in welcoming strangers, feeding the hungry, and defying the cruel. She and Madam Eva were once friends, until Madam Eva began bargaining with the creatures of the night. "We may wander amid the shadows," Mother Luba said. "But we must ever serve as a light to our fellow travelers."
Some years ago, Mother Luba disappeared into the mists, leaving behind only the Tarokka of Souls. It is said that if you draw the Mists card from it, you can hear the whispers of her kind voice.

item.name: Horn of Valhalla, Bronze
entries: You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to blow this horn. In response, warrior spirits from the plane of Ysgard appear within 60 feet of you. These spirits use the {@creature berserker} statistics. They return to Ysgard after 1 hour or when they drop to 0 hit points. Once you use the horn, it can't be used again until 7 days have passed.
A bronze horn summons {@dice 4d4 + 4} {@creature berserker||berserkers}. To use the bronze horn, you must be {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir|proficient} with medium armor.

If you blow the horn without meeting its requirement, the summoned {@creature berserker||berserkers} attack you. If you meet the requirement, they are friendly to you and your companions and follow your commands.

item.name: Bracers of Channeling
entries: A powerful illusionist of House Dimir originally developed these bracers, which enabled her to create multiple minor illusions at once. The bracers' power, though, extends far beyond illusions.
While wearing the bracers, whenever you cast a cantrip, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} on the same turn to cast that cantrip a second time.

item.name: Crown of Domination
entries: While wearing the Crown of Domination, you have {@sense darkvision} out to a range of 60 feet. If you already have {@sense darkvision}, wearing the crown increases the range of your {@sense darkvision} by 60 feet.

When you hit a beast, dragon, or monstrosity of challenge rating 15 or lower with an attack, or when you grapple it, you can use the crown to cast {@spell Dominate Monster|Ishiir} on the creature (save DC 17). On a successful save, the target is {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir|Immune} to the power of the crown for 24 hours. On a failure, a shimmering, golden image of the crown appears as a collar around the target's neck or as a crown on its head (your choice) until it is no longer {@condition Charmed|Ishiir} by the spell. If you use the crown to charm a second creature, the first spell immediately ends. When the spell ends, the target knows it was {@condition Charmed|Ishiir} by you.

item.name: Dragon Vessel
entries: This vessel can be a potion bottle, drinking horn, or other container meant to hold a liquid.

As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, if the vessel is empty, you can speak the command word to fill the vessel with one of the following (your choice): ale, olive oil, mead, wine, whiskey, a {@item potion of healing|Ishiir}, a {@item potion of healing (greater)|Ishiir}, a {@item potion of healing (superior)|Ishiir}, a {@item potion of healing (supreme)|Ishiir}, a {@item potion of climbing|Ishiir}, a {@item potion of draconic breath|Ishiir}, a {@item potion of flying|Ishiir}, or a {@item potion of dragon's majesty|Ishiir}. Once this property is used, it can't be used until the next dawn. A potion you create in this way loses its magical properties if it isn't imbibed within 24 hours.

item.name: Dragon Mask
entries: This horned mask of glossy ebony has horns and a skull-like mien. The mask reshapes to fit a wearer attuned to it. While you are wearing the mask and attuned to it, you can access the following properties.

entries.name: Damage Absorption
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to acid damage. If you already have damage {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to acid from another source, you gain {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir} to acid damage. If you already have {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir} to acid damage from another source, you regain hit points equal to half of any acid damage you are dealt.

entries.name: Draconic Majesty
entries: While you are wearing no armor, you can add your Charisma bonus to your Armor Class.

entries.name: Dragon Breath
entries: If you have a breath weapon that requires rest to recharge, it gains a recharge of 6.

entries.name: Dragon Sight
entries: You gain {@sense darkvision} with a radius of 60 feet, or an additional 60 feet of {@sense darkvision} if you already have that sense. Once per day, you can gain {@sense blindsight} out to a range of 30 feet for 5 minutes.

entries.name: Dragon Tongue
entries: You can speak and understand Draconic. You also have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on any Charisma check you make against Black dragons.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance
entries: (1/Day) If you fail a {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, you can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Water Breathing
entries: You can breathe underwater.

item.name: Staff of Power
item.reqAttune: by a sorcerer, warlock, or wizard
entries: This staff can be wielded as a magic quarterstaff that grants a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. While holding it, you gain a +2 bonus to Armor Class, {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws}, and spell {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls}.

The staff has 20 charges for the following properties. The staff regains {@dice 2d8 + 4} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the staff retains its +2 bonus to attack and damage roll but loses all other properties. On a 20, the staff regain {@dice 1d8 + 2} charges.

entries.name: Power Strike
entries: When you hit with a melee attack using the staff, you can expend 1 charge to deal an extra {@damage 1d6} force damage to the target.

entries.name: Spells
entries: While holding this staff, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it, using your spell save DC and spell attack bonus: {@spell Cone of Cold|Ishiir} (5 charges), {@spell Fireball|Ishiir} (5th-level version, 5 charges), {@spell Globe of Invulnerability|Ishiir} (6 charges), {@spell Hold Monster|Ishiir} (5 charges), {@spell Levitate|Ishiir} (2 charges). {@spell Lightning Bolt|Ishiir} (5th-level version, 5 charges), {@spell Magic Missile|Ishiir} (1 charge), {@spell Ray of Enfeeblement|Ishiir} (1 charge), or {@spell Wall of Force|Ishiir} (5 charges).

entries.name: Retributive Strike
entries: You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to break the staff over your knee or against a solid surface, performing a retributive strike. The staff is destroyed and releases its remaining magic in an explosion that expands to fill a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on it.

You have a {@chance 50} chance to instantly travel to a random plane of existence, avoiding the explosion. If you fail to avoid the effect, you take force damage equal to 16 × the number of charges in the staff. Every other creature in the area must make a DC 17 Dexterity {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. On a failed save, a creature takes an amount of damage based on how far away it is from the point of origin, as shown in the following table. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage.

rows: 8 × the number of charges in the staff
6 × the number of charges in the staff
4 × the number of charges in the staff

item.name: Horn of Valhalla: Iron
entries: You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to blow this horn. In response, warrior spirits from the plane of Ysgard appear within 60 feet of you. These spirits use the {@creature berserker} statistics. They return to Ysgard after 1 hour or when they drop to 0 hit points. Once you use the horn, it can't be used again until 7 days have passed.
The iron horn summons {@dice 5d4 + 5} {@creature berserker||berserkers}. To use the iron horn, you must be {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir|proficient} with all martial weapons.

If you blow the horn without meeting its requirement, the summoned {@creature berserker||berserkers} attack you. If you meet the requirement, they are friendly to you and your companions and follow your commands.

item.name: Rod of Absorption
entries: While holding this rod, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to absorb a spell that is targeting only you and not with an area of effect. The absorbed spell's effect is canceled, and the spell's energy—not the spell itself—is stored in the rod. The energy has the same level as the spell when it was cast. The rod can absorb and store up to 50 levels of energy over the course of its existence. Once the rod absorbs 50 levels of energy, it can't absorb more. If you are targeted by a spell that the rod can't store, the rod has no effect on that spell.
When you become attuned to the rod, you know how many levels of energy the rod has absorbed over the course of its existence, and how many levels of spell energy it currently has stored.

If you are a spellcaster holding the rod, you can convert energy stored in it into spell slots to cast spells you have prepared or know. You can create spell slots only of a level equal to or lower than your own spell slots, up to a maximum of 5th level. You use the stored levels in place of your slots, but otherwise cast the spell as normal. For example, you can use 3 levels stored in the rod as a 3rd-level spell slot.
A newly found rod has {@dice 1d10} levels of spell energy stored in it already. A rod that can no longer absorb spell energy and has no energy remaining becomes nonmagical.

item.name: Spindle of Fate
entries: This wand is shaped like a drop spindle wrapped in red thread. The wand has 6 charges that can be used for the following properties:

items.name: Battle Foreknowledge
entries: When you roll initiative, you can expend 1 charge to add or subtract your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus from the total roll.

items.name: Doom Foretold
entries: As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can expend 2 charges to target a creature within 30 feet of yourself and invoke that creature's doom. While the target is on the same plane of existence as you, you can sense the direction to its location, and you know the direction of its movement if it's in motion. Additionally, once per turn when you deal damage to the doomed creature, you can roll {@dice 1d6} and add the number rolled to the damage roll. These benefits persist for 1 hour or until you target another creature with this effect.

items.name: Twist of Fate
entries: When a creature within 60 feet of you makes a {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or an {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir}, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to expend 3 charges and alter the outcome, turning a failed {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} into a successful one, a missed {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} into a hit, or vice versa.
The wand regains {@dice 1d6} expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Random Properties
entries: The artifact has the following random properties, which you can determine by rolling on the tables in the "Artifacts" section of the {@book Dungeon Master's Guide|DMG}:

items: 2 {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Beneficial Properties|dmg|minor beneficial} properties
1 {@table Artifact Properties; Major Beneficial Properties|dmg|major beneficial} property
1 {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Detrimental Properties|dmg|minor detrimental} property

entries.name: Spells
entries: The staff has 6 charges. While holding it, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells (save DC 18) from it: {@spell Aura of Life|Ishiir} (2 charges), {@spell Aura of Purity|Ishiir} (2 charges), {@spell Banishment|Ishiir} (1 charge), {@spell Beacon of Hope|Ishiir} (1 charge), {@spell Mass Cure Wounds|Ishiir} (3 charges). The staff regains {@dice 1d6} expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Absolute Banishment
entries: While you are attuned to the staff and holding it, you can spend 10 minutes to banish all but the mightiest fiends within 1 mile of you. Any fiend with a challenge rating of 19 or higher is unaffected. Each banished fiend is sent back to its home plane and can't return to the plane the Staff of the Veil Warden banished it from for 100 years.

item.name: Staff of the Magi
item.reqAttune: by a sorcerer, warlock, or wizard
entries: This staff can be wielded as a magic quarterstaff that grants a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. While you hold it, you gain a +2 bonus to spell {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls}.

The staff has 50 charges for the following properties. It regains {@dice 4d6 + 2} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 20, the staff regains {@dice 1d12 + 1} charges.

entries.name: Spell Absorption
entries: While holding the staff, you have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} against spells. In addition, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} when another creature casts a spell that targets only you. If you do, the staff absorbs the magic of the spell, canceling its effect and gaining a number of charges equal to the absorbed spell's level. However, if doing so brings the staff's total number of charges above 50, the staff explodes as if you activated its retributive strike (see below).

entries.name: Spells
entries: While holding the staff, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to expend some of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it, using your spell save DC and spellcasting ability: {@spell Conjure Elemental|Ishiir} (7 charges), {@spell Dispel Magic|Ishiir} (3 charges), {@spell Fireball|Ishiir} (7th-level version, 7 charges), {@spell Flaming Sphere|Ishiir} (2 charges), {@spell Ice Storm|Ishiir} (4 charges), {@spell Invisibility|Ishiir} (2 charges), {@spell Knock|Ishiir} (2 charges), {@spell Lightning Bolt|Ishiir} (7th-level version, 7 charges), {@spell Passwall|Ishiir} (5 charges), {@spell Plane Shift|Ishiir} (7 charges), {@spell Telekinesis|Ishiir} (5 charges), {@spell Wall of Fire|Ishiir} (4 charges), or {@spell Web|Ishiir} (2 charges).

You can also use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to cast one of the following spells from the staff without using any charges: {@spell Arcane Lock|Ishiir}, {@spell Detect Magic|Ishiir}, {@spell Enlarge/reduce|Ishiir}, {@spell Light|Ishiir}, {@spell Mage Hand|Ishiir}, or {@spell Protection from Evil and Good|Ishiir}.

entries.name: Retributive Strike
entries: You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to break the staff over your knee or against a solid surface, performing a retributive strike. The staff is destroyed and releases its remaining magic in an explosion that expands to fill a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on it.

You have a {@chance 50} chance to instantly travel to a random plane of existence, avoiding the explosion. If you fail to avoid the effect, you take force damage equal to 16 × the number of charges in the staff. Every other creature in the area must make a DC 17 Dexterity {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. On a failed save, a creature takes an amount of damage based on how far away it is from the point of origin, as shown in the following table. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage.

rows: 8 × the number of charges in the staff
6 × the number of charges in the staff
4 × the number of charges in the staff

item.name: Demonomicon
entries: An expansive treatise documenting the Abyss's infinite layers and inhabitants, the Demonomicon of Iggwilv is the most thorough and blasphemous tome of demonology in the multiverse. The tome recounts both the oldest and most current profanities of the Abyss and demons. Demons have attempted to censor the text, and while sections have been ripped from the book's spine, the general chapters remain, ever revealing demonic secrets. And the book holds more than blasphemies. Caged behind lines of script roils a secret piece of the Abyss itself, which keeps the book up-to-date, no matter how many pages are removed, and it longs to be more than mere reference material.

entries.name: Random Properties
entries: The artifact has the follow random properties, which you can determine by rolling on the tables in the "Artifacts" section of the {@book Dungeon Master's Guide|DMG}:

items: 2 {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Beneficial Properties|dmg|minor beneficial} properties
1 {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Detrimental Properties|dmg|minor detrimental} property
1 {@table Artifact Properties; Major Detrimental Properties|dmg|major detrimental} property

entries.name: Spells
entries: The book has 8 charges. It regains {@dice 1d8} expended charges daily at dawn. While holding it, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to cast {@spell Tasha's Hideous Laughter|Ishiir} from it or to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells (save DC 20) from it: {@spell Magic Circle|Ishiir} (1 charge), {@spell Magic Jar|Ishiir} (3 charges), {@spell Planar Ally|Ishiir} (3 charges), {@spell Planar Binding|Ishiir} (2 charges), {@spell Plane Shift|Ishiir} (to layers of the Abyss only; 3 charges), {@spell Summon Fiend|Ishiir} (3 charges).

entries.name: Abyssal Reference
entries: You can reference the {@i Demonomicon} whenever you make an Intelligence check to discern information about demons or a Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) check related to the Abyss. When you do so, you can add double your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus to the check.

entries.name: Fiendish Scourging
entries: Your magic causes pain to fiends. While carrying the book, when you make a damage roll for a spell you cast against a fiend, you use the maximum possible result instead of rolling.

entries.name: Ensnarement
entries: While carrying the book, whenever you cast the {@spell Magic Circle|Ishiir} spell naming only fiends, or the {@spell Planar Binding|Ishiir} spell targeting a fiend, the spell is cast at 9th level, regardless of what level spell slot you used, if any. Additionally, the fiend has {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on its {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against the spell.

entries.name: Containment
entries: The first 10 pages of the {@i Demonomicon} are blank. As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} while holding the book, you can target a fiend that you can see that is trapped within a {@spell Magic Circle|Ishiir}. The fiend must succeed on a DC 20 Charisma {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} with {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} or become trapped within one of the {@i Demonomicon's} empty blank pages, which fills with writing detailing the trapped creature's widely known name and depravities. Once used, this action can't be used again until the next dawn.

When you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}, if you and the {@i Demonomicon} are on the same plane of existence, the trapped creature of the highest challenge rating within the book can attempt to possess you. You must make a DC 20 Charisma {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. On a failure, you are possessed by the creature, which controls you like a puppet. The possessing creature can release you as an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, appearing in the closest unoccupied space. On a successful save, the fiend can't try to possess you again for 7 days.
When the tome is discovered, it has {@dice 1d4} fiends occupying its pages, typically an assortment of demons.

entries.name: Destroying the Demonomicon
entries: To destroy the book, six different demon lords must each tear out a sixth of the book's pages. If this occurs, the pages reappear after 24 hours. Before all those hours pass, anyone who opens the book's remaining binding is transported to a nascent layer of the Abyss that lies hidden within the book. At the heart of this deadly, semi-sentient domain lies a long-lost artifact, {@i Fraz-Urb'luu's Staff}. If the staff is dragged from the pocket plane, the tome is reduced to a mundane and quite out-of-date copy of the {@i Tome of Zyx}, the work that served as the foundation for the {@i Demonomicon}. Once the staff emerges, the demon lord Fraz-Urb'luu instantly knows.

item.name: Walloping
entries: {@i Requirement: Ammunition, Thrown.}
A creature hit by the projectile must succeed on a DC 10 Strength {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or be knocked {@condition Prone|Ishiir}.

item.name: Winged
entries: {@i Requirement: Ammunition.}

Ranged weapon {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} made with this ammunition ignore half and three-quarters cover. In addition, attacking at long range doesn't impose {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on ranged weapon {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} made with this ammunition.

item.name: Starshot
entries: {@i Requirement: Weapons.}

You ignore the loading property os weapons with this property. If you load no ammunition in the weapon, it produces its own, automatically creating one piece of magic ammunition when you make a ranged attack with it. The ammunition created by the weapon vanishes the instant after it hits or misses a target. The weapon has 3 charges and regains {@dice 1d3} expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Constellations
entries: The weapon is decorated with three constellations. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can tap one of the constellations to invoke it, expending 1 charge and producing one of the following effects:

items.name: Balance
entries: The next time you hit a creature with a ranged {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} using this weapon before the end of your next turn, you or another creature of your choice within 30 feet of you can regain hit points equal to {@dice 1d8} plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus.

items.name: Flames
entries: Until the end of your next turn, when you hit a creature with a ranged {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} using this weapon, the attack deals an additional {@damage 2d8} fire damage.

items.name: Rogue
entries: Until the end of your next turn, you have the {@condition Invisible|Ishiir} condition, and anything you are wearing or carrying is also invisible.

item.name: Glimmering
entries: {@i Requirement: Weapons.}
You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

When you hit with a ranged {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} using this magic weapon, the target takes an extra {@damage 1d6} radiant damage. If you load no ammunition in the weapon, it produces its own, automatically creating one piece of magic ammunition when you make a ranged attack with it. The ammunition created by the weapon vanishes the instant after it hits or misses a target.

While wielding this magic weapon, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to enter a semi-incorporeal state until the start of your next turn. While semi-incorporeal, you have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage. Once this {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Avenging
entries: {@i Requirement: Weapons.}

When you make a ranged {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} with this weapon against your sworn enemy, you have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on the roll. In addition, your target gains no benefit from cover, other than total cover, and you suffer no {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} due to long range. If the attack hits, your sworn enemy takes an extra {@damage 3d6} piercing damage.
While your sworn enemy lives, you have {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} with all other weapons.

item.name: Season's Herald
entries: {@i Requirement: Bows, Crossbows.}

entries.name: Weapon of the Wild
entries: You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon, and you suffer no {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} when attacking at the weapon's long range. Additionally, Ephixis scores a critical hit on a {@dice d20} roll of 19 or 20.

entries.name: Ammunition of the Seasons
entries: Four ammunition—each associated with a season—accompany this weapon can be fired only from it. Each projectile disappears immediately after it's used, and it reappears in the quiver at the next dusk. The save DC against spells cast with the projectile is 18. Each projectile has a unique property:

entries.name: Spring
entries: As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can fire this projectile, targeting a beast or a plant creature you can see within 320 feet of you. On a hit, the projectile deals no damage, and the target gains the benefits of the {@spell Awaken|Ishiir} spell for 8 hours.

entries.name: Summer
entries: As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can fire this projectile at an unoccupied space on the ground that you can see within 320 feet of you, no {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} required. A Nyxborn lynx is summoned in that space (use the stat block for a {@creature tiger} with the {@book Nyxborn traits|MOT|6|Nyxborn Creatures} from chapter 6). The lynx understands your verbal commands and obeys them as best it can, and it takes its turns immediately after yours. The emissary remains for 1 hour before fading away.

entries.name: Autumn
entries: As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can fire this projectile at a space on the ground that you can see within 320 feet of you, no {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} required, casting the {@spell Wall of Thorns|Ishiir} spell there.

entries.name: Winter
entries: As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can fire this projectile at a space that you can see within 320 feet of you, no {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} required, casting the {@spell Ice Storm|Ishiir} spell there.

item.name: Bloodseeker
entries: {@i Requirement: Ammunition.}
Ranged {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} made with this ammunition have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} against any creature doesn't have all its hit points.

item.name: Slaying
entries: {@i Requirement: Ammunition.}

Ammunition with this property is meant to slay a particular kind of creature. If a creature belonging to the type, race, or group associated with the slaying property of an ammunition takes damage from it, the creature must make a DC 17 Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, taking an extra {@dice 6d10} piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much extra damage on a successful one.
Once the ammunition deals its extra damage to a creature, it becomes nonmagical.

item.name: Dragonsight
entries: {@i Requirement: Armors, Weapons.}
A creature attuned to the item gains {@sense blindsight} out to a range of 30 feet.

item.name: Keen
entries: {@i Requirement: Ammunition, Thrown, Weapons.}
The weapon has its critical range increased by 1.

item.name: Vicious
entries: {@i Requirement: Ammunition, Thrown, Weapons.}
When you attack a creature with the weapon and score a critical hit, that target takes an extra 7 damage of the weapon's type.

item.name: Returning
entries: {@i Requirement: Thrown Weapons.}
The weapon flies back to your hand immediately after an attack.

item.name: Refined
entries: {@i Requirement: Weapons.}
The weapon grants the wielder a +1 bonus to hit and damage rolls.

item.name: Warning
entries: {@i Requirement: Weapons.}

The weapon warns you of danger. While the weapon is on your person, you have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on initiative rolls. In addition, you and any of your companions within 30 feet of you can't be {@quickref Surprise|PHB|3|0|surprised}, except when {@condition Incapacitated|Ishiir} by something other than nonmagical sleep. The weapon magically awakens you and your companions within range if any of you are sleeping naturally when combat begins.

item.name: Conflagration
entries: {@i Requirement: Weapons.}

When you hit with an {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} using a weapon with this property, the target takes an extra {@damage 1d6} fire damage. If the target is a flammable, nonmagical object, it catches fire, taking {@damage 1d6} fire damage at the start of each of your turns until a creature uses an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to extinguish the flames.

item.name: Lightbringer
entries: {@i Requirement: Weapons.}
This +1 weapon glows as bright as a {@item torch|phb} when its wielder commands. While glowing, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 1d6} radiant damage to undead creatures.

item.name: Melodic
entries: {@i Requirement: Weapons.}

You can have the weapon with this property play one of the following melodies when you use it to make a weapon attack. You must choose to do so before you make the {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir}, and you can play only one melody per attack.

entries.name: Melody of Precision
entries: If you're {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir|proficient} in {@skill Performance}, you gain a +1 bonus to the {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir}. If you have expertise in {@skill Performance}, you gain a +2 bonus instead.

entries.name: Melody of Reverberation
entries: The melody echoes loudly. On a hit, the target takes extra thunder damage equal to your Charisma modifier.

item.name: Seeking
entries: {@i Requirement: Ammunition, Thrown, Thrown Weapons.}

When you whisper the word "seek" and hurl this weapon, it seeks out a target of your choice within 120 feet of you. You must have seen the target before, but you don't need to see it now. If the target isn't within range or if there is no clear path to it, the weapon falls to the ground, its magic spent and wasted. Otherwise, elemental winds guide the weapon instantly through the air to the target. The weapon can pass though openings as narrow as 1 inch wide and can change direction to fly around corners.

When the weapon reaches its target, the target must succeed on a DC 16 Dexterity {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or take {@damage 1d4} piercing damage and {@damage 3d4} lightning damage. The weapon's magic is then spent, and it becomes an ordinary weapon.

item.name: Ghoulsbane
entries: {@i Requirement: Ammunition, Thrown, Melee Weapons.}
You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with the weapon.

When you hit an undead creature with an attack using this weapon, the attack deals an extra {@damage 1d8} damage of the weapon's type, and the creature has {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} against effects that turn undead until the start of your next turn.

item.name: Giantsbane
entries: {@i Requirement: Ammunition, Thrown, Weapons.}
You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with the weapon.

When you hit a giant with it, the giant takes an extra {@dice 2d6} damage of the weapon's type and must succeed on a DC 15 Strength {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or fall {@condition Prone|Ishiir}. For the purpose of this weapon, "giant" refers to any creature with the giant type, including ettins and trolls.

item.name: Envenomed
entries: {@i Requirement: Ammunition, Thrown, Piercing Weapons.}
The weapon has a coat of black poison and gains a +1 bonus to hit and damage rolls.
A creature must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or take {@damage 2d10} poison damage and become {@condition Poisoned|Ishiir} for 1 minute when hit.

item.name: Elemental Tongue
entries: {@i Requirement: Ammunition, Thrown Weapons, Melee Weapons.}

You can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to speak this weapon's command word, causing the weapon's element to erupt from it. The weapon sheds bright light in a 40-foot radius and dim light for an additional 40 feet. While the weapon is activated, it deals an extra {@dice 2d6} damage of the relevant type to any target it hits. The weapon remains active until you use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to speak the command word again or until you drop or sheathe/put away the weapon.

item.name: Returning Storm
entries: {@i Requirement: Thrown, Thrown Weapons.}

When thrown, the weapon has a range of 60/120 feet, and any creature that is {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir|proficient} with the {@item javelin|Ishiir} is also {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir|proficient} with the weapon. On a hit, the weapon deals {@damage 1d4} bludgeoning damage and {@damage 3d4} thunder damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or be {@condition Stunned|Ishiir} until the end of its next turn. After the attack, the weapon returns to the thrower's hand.
The elemental damage and the ability to stun a target can only be applied once per turn.

item.name: Seeking Flight
entries: {@i Requirement: Ammunition, Thrown, Thrown Weapons.}
You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon.

When you make a ranged attack with this weapon and hit a target, you can cause the ammunition to ricochet toward a second target within 10 feet of the first, and then make a ranged attack against the second target.

item.name: Dragonsbane
entries: {@i Requirement: Ammunition, Thrown, Weapons.}
You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with the weapon.

When you hit a dragon with this weapon, the dragon takes an extra {@dice 3d6} damage of the weapon's type. For the purpose of this weapon, "dragon" refers to any creature with the dragon type, including dragon turtles and wyverns.

item.name: Stormbringer
entries: {@i Requirement: Ammunition, Weapons.}

When you hurl the weapon and speak its command word, it transforms into a bolt of lightning, forming a line 5 feet wide that extends out from you to a target within 120 feet. Each creature in the line excluding you and the target must make a DC 13 Dexterity {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, taking {@damage 4d6} lightning damage on a failed save, and half as much damage on a successful one. The lightning bolt turns back into the weapon when it reaches the target. Make a ranged weapon attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes damage from the weapon plus {@damage 4d6} lightning damage.
This property can't be used again until after a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}. In the meantime, the weapon can still be used as a magic weapon.

item.name: Speed
entries: {@i Requirement: Weapons.}
You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with the weapon. In addition, you can make one attack with it as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} on each of your turns.

item.name: Winter's Fang
entries: {@i Requirement: Ammunition, Slashing/Piercing Thrown, Slashing/Piercing Weapons.}
The weapon gains a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls.

You are {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir|Immune} to cold damage while holding the weapon. Whenever it deals damage to a creature, the hammer radiates a burst of intense cold in a 30-foot-radius sphere. Each creature in that area takes {@damage 3d6} cold damage.

item.name: Mirror Blade
entries: {@i Requirement: Piercing Thrown Weapons.}
You can speak, read, and write Abyssal.
You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with the weapon. Immediately after you make a ranged attack with this weapon, it returns to your hand.

Whenever you kill a humanoid with an attack using the weapon, the weapon remembers the creature's appearance. While holding the weapon, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to change your form to match any humanoid the weapon remembers. Your statistics, other than your size, don't change. Any equipment you are wearing or carrying isn't transformed. You can revert to your true appearance as an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}. You revert to your true appearance automatically when you die. When the weapon is attuned to a new wielder, the appearances of humanoids it has killed are lost.

While holding the weapon, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to cast one of the following spells from it (save DC 17): {@spell Fabricate|Ishiir}, {@spell Hallucinatory Terrain|Ishiir}, {@spell Major Image|Ishiir}, or {@spell Phantasmal Killer|Ishiir}. Once a spell has been cast using the weapon, that spell can't be cast from the weapon again until the next dawn.

While holding the weapon, you can turn {@condition Invisible|Ishiir} as an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}. Anything you are wearing or carrying is invisible with you. You remain {@condition Invisible|Ishiir} until you stop holding the weapon, until you attack or cast a spell that forces a creature to make a {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, or until you use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to become visible again.

item.name: Slaughter's Harbinger
entries: {@i Requirement: Thrown Weapons.}
You can speak, read, and write Abyssal and Orc.

You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with the weapon, and it deals an extra {@damage 2d8} piercing damage to any target it hits. Immediately after you make a ranged attack with this weapon, it flies back to your hand.

As a {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} when you are hit by a melee attack, you can make a melee attack with the weapon with {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} against the attacker. You can't use this property again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

When you hurl the weapon and speak a command word, it transforms into a bolt of lightning, forming a line 5 feet wide that extends out from you to a creature you can see within 120 feet of you. Each creature in the line, excluding you, must make a DC 15 Dexterity {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, taking {@damage 8d6} lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The weapon then returns to your hand. This property can't be used again until the next dawn.

While holding the weapon, you can let out a battle cry as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}. Each creature you choose within 30 feet of you gains {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} until the start of your next turn. This property can't be used again until the next dawn.

When you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with an attack from the weapon, you can regain hit points equal to the damage you dealt with the attack. This property can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Shining Ray
entries: {@i Requirement: Thrown Weapons, Weapons.}

entries.name: Weapon of the Sun
entries: This weapon grants a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. When you hit with an attack using this weapon, the target takes an extra {@damage 2d8} radiant damage.

entries.name: Luminous
entries: The weapon sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. The light is sunlight.

entries.name: Sun's Retaliation
entries: When you take damage from a creature within 5 feet of you, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to make a melee attack with the weapon against that creature. On a hit, the weapon deals damage as normal, and the creature is {@condition Blinded|Ishiir} until the start of its next turn. This property of the weapon can't be used again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Spells
entries: The weapon has 10 charges. While holding it, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells (save DC 18) from it: {@spell Guiding Bolt|Ishiir} (1 charge), {@spell Daylight|Ishiir} (3 charges, targeting the tip of the weapon only), {@spell Sunbeam|Ishiir} (6 charges). The weapon regains {@dice 1d6 + 4} expended charges daily at dawn.

item.name: Thalassian Call
entries: {@i Requirement: Piercing Thrown Weapons, Piercing Weapons.}

entries.name: Weapon of the Deep
entries: This weapon functions as a trident that grants a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. When you hit with an attack using the weapon, the target takes an extra {@damage 2d10} cold damage.

entries.name: Command the Deep
entries: The weapon holds the power to command the waves and its creatures. As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can change the condition of the sea within 1 mile of you, creating strong winds and heavy rain that cause violent waves (see "Weather at Sea" in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide) or calming a storm. In either case, the unnatural weather lasts for 1 hour before returning to normal. Once used, this property of the weapon can't be used again until the next dusk.

Additionally, you can cast the {@spell Dominate Monster|Ishiir} spell (save DC 18) from the weapon, but only on beasts and monstrosities that have an innate {@variantrule Swim Speed|Ishiir}. Once used, this property of the weapon can't be used again until the next dusk.

entries.name: Aquatic Metamorphosis
entries: You can cast the {@spell True Polymorph|Ishiir} spell (save DC 18) from the weapon, but you must cast it on a creature to turn it into a kind of creature that has an innate {@variantrule Swim Speed|Ishiir}. Once used, this property of the weapon can't be used again until the next dusk.

item.name: Healer's Kit
entries: This kit is a leather pouch containing bandages, salves, and splints. The kit has ten uses. As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can expend one use of the kit to stabilize a creature that has 0 hit points, without needing to make a Wisdom ({@skill Medicine}) check.

item.name: Antitoxin
entries: A creature that drinks this vial of liquid gains {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} against poison for 1 hour. It confers no benefit to undead or constructs.

item.name: Potion of Healing
entries: You regain {@dice 2d4 + 2} hit points when you drink this potion. The potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.
{@b Masterwork}: You regain 10 hit points instead.

item.name: Potion of Healing (Greater)
entries: You regain {@dice 4d4 + 4} hit points when you drink this potion. The potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.
{@b Masterwork}: You regain 20 hit points instead.

item.name: Potion of Healing (Superior)
entries: You regain {@dice 8d4 + 8} hit points when you drink this potion. The potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.
{@b Masterwork}: You regain 40 hit points instead.

item.name: Elixir of Health
entries: When you drink this potion, it cures any disease afflicting you, and it removes the {@condition Blinded|Ishiir}, {@condition Deafened|Ishiir}, {@condition Paralyzed|Ishiir}, and {@condition Poisoned|Ishiir} conditions. The clear red liquid has tiny bubbles of light in it.

item.name: Fireward Balm
entries: This paste made from the {@item Nostrian Palm|Ishiir} tree is known to help prevent sunburn, but it is also a fire retardant. After spending 1 minute applying a quarter pint of fireward balm to your skin, you gain {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} against fire damage for 1 hour.
A dose of fireward balm sufficient for treating sunburn costs 1 gp.

item.name: Potion of Revitalization
entries: If your maximum hit points were reduced, you regain all of them and an amount of hit points equal to the maximum hit points you were missing.

item.name: Gold Oil
entries: A dark blue oil can be extracted from a {@item Sylvan Pepper|Ishiir}. A creature can use its action to apply the oil to another creature that has been {@condition Petrified|Ishiir} for less than 1 minute, causing the {@condition Petrified|Ishiir} condition on that creature to end at the start of what would be that creature's next turn.

item.name: Sylvan Tea
entries: These dried petals of the {@item Sylvan Lotus|Ishiir}, when steeped to make a tea, can help a body recover from strenuous activity. If you drink a dose of Sylvan Tea during a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}, your {@condition Exhaustion|Ishiir} level is reduced by 2 instead of 1 at the end of that {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

item.name: Black Incense
entries: This substance harvested from the dark boughs of a {@item Black Willow|Ishiir} is a powerful intoxicant. A creature subjected to a dose of black incense cannot be {@condition Charmed|Ishiir} or {@condition Frightened|Ishiir} for {@dice 1d6} hours.

For each dose of black incense, a creature must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or become {@condition Poisoned|Ishiir} for {@dice 2d4} hours—an effect that is cumulative with multiple doses.

item.name: Keoghtom's Ointment
entries: This glass jar, 3 inches in diameter, contains {@dice 1d4 + 1} doses of a thick mixture that smells faintly of berries.

As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, one dose of the ointment can be swallowed or applied to the skin. The creature that receives it regains {@dice 2d8 + 2} hit points, ceases to be {@condition Poisoned|Ishiir}, and is cured of any disease.

item.name: Ointment of Lucidity
entries: This bitter chartreuse concoction is distilled from the {@item Death Cap|Ishiir} fungus. The sickly green liqueur harbors potent psychedelic properties. Provided it is neither a construct nor undead, a creature subjected to a dose of this ointment gains {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on Intelligence and Wisdom {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks}, as well as vulnerability to psychic damage, for 1 hour. For each dose consumed, the creature must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or become {@condition Poisoned|Ishiir} for {@dice 1d6} hours and suffer the effects of a {@spell Confusion|Ishiir} spell for 1 minute. An undead creature subjected to a dose gains {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on all Dexterity {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks} and is {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir|Immune} to the {@condition Frightened|Ishiir} condition for 1 hour.

item.name: Potion of Healing (Supreme)
entries: You regain {@dice 10d4 + 20} hit points when you drink this potion. The potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.
{@b Masterwork}: You regain 60 hit points instead.

item.name: Potion of Vitality
entries: When you drink this potion, it removes any {@condition Exhaustion|Ishiir} you are suffering and cures any disease or poison affecting you. For the next 24 hours, you regain the maximum number of hit points for any Hit Die you spend. The potion's crimson liquid regularly pulses with dull light, calling to mind a heartbeat.

item.name: Potion of Healing (Legendary)
entries: You regain all hit points when you drink this potion.

item.name: Potion of Regeneration
entries: 1 hour duration. You regain {@dice 4d8+15} hit points and 10 hit point at the start of each of your turns as long as you have at least 1 hit point remaining. Severed limbs regrow and regain functionality within 2 minutes. Holding a severed limb to its stump causes it to reattach within one turn.

item.name: Potion of Longevity
entries: When you drink this potion, your physical age is reduced by {@dice 1d6 + 6} years, to a minimum of 13 years. Each time you subsequently drink a potion of longevity, there is 10 percent cumulative chance that you instead age by {@dice 1d6 + 6} years. Suspended in this amber liquid are a scorpion's tail, an adder's fang, a dead spider, and a tiny heart that, against all reason, is still beating. These ingredients vanish when the potion is opened.
{@b Masterwork}: This potion still only has a single use, but the cumulative effects do not apply.

item.name: Feywrought
entries: {@i Requirement: Armors.}
While wearing this armor, you have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} you make to avoid or end the charmed condition on yourself.

This armor has 3 charges. You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to expend a charge to cast the {@spell Compulsion|Ishiir} spell (save DC 15) from this armor. The armor regains {@dice 1d3} expended charges daily at dawn.

item.name: Bloodletter's Coat
entries: {@i Requirement: Armors.}
You have a +1 bonus to AC while wearing the armor.

The coat has 3 charges. When you hit a creature with an attack and that creature doesn't have all its hit points, you can expend 1 charge to deal an extra {@damage 1d10} necrotic damage to the target. The coat regains {@dice 1d3} expended charges daily at dawn.

item.name: Serpent's Coil
entries: {@i Requirement: Armors.}

You gain a +2 bonus to AC and {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to poison damage while you wear the armor. In addition, you gain {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|Ability Checks} and {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} made to avoid or end the {@condition Grappled|Ishiir} condition on yourself.

item.name: Emerald Warden
entries: {@i Requirement: Armors.}
You gain a +3 bonus to AC while you wear the armor.
While you are transformed by an effect that replaces any of your game statistics with those of another creature, your melee attack and damage rolls gain a +3 bonus.

As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can use the armor to cast {@spell Polymorph|Ishiir} on yourself, transforming into a {@creature giant owl}, a {@creature cave bear}, or a {@creature guardian wolf|EGW} while retaining your Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores. This property can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Basic Venom
entries: A creature subjected to this poison must make a DC 10 Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. On a failed save, it takes {@damage 1d4} poison damage.

item.name: Web Lurker's Kiss
entries: A creature subjected to this poison must make a DC 12 Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 2d8} poison damage and becomes {@condition Poisoned|Ishiir}. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and does not become {@condition Poisoned|Ishiir}. The creature may repeat the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a successful save. If the creature fails the save by 5 or more, it is subjected to the {@spell Slow|Ishiir} effect.

item.name: Fungus Fumes
entries: A creature subjected to this poison must make a DC 12 Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. On a failed save, the creature becomes {@condition Confused|Ishiir}. The creature may repeat the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a successful save.

item.name: Stone Lung
entries: A creature subjected to this poison must make a DC 11 Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. On a failed save, the creature becomes {@condition Poisoned|Ishiir} and is choking while {@condition Poisoned|Ishiir} this way. The creature may repeat the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a successful save. If the creature fails the save by 5 or more, it is subjected to gradual petrification as per {@spell Flesh  to Stone|Ishiir}.

item.name: Broodmother's Kiss
entries: A creature subjected to this poison must make a DC 12 Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 4d8} poison damage and becomes {@condition Poisoned|Ishiir}. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and does not become {@condition Poisoned|Ishiir}. The creature may repeat the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a successful save. While {@condition Poisoned|Ishiir} this way, the creature is also {@condition Restrained|Ishiir} and {@condition Prone|Ishiir}.

item.name: Corpse Crawler Mucus
entries: A creature subjected to this poison must make a DC 14 Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 2d8} poison damage and becomes {@condition Poisoned|Ishiir}. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and does not become {@condition Poisoned|Ishiir}. The creature may repeat the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a successful save. If the creature fails the save by 5 or more, it becomes {@condition Paralyzed|Ishiir}.

item.name: Manticore Venom
entries: A creature subjected to this poison must make a DC 14 Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 4d6} poison damage and becomes {@condition Poisoned|Ishiir}. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and does not become {@condition Poisoned|Ishiir}. The creature may repeat the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a successful save.

item.name: Swampblood
entries: A creature subjected to this poison must make a DC 15 Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 3d6} poison damage. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage.

item.name: Spiketail Wyvern's Sting
entries: A creature subjected to this poison must make a DC 12 Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 4d8} poison damage and becomes {@condition Poisoned|Ishiir}. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and does not become {@condition Poisoned|Ishiir}. The creature may repeat the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a successful save. If the creature fails the save by 5 or more, it becomes {@condition Stunned|Ishiir} until the end of its next turn.

item.name: Cloaksman's Farewell
entries: A creature subjected to this poison takes {@damage 4d6} poison damage.

item.name: Lullaby
entries: A creature subjected to this poison must make a DC 14 Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. On a failed save, the creature becomes {@condition Poisoned|Ishiir}. While {@condition Poisoned|Ishiir}  this way the creature falls asleep and cannot be woken, becoming {@condition Incapacitated|Ishiir} for the duration.

item.name: Deep Scorpion's Venom
entries: A creature subjected to this poison must make a DC 13 Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 5d6} poison damage and becomes {@condition Poisoned|Ishiir}. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and does not become {@condition Poisoned|Ishiir}. The creature may repeat the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a successful save. If the creature fails the save by 5 or more, it falls {@condition Unconscious|Ishiir}.

item.name: Myststalker Venom
entries: A creature subjected to this poison must make a DC 14 Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 3d6} poison damage and becomes {@condition Poisoned|Ishiir}. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and does not become {@condition Poisoned|Ishiir}. The creature may repeat the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a successful save. If the creature fails the save by 5 or more, it becomes {@condition Confused|Ishiir}.

item.name: Retcher
entries: A creature subjected to this poison must make a DC 15 Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. On a failed save, the creature becomes {@condition Poisoned|Ishiir}. The creature may repeat the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a successful save. While {@condition Poisoned|Ishiir} this way, the creature must spend his action retching and choking.

item.name: Choker
entries: A creature subjected to this poison must make a DC 16 Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. On a failed save, the creature becomes {@condition Poisoned|Ishiir}. While {@condition Poisoned|Ishiir} this way, the creature is choking. The creature may repeat the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a successful save.

item.name: Deep Crawler Mucus
entries: A creature subjected to this poison must make a DC 16 Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 3d8} poison damage and becomes {@condition Poisoned|Ishiir}. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and does not become {@condition Poisoned|Ishiir}. While {@condition Poisoned|Ishiir} this way, the creature also becomes {@condition Blinded|Ishiir}. The creature may repeat the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a successful save. If the creature fails the save by 5 or more, it becomes {@condition Paralyzed|Ishiir}.

item.name: Greater Stone Lung
entries: A creature subjected to this poison must make a DC 16 Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. On a failed save, the creature becomes {@condition Poisoned|Ishiir}. While {@condition Poisoned|Ishiir} this way, the creature is choking. The creature may repeat the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a successful save. If the creature fails the save by 5 or more, it is subjected to gradual petrification as per {@spell Flesh  to Stone|Ishiir}.

item.name: Blackskin
entries: A creature subjected to this poison must make a DC 16 Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 3d6} poison damage and it is subjected to gradual petrification as per {@spell Flesh  to Stone|Ishiir}. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and suffers no additional effects.

item.name: Swamp Lurker's Kiss
entries: A creature subjected to this poison must make a DC 16 Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 5d6} poison damage and becomes {@condition Poisoned|Ishiir}. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and does not become {@condition Poisoned|Ishiir}. While {@condition Poisoned|Ishiir} this way, the creature is {@condition Blinded|Ishiir} and choking.

item.name: Basilisk Venom
entries: A creature subjected to this poison must make a DC 17 Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 5d6} poison damage and it is subjected to gradual petrification as per {@spell Flesh  to Stone|Ishiir}. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and suffers no additional effects.

item.name: Greater Basilisk Venom
entries: A creature subjected to this poison must make a DC 19 Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 6d6} poison damage and it is subjected to gradual petrification as per {@spell Flesh  to Stone|Ishiir}. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and suffers no additional effects.

item.name: Dismembering
entries: {@i Requirement: Slashing Weapons.}
When you attack an object with the weapon, maximize your weapon damage dice against the target.

When you attack a creature with the weapon and score a critical hit, that target takes an extra 14 damage of the weapon's type. Then roll another {@dice d20}. If you roll a 20, you lop off one of the target's limbs, with the effect of such loss determined by the DM. If the creature has no limb to sever, you lop off a portion of its body instead.
