In addition, you can speak a command word to cause the weapon to shed bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. Speaking the command word again or sheathing the weapon puts out the light.

item.name: Perfect Balance
entries: {@i Requirement: Monk Weapons.}
Once per day, you can use your Patience Defense feature using a {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir}.

item.name: Serrated
entries: {@i Requirement: Slashing Melee Weapons.}

This weapon is outfitted with serrated edges to deal gaping wounds. Each time you deal damage to a creature with this weapon, the target has to make a DC 14 Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. On a failure, the target becomes {@condition Lacerated|Ishiir} for 1 minute. At the end of each of its turns, the target can repeat the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, ending the effect on it on a success.

item.name: Bloodrage
entries: {@i Requirement: Weapons.}
You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon while you have half your hit points or fewer.

item.name: Terrifying
entries: {@i Requirement: Melee Weapons.}

The weapon has 3 charges. While holding it, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} and expend 1 charge to release a wave of terror. Each creature of your choice in a 30-foot radius extending from you must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or become {@condition Frightened|Ishiir} of you for 1 minute. While it is {@condition Frightened|Ishiir} in this way, a creature must spend its turns trying to move as far away from you as it can, and it can't willingly move to a space within 30 feet of you. It also can't take {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir|Reactions}. For its action it can use only the {@action Dash} action or try to escape from an effect that prevents it from moving. If it has nowhere it can move, the creature can use the {@action Dodge} action. At the end of each of its turns, a creature can repeat the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, ending the effect on itself on a success.
The weapon regains {@dice 1d3} expended charges daily at dawn.

item.name: Shattering
entries: {@i Requirement: Bludgeoning Weapons.}

You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with the weapon. If it hits an object, the hit is automatically a critical hit, and it can deal bludgeoning or slashing damage to the object (your choice). Further, damage from nonmagical sources can't harm the weapon.

item.name: Blackblade
entries: {@i Requirement: Melee Weapons.}
You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with the weapon. While the weapon is on your person, you are {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir|Immune} to effects that turn undead.

entries.name: Dark Blessing
entries: While holding the weapon, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to give yourself {@dice 1d4 + 4} temporary hit points. This property can't be used again until the next dusk.

entries.name: Disheartening Strike
entries: When you hit a creature with an attack using this weapon, you can fill the target with unsettling dread: the target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on the next {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} it makes before the end of your next turn. The creature ignores this effect if it's {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir|Immune} to the {@condition Frightened|Ishiir} condition. Once you use this property, you can't do so again until the next dusk.

item.name: Fate Cutter
entries: {@i Requirement: Slashing Melee Weapons.}
The weapon functions as a magic weapon and has the following properties:

items.name: Ever Sharp
entries: When you hit with an attack using the weapon, the target takes an extra {@damage 1d6} force damage.

items.name: Sever Threads
entries: When you hit a creature with the weapon, you can cut that creature's fate. Until the target finishes a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}, {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} against it score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20 on the {@dice d20}. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Toxic
entries: {@i Requirement: Weapons.}
You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon, and it deals double damage to objects and structures.

Additionally, when you hit a creature with this weapon, you can force the creature to make a DC 15 Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. On a failed save, the creature has the poisoned condition for 1 minute. The poisoned creature takes {@damage 2d4} necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns. The creature can repeat the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Once this property is used in this way, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Baleful Talon
entries: {@i Requirement: Weapons.}
You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

When you hit a creature with this magic weapon and roll a 19 or 20 on the {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir}, the creature must make a DC 15 Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} as the weapon flares with sickly light. The creature takes {@damage 6d6} necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. If this damage reduces the creature to 0 hit points, the creature disintegrates into dust.

item.name: Disruption
entries: {@i Requirement: Melee Weapons.}

When you hit a fiend or an undead with the weapon, that creature takes an extra {@damage 2d6} radiant damage. If the target has 25 hit points or fewer after taking this damage, it must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or be destroyed. On a successful save, the creature becomes {@condition Frightened|Ishiir} of you until the end of your next turn.
While you hold this weapon, it sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet.

item.name: Frost Brand
entries: {@i Requirement: Melee Weapons.}
When you hit with an attack using the weapon, the target takes an extra {@dice 1d6} cold damage. In addition, while you hold the sword, you have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to fire damage.
In freezing temperatures, the weapon sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet.
When you draw this weapon, you can extinguish all nonmagical flames within 30 feet of you. This property can be used no more than once per hour.

item.name: Runic Focus
entries: {@i Requirement: Melee Weapons.}

This magic weapon has 3 charges. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can expend 1 charge and hit the ground with this weapon, creating a 15-foot-radius circle of glowing runes centered on the point of impact. While you're inside that area, your weapon glows with matching runes, and you gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon. The rune circle disappears after 1 minute, when you create another rune circle, or when you dismiss the rune circle as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}. This weapon regains {@dice 1d3} expended charges daily at dawn.

item.name: Bloodthirster
entries: {@i Requirement: Melee Weapons.}
You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with the weapon.
When you hit with a melee attack using the weapon and reduce the target to 0 hit points, you gain {@dice 2d6} temporary hit points.

item.name: Forcebreaker
entries: {@i Requirement: Weapons.}
You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

This weapon was crafted to destroy structures made of force, such as those created by {@spell Forcecage|Ishiir} or {@spell Wall of Force|Ishiir}. Striking a Large or smaller structure of magical force with this weapon automatically shatters that structure. If the target is a Huge or larger structure of force, this weapon shatters a 20-foot-cube portion of it.

item.name: Mindblade
entries: {@i Requirement: Slashing Weapons.}
The weapon deals an extra {@dice 2d6} psychic damage to any target it hits.

item.name: Illusory
entries: {@i Requirement: Melee Weapons.}
This weapon appears ordinary, but it bears strong illusion magic that allows its wielder to skillfully deceive opponents.
You have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. While wielding it, you also gain the following benefits:

items.name: Fool's Feint
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can feint, choosing a creature within 5 feet of you as your target. Until the start of your next turn, you have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} against the target. Once this {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

items.name: Misdirect
entries: When a creature within 60 feet of you targets you with an {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir}, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to require that creature to make a DC 15 Intelligence {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. On a failed save, the attack instead targets another creature of your choice that is within the attacker's reach. Once this {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} has been used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Devotee's Censer
entries: {@i Requirement: Bludgeoning Melee Weapons.}

The rounded head of this flail is perforated with tiny holes, arranged in symbols and patterns. The flail counts as a holy symbol for you. When you hit with an attack using the flail, the target takes an extra {@damage 1d8} radiant damage.

As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can speak the command word to cause the flail to emanate a thin cloud of incense out to 10 feet for 1 minute. At the start of each of your turns, you and any other creatures in the incense each regain {@dice 1d4} hit points. This property can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Executing
entries: {@i Requirement: Slashing Weapons.}
You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with the weapon.

The weapon has {@dice 1d8 + 1} charges. If you score a critical hit against a creature that has fewer than 100 hit points, it must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or be slain instantly as the weapon tears its life force from its body (a construct or an undead is {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir|Immune}). The weapon loses 1 charge if the creature is slain. When the weapon has no charges remaining, it loses this property.

item.name: Sunblade
entries: {@i Requirement: Slashing Weapons.}

This item appears to be a weapon's hilt. While grasping the hilt, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to cause a blade of pure radiance to spring into existence, or make the blade disappear. While the blade exists, the weapon has the finesse property.

You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon, which deals radiant damage instead of slashing damage. When you hit an undead with it, that target takes an extra {@damage 1d8} radiant damage.

The luminous blade emits bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 15 feet. The light is sunlight. While the blade persists, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to expand or reduce its radius of bright and dim light by 5 feet each, to a maximum of 30 feet each or a minimum of 10 feet each.

item.name: Tidecaller
entries: {@i Requirement: Piercing Melee Weapons.}

You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. You also have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} made with this weapon while underwater.

This weapon has 3 charges. You can expend 1 charge to cast {@spell Control Water|Ishiir} (save DC 15) from the weapon or 3 charges to cast {@spell Tsunami|Ishiir} (save DC 15) from it instead. The weapon regains {@dice 1d3} expended charges daily at dawn.

item.name: Lockbane
entries: {@i Requirement: Melee Weapons.}
A weapon that is given this property transforms into a key. While holding it in its key form, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to cast the {@spell Knock|Ishiir} spell from the key.

entries.name: Transforming the Key
entries: While holding the key, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to transform it into a magic longsword. You are considered {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir|proficient} with the sword, and you have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. On a hit, the sword deals {@damage 1d10} force damage. The item remains in its sword form until it leaves your grasp or you use another {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to revert it to its key form.
If you end your attunement to the item while it's in its sword form, it automatically reverts to its key form.

item.name: Lifedrinker
item.reqAttune: by an evil cleric or paladin
entries: {@i Requirement: Piercing/Slashing Weapons.}

You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls with the weapon. If you attack a creature with this weapon and roll a 20 on the {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir}, the creature takes an extra {@damage 2d8} necrotic damage, and you regain a number of hit points equal to the necrotic damage taken.

item.name: Feywind
entries: {@i Requirement: Melee Weapons.}
The weapon gains a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls.
The weapon can't be damaged or dulled, and it can't be teleported anywhere without its wielder while the two are attuned to one another.

entries.name: Spells
entries: The weapon with this property has 6 charges and regains {@dice 1d4 + 2} expended charges daily at dawn. A creature attuned to it can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} and expend 1 or more charges to cast one of the following spells from it without material components: {@spell Fly|Ishiir} (2 charges), {@spell Polymorph|Ishiir} (3 charges), or {@spell Transport via Plants|Ishiir} (4 charges).
When you attack an object with the weapon, maximize your weapon damage dice against the target.

When you attack a creature with the weapon and score a critical hit, that target takes an extra 14 damage of the weapon's type. Then roll another {@dice d20}. If you roll a 20, you lop off one of the target's limbs, with the effect of such loss determined by the DM. If the creature has no limb to sever, you lop off a portion of its body instead.

You can speak a command word to cause the weapon to shed bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. Speaking the command word again or sheathing the weapon puts out the light.

item.name: Defender
entries: {@i Requirement: Melee Weapons.}
You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with the weapon.

The first time you attack with the weapon on each of your turns, you can transfer some or all of the weapon's bonus to your Armor Class, instead of using the bonus on any attacks that turn. For example, you could reduce the bonus to your attack and damage rolls to +1 and gain a +2 bonus to AC. The adjusted bonuses remain in effect until the start of your next turn, although you must hold the weapon to gain a bonus to AC from it.

item.name: Archmage's Companion
entries: {@i Requirement: Melee Weapons.}
This +3 dagger allows you to use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to activate one of the following properties:

items: Cause a blue gem set into the dagger's pommel to shed bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet, or make the gem go dark.
Turn the dagger into a compass that, while resting on your palm, points north.
Cast {@spell Dimension Door|Ishiir} from the dagger. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

Cast {@spell Compulsion|Ishiir} (save DC 15) from the dagger. The range of the spell increases to 90 feet but it targets only spiders that are beasts. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Dancing
entries: {@i Requirement: Melee Weapons.}

You can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to toss the weapon into the air and speak the command word. When you do so, the weapon begins to hover, flies up to 30 feet, and attacks one creature of your choice within 5 feet of it. The weapon uses your {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} and ability score modifier to damage rolls.

While the weapon hovers, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to cause it to fly up to 30 feet to another spot within 30 feet of you. As part of the same {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can cause the weapon to attack one creature within 5 feet of it.

After the hovering weapon attacks for the fourth time, it flies up to 30 feet and tries to return to your hand. If you have no hand free, it falls to the ground at your feet. If the weapon has no unobstructed path to you, it moves as close to you as it can and then falls to the ground. It also ceases to hover if you grasp it or move more than 30 feet away from it.

item.name: Dwarven Thrower
entries: {@i Requirement: Thrown Axes, Thrown Hammers.}

You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with the weapon. It has the thrown property with a normal range of 20 feet and a long range of 60 feet. When you hit with a ranged attack using this weapon, it deals an extra {@damage 1d8} damage or, if the target is a giant, {@damage 2d8} damage. Immediately after the attack, the weapon flies back to your hand.

item.name: Moonsong Blade
entries: {@i Requirement: Slashing Weapons.}

Of all the magic items created by the elves, one of the most prized and jealously guarded is a moonsong blade. In ancient times, nearly all elven noble houses claimed one such blade. Over the centuries, some blades have faded from the world, their magic lost as family lines have become extinct. Other blades have vanished with their bearers during great quests. Thus, only a few of these weapons remain.

A moonsong blade passes down from parent to child. The sword chooses its bearer and remains bonded to that person for life. If the bearer dies, another heir can claim the blade. If no worthy heir exists, the sword lies dormant. It functions like a normal weapon until a worthy soul finds it and lays claim to its power.
A moonsong blade serves only one master at a time. The attunement process requires a special ritual in the throne room of an elven regent or in a temple dedicated to the elven gods.

A moonsong blade won't serve anyone it regards as craven, erratic, corrupt, or at odds with preserving and protecting elvenkind. If the blade rejects you, you make {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|Ability Checks}, {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls}, and {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} with {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} for 24 hours. If the blade accepts you, you become attuned to it and a new rune appears on the blade. You remain attuned to the weapon until you die or the weapon is destroyed.

A moonsong blade has one rune on its blade for each master it has served (typically {@dice 1d6 + 1}). The first rune always grants a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with the weapon. Each rune beyond the first grants the moon blade an additional property.

items: +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls
critical range is increased by 1
attacks deal an extra {@damage 1d6} slashing damage
bearer can use {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to have the weapon emit light in a 15/15 radius or extinguish it, this counts as moonlight
the weapon makes melodic sounds when drawn from its sheath or swung
the weapon grants a +2 bonus to initiative rolls

item.name: Dawnbringer
item.reqAttune: by a creature of non-evil alignment
entries: {@i Requirement: Melee Weapons.}

While grasping the hilt of the weapon, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to make a blade of pure radiance spring from the hilt, or cause the blade to disappear. While the blade exists, the weapon has the finesse property.

You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon, which deals radiant damage instead of the normal weapon's damage. When you hit an undead with it, that target takes an extra {@damage 1d8} radiant damage.

The sword's luminous blade emits bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 15 feet. The light is sunlight. While the blade persists, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to expand or reduce its radius of bright and dim light by 5 feet each, to a maximum of 30 feet each or a minimum of 10 feet each.

While holding the weapon, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to touch a creature with the blade and cast {@spell Lesser Restoration|Ishiir} on that creature. Once used, this ability can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Azuredge
entries: {@i Requirement: Slashing Weapons.}

You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with the weapon. The {@spell Shield|Ishiir} spell provides no defense against the weapon, which passes through that spell's barrier of magical force.
When you hit a fiend or an undead with the weapon, cold blue flames erupt from its blade and deal an extra {@damage 2d6} radiant damage to the target.

entries.name: Hurling
entries: The weapon has 3 charges. You can expend 1 charge and make a ranged attack with the weapon, hurling it as if it had the thrown property with a normal range of 60 feet and a long range of 180 feet. Whether it hits or misses, the weapon flies back to you at the end of the current turn, landing in your open hand or at your feet in your space (as you choose). The weapon regains all expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Illumination
entries: While holding the weapon, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to cause the weapon to glow blue or to quench the glow. This glow sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet.

item.name: Riftmaker
entries: {@i Requirement: Slashing Melee Weapons.}
You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic sword.

This sword can tear the fabric of reality, creating a temporary rift between planes. You can use your action to choose a different plane of existence from the one you're on and slice through an unoccupied space within 5 feet of yourself, creating a rift to that other plane. The rift can be up to 10 feet high and 10 feet wide, and it lasts for 1 minute. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

You can specify a target destination, such as the City of Brass on the Elemental Plane of Fire or the palace of Dispater on the second layer of the Nine Hells, and the rift opens in or near that destination (DM's discretion). If you are trying to reach the City of Brass, for example, the rift might appear on the Street of Steel, before the Gate of Ashes, or facing the city from across the Sea of Fire, at the DM's discretion.
Anything that enters the rift is instantly transported to the other plane, appearing in the unoccupied space nearest to the rift.

item.name: Imperious
entries: {@i Requirement: Melee Weapons.}

You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon. Additionally, you gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in the {@skill Intimidation} and {@skill Persuasion} skills if you don't already have it.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries: The weapon has 5 charges. You can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} and expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells (save DC 16): {@spell Command|Ishiir} (1 charge), {@spell Zone of Truth|Ishiir} (2 charges), {@spell Compulsion|Ishiir} (4 charges), {@spell Banishment|Ishiir} (4 charges), or {@spell Dominate Person|Ishiir} (5 charges).
The weapon regains {@dice 1d4} expended charges daily at dawn.

item.name: Vorpal
entries: {@i Requirement: Slashing Weapons.}
You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with the weapon. In addition, the weapon ignores {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to slashing damage.

When you attack a creature that has at least one head with this weapon and roll a 20 on the {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir}, you cut off one of the creature's heads. The creature dies if it can't survive without the lost head. A creature is {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir|Immune} to this effect if it is {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir|Immune} to slashing damage, doesn't have or need a head, has legendary actions, or the DM decides that the creature is too big for its head to be cut off with this weapon. Such a creature instead takes an extra {@dice 6d8} slashing damage from the hit.

item.name: Death's Caress
entries: {@i Requirement: Slashing Weapons.}

Even if you aren't attuned to the the weapon with this property, you gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon. If you are not attuned with it, you deal an extra {@damage 1d6} necrotic damage when you hit with the weapon.

entries.name: Increased Potency
entries: While you are attuned to the weapon a hit deals an extra {@damage 2d6} necrotic damage (instead of {@dice 1d6}).

entries.name: Spells
entries: The weapon has 4 charges to cast spells. As long as are attuned and holding it in your hand, you can cast {@spell Detect Magic|Ishiir} (1 charge), {@spell Detect Evil and Good|Ishiir} (1 charge), or {@spell Detect Thoughts|Ishiir} (2 charges). Each night at midnight, the weapon regains {@dice 1d4} expended charges.

entries.name: Wounding
entries: While you are attuned to the weapon, any creature that you hit it can't regain hit points for 1 minute. The target can make a DC 15 Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} at the end of each of its turns, ending this effect early on a success.

item.name: Serpent's Herald
item.reqAttune: by a creature that worships the god Gargan
entries: {@i Requirement: Piercing Weapons.}
You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with the weapon. If you score a critical hit with it, the target takes an extra {@damage 6d8} thunder damage.

The weapon has 3 charges. While you carry it, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} and expend 1 charge to cast {@spell Dominate Beast|Ishiir} (save DC 20) from it on a beast that has an innate {@variantrule Swim Speed|Ishiir}. The weapon regains {@dice 1d3} expended charges daily at dawn.

The weapon also warns you of danger. While the weapon is on your person, you have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on initiative rolls. In addition, you and any of your companions within 30 feet of you can't be surprised, except when {@condition Incapacitated|Ishiir} by something other than nonmagical sleep. The weapon magically awakens you and your companions within range if any of you are sleeping naturally when combat begins.

While holding this weapon, you can speak its command word as an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to create a bubble of air around your head. It allows you to breathe normally underwater. This bubble stays with you until you speak the command word again, you're no longer holding the weapon, or you are no longer underwater.

item.name: Abysswalker
entries: {@i Requirement: Weapons.}
You can speak, read, and write Abyssal, Elvish, and Undercommon.

You have {@sense darkvision} out to a range of 60 feet. If you already have {@sense darkvision}, being attuned to the weapon increases the range of your {@sense darkvision} by 60 feet. Magical darkness doesn't impede your {@sense darkvision}.
You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with the weapon.

You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to cause poison to coat the weapon. The poison remains for 1 minute or until an attack using this weapon hits a creature. That creature must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or become {@condition Poisoned|Ishiir} for 1 hour. If the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} fails by 5 or more, the creature is also {@condition Unconscious|Ishiir} while {@condition Poisoned|Ishiir} in this way. The creature wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature uses its action to shake the creature awake.

While carrying the weapon, you can move up, down, and across vertical surfaces and upside down along ceilings, while leaving your hands free. You have a {@variantrule Climb Speed|Ishiir} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir}. Additionally, you can't be caught in webs of any sort and can move through webs as if they were {@quickref difficult terrain||3}.

While holding the weapon, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to cast one of the following spells from it (save DC 17): {@spell Cloudkill|Ishiir}, {@spell Darkness|Ishiir}, {@spell Levitate|Ishiir}, or {@spell Web|Ishiir}. Once a spell has been cast using the weapon, that spell can't be cast from the weapon again until the next dawn.

While holding the weapon in dim light or darkness, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space you can see that is also in dim light or darkness. This property can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Fortune's Favor
entries: {@i Requirement: Piercing/Slashing Weapons.}
You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with the weapon. While the weapon is on your person, you also gain a +1 bonus to {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws}.

entries.name: Luck
entries: If the weapon is on your person, you can call on its luck (no action required) to reroll one {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir}, {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir}, or {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} you dislike. You must use the second roll. This property can't be used again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Wish
entries: The weapon has {@dice 1d4 - 1} charges. While holding it, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to expend 1 charge and cast the {@spell Wish|Ishiir} spell from it. This property can't be used again until the next dawn. The weapon loses this property if it has no charges.

item.name: Starsong Blade
item.reqAttune: by a creature that has psionic ability
entries: {@i Requirement: Slashing Weapons.}

The weapon grants a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. While you hold the sword, you have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws}, you are {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir|Immune} to being {@condition Charmed|Ishiir}, and you have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to psychic damage. In addition, if you score a critical hit with it against a creature's astral body, you can cut the silvery cord that tethers the target to its material body, instead of dealing damage.

item.name: Dragonsoul
entries: {@i Requirement: Weapons.}
You can speak, read, and write Draconic and Infernal.
You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with the weapon.
While carrying the weapon, you have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to acid, cold, fire, lightning, and poison damage.

As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} while holding the weapon, you can cause the following effect: each creature of your choice that is within 30 feet of you and is aware of you must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or become {@condition Frightened|Ishiir} of you for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir|Immune} to your Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours. This property can't be used again until the next dawn.

While holding the weapon, you can use your action to exhale destructive energy. Pick a damage type from the Dragonsoul Breath Weapons table. Each creature in the area of the exhalation must make a DC 17 {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, the type of which is specified in the table. A creature takes {@damage 5d6} damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

item.name: Agony's Embrace
entries: {@i Requirement: Melee Weapons.}
You can speak, read, and write Infernal.
You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with the weapon.

While holding the weapon, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to cast one of the following spells from it (save DC 17): {@spell Charm Person|Ishiir}, {@spell Dominate Person|Ishiir}, {@spell Fear|Ishiir}, or {@spell Dominate Monster|Ishiir}. Once a spell has been cast using the weapon, that spell can't be cast from it again until the next dawn.
While holding the weapon, you have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on Charisma ({@skill Intimidation}) {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks}.

When you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with an attack using the weapon, you can cause the following effect: each creature of your choice within 15 feet of you must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or be {@condition Frightened|Ishiir} of you until the end of your next turn. This property can't be used again until the next dawn.
When a creature hits you with a melee attack, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to deal {@damage 2d6} psychic damage to the attacker.

item.name: Blackfyre Harbinger
entries: {@i Requirement: Melee Weapons.}
You can speak, read, and write Infernal.
You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with the weapon.

While holding the weapon, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to speak its Infernal command word, causing flames to erupt from the head. These flames shed bright light in a 40-foot radius and dim light for an additional 40 feet. While the weapon is ablaze, it deals an extra {@damage 3d6} radiant damage to any target it hits. Radiant damage dealt by the weapon ignores {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to radiant damage. The flames last until you use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to speak the command word again or until you are no longer holding the weapon.

While holding the weapon, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to summon an {@creature imp}, a {@creature bearded devil} or a {@creature barbed devil}. Any devil you summon with this weapon is friendly to you and your companions for the duration. The imp obeys any verbal commands that you issue to it and returns to the Nine Hells 10 minutes after you summoned it. This property can't be used again until the next dawn.
You have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to radiant and necrotic damage while holding this weapon.

item.name: Dragon's Wrath
entries: {@i Requirement: Melee Weapons.}
When this property is applied to a weapon, choose a dragon type.

Whenever you roll a 20 on your {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} with this weapon, each creature of your choice within 5 feet of the target takes 5 damage of the type dealt by the dragon's breath weapon.
You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made using the weapon. On a hit, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 3d6} damage of the type dealt by the dragon's breath weapon.

As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can unleash a 60-foot cone of destructive energy from the weapon. Each creature in that area must make a DC 18 Dexterity {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, taking {@damage 12d6} damage of the type dealt by the dragon's breath weapon on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Once this action is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Hand of Justice
entries: {@i Requirement: Melee Weapons.}

In the world of Greyhawk, only nine of these blades are known to exist. Each is patterned after the legendary sword Fragarach, which is variously translated as "Final Word." Each of the nine swords has its own name and alignment, and each bears a different gem in its pommel.
Answerer, the Chaotic Good sword, has an emerald set in its pommel.

You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this sword. In addition, while you hold the sword, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to make one melee attack with it against any creature in your reach that deals damage to you. You have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on the {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir}, and any damage dealt with this special attack ignores any damage {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir} or {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} the target has.

item.name: Entropy's Bite
entries: {@i Requirement: Slashing/Piercing Melee Weapons.}
You can speak, read, and write Abyssal and Draconic.
You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with the weapon.

You can attempt to poison any creature that is hit by the weapon. The creature must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or suffer the effect of one of the following poisons of your choice; once a poison other than Serpent Venom has been used, that poison can't be used again until the next dawn:

items.name: Dead Eyes
items.entry: A creature that fails the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against this poison is {@condition Poisoned|Ishiir} for 1 hour. While {@condition Poisoned|Ishiir} in this way, the creature is {@condition Blinded|Ishiir}.

items.name: Serpent Venom
items.entry: A creature that fails the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against this poison takes {@damage 3d6} poison damage, or half as much damage on a successful save.

items.name: Ghoul's Blood
items.entry: A creature that fails the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against this poison is {@condition Poisoned|Ishiir} for 1 minute. While {@condition Poisoned|Ishiir} in this way, the creature is {@condition Paralyzed|Ishiir}. The creature can repeat the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

items.name: Cockatrice Tears
items.entry: A creature that fails the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against this poison begins to turn to stone and is {@condition Restrained|Ishiir}. It must repeat the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the creature is {@condition Petrified|Ishiir} for 24 hours.

item.name: Dark Queen's Reach
entries: {@i Requirement: Melee Weapons.}

entries.name: Weapon of the Dead
entries: Erebos's weapon seethes with the enervating energy of the Underworld. The weapon grants a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. When you hit with an attack using this weapon, the target takes an extra {@damage 2d8} necrotic damage and you regain hit points equal to half the amount of necrotic damage dealt.
Additionally, when you make an attack with the weapon on your turn, you can increase the range of the attack to 300 feet. This property of the weapon can't be used again until the next dusk.

entries.name: Erebos's Claim
entries: While carrying the weapon, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to cast either {@spell Circle of Death|Ishiir} or {@spell Dominate Monster|Ishiir} (targeting only undead) from the weapon. The save DC for these spells is 18. Once you use the weapon to cast a spell, that spell can't be cast from it again until the next dusk.

item.name: Worldsplitter
entries: {@i Requirement: Bludgeoning Weapons.}
You can speak, read, and write Abyssal and Infernal.

You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with the weapon. When you hit with an attack using this weapon, you can deal an extra {@damage 2d6} bludgeoning damage to the target. If you do, you take {@damage 1d6} psychic damage. The weapon deals double damage to objects and structures.
While holding this weapon, you have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks} made to discern a lie spoken in a language you understand.

You gain a {@variantrule Burrow Speed|Ishiir} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir}. You can use your {@variantrule Burrow Speed|Ishiir} to move through sand, loose earth, mud, or ice, not solid rock.

When a creature you can see within 30 feet of you hits you with an attack while you are wielding the weapon, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to deal an amount of psychic damage to that creature equal to the damage you took from the attack. This property can't be used again until the next dawn.

When you have fewer hit points than half your hit point maximum, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 2d6} bludgeoning damage on a hit. You can burrow through solid rock at half your {@variantrule Burrow Speed|Ishiir} and leave a 5-foot-diameter tunnel in your wake.

As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can use the weapon to cast one of the following spells from it (save DC 17): {@spell Earthquake|Ishiir}, {@spell Meld into Stone|Ishiir}, or {@spell Stone Shape|Ishiir}. Once a spell has been cast using the weapon, that spell can't be cast from the weapon again until the next dawn.

item.name: Holy Avenger
entries: {@i Requirement: Melee Weapons.}
You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with the weapon. When you hit a fiend or an undead with it, that creature takes an extra {@dice 2d10} radiant damage.

While you hold the weapon, it creates an aura in a 10-foot radius around you. You and all creatures friendly to you in the aura have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} against spells and other magical effects. If you have 17 or more levels in the paladin class, the radius of the aura increases to 30 feet.

item.name: Forgefire
entries: {@i Requirement: Bludgeoning Melee Weapons.}

entries.name: Weapon of the Forge
entries: The weapon grants a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. When you hit with an attack using it, the target takes an extra {@damage 3d10} fire damage.

entries.name: Reforged
entries: While holding the weapon, you have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to fire damage and are {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir|Immune} to {@condition Exhaustion|Ishiir}. Additionally, you have {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} with {@item armorsmith's tools|Ishiir} and {@item weaponsmith's tools|Ishiir}, and have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on all {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|Ability Checks} made using them.

entries.name: Spells
entries: While the weapon is on your person, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to cast one of the following spells (save DC 18): {@spell Animate Objects|Ishiir}, {@spell Heat Metal|Ishiir}, {@spell Fabricate|Ishiir}, {@spell Magic Weapon|Ishiir}, {@spell Mending|Ishiir}, {@spell Shatter|Ishiir}. Once you use the weapon to cast a spell, the spell can't be cast again from it until the next dusk.

item.name: Zenith
entries: {@i Requirement: Melee Weapons.}

entries.name: Attunement
entries: The weapon allows you to attune to it immediately, without having to take a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir}, and it gains a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls.

The first time you attune to the sword, you are transformed into a heavenly, idealized version of yourself, blessed with otherworldly beauty and a touch of heaven in your heart. Neither magic nor divine intervention can reverse this transformation. Your alignment becomes lawful good, and you gain the following traits:

items.name: Angelic Language
items.entry: You can speak, read, and write Celestial.

items.name: Celestial Resistance
items.entry: You have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to necrotic and radiant damage.

items.name: Divine Presence
items.entry: Your Charisma score becomes 20, unless it is already 20 or higher.

items.name: Feathered Wings
items.entry: You sprout a beautiful pair of feathered wings that grant you a {@variantrule Fly Speed|Ishiir} of 90 feet and the ability to hover. If you already have a different kind of wings, these new wings replace the old ones, which fall off.

items.name: Truesight
items.entry: Your eyes become luminous pools of silver. You can see in normal and magical darkness, see {@condition Invisible|Ishiir} creatures and objects, automatically detect visual illusions and succeed on {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} against them, perceive the original form of a shapechanger or a creature that is transformed by magic, and see into the Ethereal Plane, all within a range of 60 feet.

items.name: New Personality
entries: You gain new personality traits, determined by rolling once on each of the following tables. These traits override any conflicting personality trait, ideal, bond, or flaw.

entries.caption: Personality Traits
rows: I treat all beings, even enemies, with respect.
I enjoy sharing my philosophical worldview and experiences with others.
I cut right to the chase in every conversation.
I often quote (or misquote) religious texts.
I anger quickly when I witness cruelty or injustice.
My praise and trust are earned and never given freely.
I like everything clean and organized.

entries.caption: Ideals
rows: Charity. I always help those in need. (Good)
Faith. I choose to follow the tenets of a particular lawful good deity to the letter. (Lawful)
Responsibility. It is the duty of the strong to protect the weak. (Lawful)
Respect. All people deserve to be treated with dignity. (Good)
Honor. The way I conduct myself determines my reward in the afterlife. (Lawful)
Redemption. All creatures are capable of change for the better. (Good)

entries.caption: Bonds
rows: I have a favorite religious hymn that I constantly hum.
I must keep a written record of my beliefs and the sins that I witness. When finished, this book will be my gift to the multiverse.
I have cherished memories of Idyllglen, though I've only seen this bucolic town in dreams.
I would die for those who fight beside me, regardless of their faults.
I seek to honor the angel Zariel by destroying fiends and other evildoers wherever I find them.
The Sword of Zariel has chosen me. I shall not fail to wield it justly.

entries.caption: Flaws
rows: I am too quick to judge others.
I will sacrifice innocent lives for the greater good.
Flaw? What flaw? I am flawless. Utter perfection!
I allow nothing to stand in the way of my crusade to eradicate evil from the multiverse.
I ignore those who do not support my plans, for my calling is higher than all others.

entries.name: Holy Light
entries: The weapon sheds bright light in a 5-foot radius and dim light for an additional 5 feet. Fiends find the sword's light disconcerting and painful, even if they can't see it, and have {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} made within the weapon's radius of bright light.

As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can intensify the sword's light, causing it to shed bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 15 feet, or reduce its glow to its normal intensity.

entries.name: Random Properties
entries: The sword has 2 {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Beneficial Properties|dmg|minor beneficial properties}.

entries.name: Searing Radiance
entries: The sword deals an extra {@damage 2d8} radiant damage to any creature it hits, or {@damage 3d10} radiant damage if you're wielding the weapon with two hands. An evil creature that takes this radiant damage must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or be {@condition Blinded|Ishiir} until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Truth Seer
entries: While holding the sword, you gain {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on all Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks}.

item.name: Wrath of the Ancients
entries: {@i Requirement: Melee Weapons.}

You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon. When you hit with an {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} using it, the target takes an extra {@damage 5d4} damage of your choice of one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison.

While holding the weapon, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} and speak a command word to cause the heads to breathe multicolored flames in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 18 Dexterity {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. On a failed save, it takes {@damage 14d6} damage of one of the following damage types (your choice): acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage. Once this action is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Cycle's End
item.reqAttune: by a creature of non-lawful alignment
entries: {@i Requirement: Slashing/Piercing Melee Weapons.}
You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with the weapon. It has the following additional properties.

entries.name: Devour Soul
entries: Whenever you use it to reduce a creature to 0 hit points, the sword slays the creature and devours its soul, unless it is a construct or an undead. A creature whose soul has been devoured can be restored to life only by a {@spell Wish|Ishiir} spell.

When it devours a soul, the weapon grants you temporary hit points equal to the slain creature's hit point maximum. These hit points fade after 24 hours. As long as these temporary hit points last and you keep the weapon in hand, you have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls}, {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws}, and {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|Ability Checks}.

If you hit an undead with this weapon, you take {@damage 1d10} necrotic damage and the target regains {@dice 1d10} hit points. If this necrotic damage reduces you to 0 hit points, it devours your soul.

entries.name: Soul Hunter
entries: While you hold the weapon. you are aware of the presence of Tiny or larger creatures within 60 feet of you that aren't constructs or undead. You also can't be {@condition Charmed|Ishiir} or {@condition Frightened|Ishiir}.
You can cast the {@spell Haste|Ishiir} spell once per day using this weapon and you don't maintain {@condition Concentration|Ishiir} on it.

itemGroup.name: Potion of Resistance
items: Potion of Acid Resistance|Ishiir
Potion of Cold Resistance|Ishiir
Potion of Fire Resistance|Ishiir
Potion of Force Resistance|Ishiir
Potion of Lightning Resistance|Ishiir
Potion of Necrotic Resistance|Ishiir
Potion of Poison Resistance|Ishiir
Potion of Psychic Resistance|Ishiir
Potion of Radiant Resistance|Ishiir
Potion of Thunder Resistance|Ishiir
